1ZEr3AjJjCo217SohkOeFg.text: 4/5 stars because the service was slow. Had dinner on a Friday night, wasn't very busy. A lot of empty tables. The hostess did accommodate my friends and I, as we were late to meeting the rest of our party.  Food was pricey, but quality and portions definitely made it worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Miso salmon.

dI12SKpyUa3lBHsaQZCeHQ.text: Ocean One was fairly empty when we arrived. We thought it would be great to have attentive service.  We thought wrong.  Our drinks came after our entrees and had to wait for our server to come around to get another drink.  Also, when we sat down, the people next to us left. The table remained uncleaned until we received our entrees.  The food was mediocre at best. On the plus side they had a buy one get three drink special. Cheers!

6T4ajJeLaJwYfU3MZuPZqA.text: Awesome for breakfast and affordable. Came here with my girlfriends basically everyday on our Vegas trip last year. Back here with my significant other and it's still good. $5.99 breakfast specials with 2 for $10 mimosas. I love it. The poached eggs are amazing. Def worth the walk from the mirage!!!

dwn-5OK3NQJoyTJqkguiTg.text: Compliments to the chef.  Both I and my friend ordered steaks and they were done to perfection.  Reasonably priced and nice staff. Well done Ocean One.

Zwad8zKQqEa5tytaocIJCQ.text: My two friends and I tried this place for breakfast one morning.  I have to say it has a nice atmosphere with the open windows and pretty fish tank above the bar.  I liked the look of the place but that was all I was going to get that day.  Once we were seated it took forever for our very unenthusiastic server to acknowledge us.  Drinks came 10 minutes later.  I cant forget to mention that they served the creamer to our coffee in a gravy boat...HAHA, really?  All I can say is the food is not worth the wait.  There was nothing wrong with it for us....it just took an hour to actually get to us.  Mind you, the restaurant was half empty.  Not once did the server check on us...he actually disappeared for a bit.  Someone else was nice enough to refill our water and coffee.    And after we sat at an empty table for 20 minutes, asked a bus boy, asked a server, and asked our own server twice did we actually get a check.   Not impressed with this Vegas breakfast at all - room service would have been better...

wALV1ZQWHfUQCzX9jtQepw.text: It was OK. We went for the $5.99 lunch special. Good deal, right? Kinda...  I got the Chicken Wrap with fries. The lady got the chicken breast with mashed potatoes and vegetables.   The chicken wrap tasted like it was drenched in Tapatio... Not so great. I'm not that picky but I had a hard time finishing it.   The chicken breast was good though. No complaints. Not much flavor, but still good.   Service was what you'd expect for lunch time. I'm not big on service, so no complaints.   I can't really complain since it was under $13 after tax for two in Vegas. Probably won't be back, but hey... No regrets.

f9e_RiF8Z__H7tLEwZ2ohA.text: Glad I had the Restaurant.com coupon ($25 off $50) or I'd be upset about our dinner. Our waitress must be the only person on the planet who couldn't understand that the spinach/artichoke dip should come out 1st: the salad, 2nd; and our entrees 3rd. Salad & entree were served simultaneously, along with the question "do you want me to hold the entrees under the heat lamp for ya'?" Sounds delightful, right?!? After both the salad and the entrees were done, she then asked if we wanted some more salsa for the leftover chips from our dip. Strange! Our empty bottle of Pellegrino sat on our table most of dinner & we were never offered (to pay for) an additional bottle. The food & coupon got Ocean One the 2-stars... the service was a 0.

wKbiWFli_qx6QzfMyvfqvg.text: 1 star is to much for this place!!    We ate on a Wednesday night and the place was empty.  The staff were more concerned with watching TV than serving.  We were a table of 3 and the food came out quickly and cold.  The fish was bland, the pasta greasy and the chicken dry.  Our waitress attempted to upsell us on the 2 for 1 drink special, which, when queried on our part was finally explained as we could buy a 2nd drink for the same price as the first (so it's not free!) and get it in a plastic kids to go cup ?!?  An automatic 18% gratuity was added to the bill for our party of 3.   The place is a disgrace - poor service, terrible food, bad attitudes, hidden costs etc etc.  With all the other great choices in Vegas, give this place a wide berth on your way through the Miracle Mile and spend your money anywhere but here.

yPp_DrZsKiAYXGQYiv6FyQ.text: Where do I begin.  The food was okay. But that's not what got me to write this review.    Watch your bill CAREFULLY!  Forgot the dude's name but our shady punk server (name started with a "K") tried to slip one past us by charging $2 for hot water (called Flavor Shot on the receipt), and conveniently including gratuity for a party of three!!!    What happened was, I handed him my credit card thinking the bill was a bit high, but decided to check the receipt after.  When he brings my credit card receipt, the itemized bill magically disappears.  I ask for the receipt and find the $2 charge for hot water and gratuity has been automatically included.  His explanation was that when you order more than 6 total items, the computer reads it as being a party of six.  REALLY??? STFU, right???  Asked for the manager, and literally about 10 min. later, some jackass working the bar, is supposed to be the supervisor.  Just the same unapologetic ass pretending to be the manager, with the same sorry excuses.    Long story short, had him redo my bill and forgot to tip him.  So here's a tip: "Don't try to screw over your customers, scumbag!"

w1yicenr7jmXVQdWze64fQ.text: Most the other reviewers are right. The food is pretty bad, but at least there's a wide range of dishes.  If you're part of one of those groups where everyone likes something different, liquor the crew up (or whatever else you need to do) and head here to order from a wide selection of seafood/meat/starch options.  Feeling generous. 3 stars.

h3COLWVcmydrabsLgkszGw.text: While staying at the Elara last weekend, I found this restaurant to be a good place for brunch - both days I was there - with good food and attentive service. Gotta stick with what works for you. I am never in the mood to stand in line for the typical Vegas buffet troughs!

rOnw0YnnwP-vtB_amVWykA.text: We found the food to be very good. I ordered pasta with chicken - problem was there was hardly any chicken - 7 small chicken cubes about 5/8". I told the server and he brought me an entire plate of chicken - about 5 times was in the original dish! My wife had the tilapia and it was very good.   Be aware, they will add 18% to your bill. Of course you can reject it, but our waitress was so good, I decided to leave it.  I just resent their presumption.

1Mu4s8rlyYQi6UEYtzNqyg.text: My fiance and I stopped here for a light lunch before heading to the airport. They had a 3 for $10 cocktail special, can't beat that! We had margaritas, and they were actually pretty strong so the waiter was nice enough to put the remaining drinks in a to go cup. As for the food, I just ordered the chicken caesar salad, which was not that great. The chicken was flavorless and the dressing didn't taste homemade. I shouldn't complain though, the lunch items were only $4.99! My fiance ordered the mahi sandwich, he said the mahi was great and the bread was so-so. Overall, not bad at all and great prices!

d36KFtTT_wmHfutz0pUR5w.text: The $5.99 lunch specials is what reeled us into Ocean One. The quality is average, but the prices are affordable.  I was craving a burger, which wasn't so bad. A little dry, but it satisfied my craving enough. If you want to order off the $5.99 lunch menu, I would recommend the Blackened Tilapia. My cousin ordered it and it was pretty good for the price. I'll be sure to order it next time I go here.  I wouldn't recommend the Ahi Tuna Wrap, which is on the regular menu. I believe it was about $10. My cousin ordered this the second time we came here and after telling me she didn't like it, I took a bite and it wasn't very tasty. There was too much wasabi, and it just wasn't good in general, which is surprising because I love ahi tuna.  The service is ok. It took a while to get us seated, but our server was friendly.

SZpWbhOjKDFRl4p3cXx34w.text: Worst experience in Vegas.  We had to grab place settings off of an empty tables as we were never given any.  Had to get the high chair myself as they never brought.  Our waitress saw me grab the high chair with my child in my hand and she asked what was I doing with the high chair?  Really???  I ordered a sirloin cheeseburger with no bacon but all of the fixings.  My burger shows up with cheese and bacon and none of fixings.  Also when the waitress came instead apologizing she goes oh that was my bad.  Again really???  Never did they ask how I wanted my burger which was bone dry.  I ordered a kids burger with cheese for my son and they charged me for a full priced burger.  Not only did they completely fumble everything with poor food, poor service they overcharged me and our server had the nerve to ask if we needed our change.  0 stars and I hope they contact me regarding this review.

2kE5e01VN8le_tHUmFb2Cg.text: Had brunch on 9/2. I ordered pasta, I think it was a bit too salty. My husband ordered steak and egg. Not bad for the price. The server was really nice and helpful.

c5wFwtRua8z79Uvg6fLGtA.text: based on the reviews we were really hesitant, BUT I was hungry & my feet hurt & I really just wanted to sit, so we took the chance.  I figured if it was bad, it's $6 in Vegas... we've 'donated' way more than that so no biggie! lol... we had the chicken Caesar & Asian wings.  I thought both were pretty good.  I would go back for those... we didn't order anything else so not sure how the other food is but the service was ok too.  the place is clean and inviting.  I'd go back for a cheap quick lunch ;)

VTxhDpOim7RspctFNHbVIA.text: You can't expect much given the prices on the menu, so I would say that Ocean meets expectations.  Food is ok, a good value but obviously pretty average taste and quality.    I've been here before for breakfast and remember their omelets being pretty decent (although accompanied by greasy potatoes).  For lunch, I've tried the salmon salad with orange dressing and penne pasta - both good, but unremarkable.  Service could be better.  In addition to being painfully slow (30+ minutes to get our food), my friend tried to substitute a side salad for his fries.  The waitress said this couldn't be done (odd enough), but that she could bring him a separate side salad.  The side salad turned out to be a full-sized salad and was billed individually at more than the price of the sandwich he ordered.  When he inquired, she said there was nothing she could do because the salad "was no longer at the table".  Was weird more than anything else.  I wouldn't discourage someone looking for a quick, cheap meal from eating here, and might go back again one day when the line at Earl of Sandwich is long...

siu9bpGw21lWRwXaEYiFsg.text: Dont bother for breakfast.  Omelette is OK, potatoes OK, toast with omelette is one slice with no butter and no jam.  French Toast is what you could make at home...two slices of packaged bread dipped in egg and fried.

19RTVCjgbuymIGeSdT5MOA.text: Can I say WOW?! I love this place!! I always order online since I work at Planet Hollywood and can get one lunch entree for $4.32 INCLUDING TAX! I love this place so much. The service is always great and I love their amazing lunch options. My favorite place to eat!

PKJgq__GZ3ZDF80hgZmTUw.text: My husband and I decided to go out late.  We were trying to find somewhere to have dinner on the strip around 10pm.  Everywhere had a crazy line!  We walked from The Paris to Planet Hollywood into PH Shops.  Because we were sick of walking and were past hungry, we decided to try this place.  Not the best selection ever but we ordered a petite filet, medium with garlic mashed potatoes.  I had really low expectations going in...Surprisingly good!  Meat was tender, cooked to our order, nice portion size. The potatoes were good...the veggies under the steak and potatoes were kind of random....overall, good food.  The server was good...checked on us often enough.  Wine special for between $6-7...I had a glass of white wine.  Nothing to write home about but wasn't horrible either.  They also have a full bar.  Prices were right in the middle...not cheap late night but not very expensive either.    The thing I thought needed the most work is the decor.  Probably a couple years ago, this place probably looked really nice.  However, it's gotten run down.  The wood floors are ruined and were clearly never taken care of.  The booth seats are run down and torn.  Maybe this restaurant was forgotten about during the Aladdin-Planet Hollywood renovation!  I've seen it before while shopping at PH and never went in.  We were happy with the meal we had there but probably won't make a point to go back.

xJ_z54Ih7F1ODsoH0yKvaQ.text: We were looking for a place for breakfast, and we stumbled upon this gem!!  Great food AND prices on the Strip?!?!?  Don't miss it!!  Will definitely be back on our next trip!!

34fuPSoTZbH-EbaYTk0uzA.text: Try this place for lunch and was very impressed. It was so good we came back for our evening meal. Great service incredible value for money!

jiV6hSOLMuv5aat64sPh6Q.text: Food is good for the price, very cheap though. They have good drink specials. Service is slow. This place is well located close to many shops.

o3EmyGRkWJ9Ew2NTH53MUw.text: We came here 2 nights in a row!!! It was great! Great food! Amazing prices and the server named Manny was so sweet with our kids.  We loved it! We will come back again soon hopefully

SY7e75H59CqXmgpWcEYDfw.text: Great food and location if you sit on the patio. Prices are reasonable for Strip. We will definitely be back next time in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the candle on the table

s0Da5glPnlXZEzlrdcc3aA.text: The food taste like frozen food .  Toast was really stale. Trying you don't mind expensive frozen food. Don't recommend it.

yD9lPlfOSU9HYhWFjGb9HA.text: Hidden gem.  Great service.  $5 lunch menu- everything and $ draft beers.  Food was excellent - grilled chicken club sandwich with fries. - perfectly cooked and served hot.  $15+ at comparable places and more at the hotels.  Highly recommend for the out of towners.

RwiZylZ5PZit1LAtwYABfQ.text: Food was delicious great prices but there was 1 server to cover 6 tables so it took forever to get the servers attention

YIgbx9UkPF4AJyWQNKUjRg.text: First time here with boyfriend and man the food was really yummy!! We got seated immediately when we arrived without a wait and the hostess was very friendly. The 3 stars are for the service though, the waiter was non-existent. We only saw him when he dropped off 2 waters at the table and then to take our order, and we didn't see him at all after that... I think the manager dropped off our bill.  Delicious food though!!

SIwTvTP7PlVd5jpiTDSxrA.text: Decent food (salmon).  But the atmosphere and service are lacking.  Better options in the area.

8MdgAM0NokCiLInVf4PWvQ.text: Nope nope nope!!! Not a fan!  A meal is an important tell tale of the way the rest of your day is going to go. Unfortunately for this place, they didn't set a good tone! The menu was bland, nothing special. But that's ok, my sights were not set so high! However... as I've mentioned in reviews before. I'm diabetic, and to have sugar free items is not mandatory, but it's nice! Especially when it's something as easy as sugar free syrup, which is even carried by your local Denny's!!! So this is the way we started! Not on a good foot! Let's hope breakfast is great! NOPE! The biscuit gravy tasted canned, the biscuit itself was Pillsbury... my dining companions were not impressed either, they just felt it was eh!  The only one plus! In a town of Pepsi products, my wife was excited to get a Diet Coke!  Other than that, this place falls flat! However the good news is, we will be back tomorrow! Only we will be going to the restaurant across the hall. When I asked them in my way out about sugar free syrup, their answer was, OF COURSE WE DO!!!

QDGwDK9yhKOd1qCyV66YJA.text: We had the best experience with our server Stefan along with great priced drinks in the three for one cocktails and 4.99 flank steak and 4.99 salmon dish.  Very taste! We will definitely come back when we are back in Las Vegas!

1x1KHIejlxrdGALOzbCCLQ.text: So far, I have enjoyed the chicken caesar...very good. The omelet I tried was also very nice. Skirt steak is yummy too! However, the burger is nothing special...but the price is great for the strip. Bartenders are always pleasant when I go there. Will be back again for sure.

KvGRy6jhgkI_fbgEr_xsxg.text: Can't say enough good things about this little beauty. 3 for 1 cocktails. Damn good cocktails too. Service is great. Food is good. What more could you ask for?  Cajun pasta alfredo. Not too spicy a ton of chicken.  The only improvement was the piece of bread that was drier than a crouton.  I didn't need it anyway.

lPtA2GcK0Q8V--_a1ztNWw.text: The food is very good for 5$ the steak was delicious and the Caribbean mahi mahi sounded very good too.

qNa3A2FTNe_g9TsqWx0_eA.text: Famous Simple pros and cons! No babble!  Pros: Great location if at PH Great dinner prices - as cheap as $9 Delicious food for the price  Brick oven pizza and calimari were fantastic Not greecy, not salty, pretty healthy Great fast service Great for dates - nice decor Every hour see lightning from the patio  Cons - honestly none that I can see.  Side note to 1 or 2 star folks - if you expect $100 ass kissing food and service at $15 prices then go to some french sissy restaurant and dont complain.

lpVS77-r6jHzbif0v0Rkrg.text: Well... I'm not a total food snob, but as we said after we ate "you get what you pay for".  The cheap drinks are a plus, especially for the strip. But literally, the food is just... edible. If you're hung over and just want a Bloody Mary (which was just ok, don't have high expectations there please, I'm pretty sure it was V8 and a splash of Kirkland vodka) and some cheap, greasy eggs and potatoes, this is your place.  On the plus side, our party of 6 got out of there for like $60 so that's something!

FSTz84J5gf40bFiLdY0DNA.text: The food is amazing, the service is awful. It's really too bad they couldn't get both figured out...

_Gg3T6EMwvMQLU38ERWbKg.text: Staying at Planet Hollywood and killing time until my room was ready, I roamed the mall. Normally not drawn to cheap eats, their sign for 3-1 cocktails made me curious. How decent could that be in extremely expensive Vegas? Turns out I was very pleasantly surprised! I had two cocktails and a ( small ) glass of wine for $10. ( I'm not a complete lush- you can take one to-go). And the lunch Marinated Flank steak ( $4.99) was perfectly medium- rare., served with perfectly tender/ crisp vegetables with a cabernet sauce. We are foodies and this was actually very good! Service at the bar was very attentive. Highly recommend as a great value for lunch!

hqD84sAR_ljNhPGX41lPBA.text: The Hot Wings and salad were great, and the service at the bar was wonderful. Stay away from the calamari if you like it crispy.

R3zWTFuwbf2XE-_rmZPZlQ.text: I heard about this place on Yelp when I was bookmarking some new spots for my upcoming trip and stumbled across mixed reviews about slow service, $4.99 Lunch deals, and mediocre food. Well let's talk about those:   So first things first - yes the food is $4.99 from 11-5p / I was in shock too, I know. The entire food menu is priced very inexpensively yet the quality of food offered and the portion size makes you wonder why it's so cheap. We were so puzzled about it, we asked our waitress Maria H. (I'll come back to her later) - and she said that honestly the owner just likes it that way. For dinner time though, the price goes up to about $10.99 which still isn't bad for a restaurant literally in the middle of the strip. **Also drinkers - they offer a 3 for $10 deal all day long. These drinks are regular sized, pretty strong and very good. They also offer other drinks that are super cheap and range from $3 - $10.   The food isn't mediocre at all. For $4.99 you would think the restaurant only served chicken strips, fries, and nuggets but the menu is actually pretty extensive and covers a good variety of choices.   Our server Maria H. was literally amazing. We met her on our first visit to the restaurant and asked for her each day that we came back. She was nice, personable, patient and her customer service was IMPECCABLE. She greeted us and treated us like her own family even when she wasn't serving us. SHE DESERVES A RAISE! SERIOUSLY - THE BEST WAITRESS WE'VE EVER HAD.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ocean One Wings
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Three Cheese Quesadilla
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Calamari Classic Style

Eql1mdAG6qxcOIq9cAR1ww.text: We came here for lunch today because yesterday the place always had a line outside no matter when we walked by. The only reason for the line is the price point. It's cheap, but the food is mediocre at best. The service is slow. We won't be back

4qQYUB54UPqmV3oQMcjIfg.text: Can't beat $4.99 lunch plates!  Tuna tartare- fresh avocado and tuna, although the tuna pieces were small  Ocean one wings- came w/ 8! Lots of meat on the lollipops. Good char  Grilled salmon w/ mashed potatoes- fresh, cooked well. Mashed potatoes were good! Can't ever get salmon for this cheap, it was at least 5 oz.   Orechiette pasta- tasty, small pieces of chicken. Big portion.   Molten lava cake w/ vanilla ice cream- warm, moist, and lots of lava chocolate, mmmm. Just as good as fancy restaurants  All of it was good, especially the wings, pasta, and cake! Waited ~10 minutes before noon on a Saturday to get seated. Service was friendly but a bit slow. Took only 10 minutes for the food to come out surprisingly :)

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wings, lava cake, and orecchiette pasta were the best although they were all great, especially for $4.99
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not the complete lunch menu

spHA75end6dBC5Z_ZIXUFw.text: This has to be the best bargain in all Las Vegas.  I had 3 high quality, very delicious mahi fish tacos for $4.99.  My bottle of beer was $3.  The food here is outstanding along with THE lowest prices in the valley. It is worth the trip to come here

8mQjy0oyXqAlNRTzXDgHCw.text: Me and my family have the worst and horrible experience ever at this place. We were sitting next to a person that found a live cockroach on her food. Of course we stop eating, some how I guess they call Health Department which they show up right away and guess what, they shutdown the place, we don't know what  they found in the kitchen, I don't even want to know we just pay and get out of this place, we are here for a week we just pass by and guess what they are open like nothing happens I guess this the factor of a city with a tourist people coming from out of Vegas who cares if someone get even poisoned or if you die tomorrow more tourists will come and they can keep business running like no one care

s9_I5RaId0CZyz2wFd8Cgw.text: By far the worst chicken Marsala I have ever had . Very simple dish and they pretty much failed on everything . The sauce was horrible and tasted like it has been lying in a can for 6 months . The chicken was not cooked properly and the the other ingredients were far below avg. only in Vegas can I crap dish on this level pass as food..back in Chicago this place would be out of business.  It's like a bunch of Middle school kids put this together after watching Sesame Street. A TV dinner would have been a huge upgrade

hxgqAO6tM_xaj_c8vud38g.text: This was a huge disappointment I very rarely will go out of my way to rate something I never had the chance to even try but the experience we had here last night is enough for me to feel the need to post this review.  We are staying pretty much across from the entrance to where this restaurant is located and we were looking for something to eat and wanted a place just to relax and enjoy the rest of our evening we walked around looking at menus and settles on this because they have a very extensive menu with so many choices and the people who were already seated and eating looked like they were enjoying.  We were seated right away the restaurant looked full but not packed so we waited patiently looking at the menu 10 minutes went by and we had settled on the drink and the meal, a couple was set right next to us and their waitress came took the drink order and had come back with their drinks ( this is now 15min) my husband walks from the back of the restaurant to the front to ask the hostess if our server knew we were there, she apologized and went to find our server.  Another 4 min the other server comes with water and lets us know our server would be right with us, he never came.  We did leave within minutes of that interaction very very hungry and very disappointed

Hftm2ivZ-dRSoFv7Bzq0VA.text: Vegas can be expensive so I'm always on the look out for good deals and specials. The wait for a table at Ocean One can be a little long depending on what time you go but I say it's worth it.   We were there in a group of 6 and they were pretty busy so service was just okay. Same with the food. It was perfectly edible, tasted fine, and the portions were a decent size, but that was about it. It was fine. With all of the amazing food options in Las Vegas the meals here don't really come close. It's equivalent to diner food or food you'd find at a national breakfast chain.  The reason you go to Ocean One is for the drink special. 3 for $10 drinks all day every day. Tons of options to choose from, and the drinks we had you could DEFINITELY taste the alcohol. It always took a little while to get the drinks so don't expect to be in and out in a quick minute. The best part was that you can take your last drink to go. They'll give you a lid and send you on your way. So go for a meal, get two drinks there and one to go.   Ocean One is definitely a must visit on any trip to Vegas just to save a few bucks!

zWsDduHbi7RTmhlfAx2VrA.text: I wasn't sure you could find a cheap meal on the strip anymore and I was wrong. Welcome to Ocean One. They have lunch for $4.99 a plate! That to me is just insane.  So I walked in with the mindset that there was no way their food was going to be any good.  I was dead wrong. I got a good burger and fries and I left completely satisfied and my wallet wasn't empty.   If you want cheap, good food, this is your place to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

050oNdZzyrcgD84_1gGiWw.text: Lovely lunch menu for the price.  Great flank steak!  Boys had two orders each.  Worth the 15 minute wait.

vpZ-ZIk_IxChlRe59qU5Ug.text: Vianey is amazing! Quick service. They take care of your check asap. Food is bomb. All lunch items are 4.99. Cocktails are 3 for $10. Wonderful experience. Not a long wait for a table because they are so organized. We came yesterday and cam back today!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great waitress

3D8Xmhn1Mbq1YkbsDMr-JA.text: Pretty good! Nice to escape the heat and the over priced food on the strip sure it's not perfect but for $5 you want to be full and happy afterwards and we were. Frozen cocktails even with small amounts of alcohol are cold and refreshing. We would be back if we were staying longer!! Our server was lovely too.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish tacos
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon

qsdoZqMh3h4y9AuI3NnYcg.text: Went here for breakfast with a group of my friends.   Nothing special.   I ordered pancakes, scrambled eggs, sausage, toast, and fruit.   Their pancake was dry- I didn't even eat half of it.   Scrambled eggs, sausage, and toast were okay.   The fruit seemed a bit old.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DveVUPmjwZI15u4X0PjYhg.text: You cannot get a better deal anywhere in Las Vegas and especially on the Strip. The food is delicious. We came for lunch at 4.99 per dish. Got the salmon lunch and it is unbelievable. The wings are a must.  And to make things better, three upscale drinks for $10. We will be back.

ZNDpq19oY_4jIc-F44P0nQ.text: I have to thank the bell hop at the Elara Hilton Grand Vacations for suggesting Ocean One Bar and Grille. During our stay in Vegas we ended up eating there four times between sitting down in the restaurant and ordering to go each time they kept the same high standards. I have to give a shout out to our waiter Frank during our breakfast sit down experience he was simply fantastic, kind and very helpful. Hands down I have to say he was one of our top five servers I have come across since I starting writing these food reviews.  The atmosphere within the space was great, the food was fantastic and there food and drink deals were down right crazy! Three drinks for 10.00 and not any watered down drinks, no these were full on top shelf and amazing. My wife and I both had the steak and eggs meals which were only 13.00 each you just don't get deals like that everywhere, not with the food tasting so good, coupled with such great service. I would come back to eat at Ocean One Bar and Grille on my next trip to Las Vegas and would bring friends as well. This is truly a hidden gem if you want the most bang for you buck while in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Steak and Eggs Breakfast Meal.

34cvfRv2mJHyCC8G9R0OAQ.text: We went here twice for lunch. What a deal! Had the spaghetti and meatballs which was simple but tasty, and the calamari which was crispy and yummy. The second time we had the quesadillas (very good) and the tuna tartare (just ok). Portions were just right for lunch.   Their 3 for $10 drink special is a pretty good value too, though I opted for the mango and the margarita frozen drinks. Service was cheerful and quick. Will definitely visit again next time we are in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti and meatballs - lunch $4.99
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari - $4.99 lunch special

2VtazsE5fLqzl3nibwWlrA.text: Arrived 10 minutes before lunch and they did not seat us. Other than waiting for 10 minutes with ample seating available the food was pretty decent. My husband ordered the wings and they were tasty. I ordered a bun less burger to accommodate my Keto diet and it was satisfying. Fries was good, but the tacos and coke slaw was not up to par. The slaw tastes old and the tacos lacked flavor. All lunch items were 4.99 and they had a nice variety on the menu. Overall for a cheap lunch I would eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mahi Mahi tacos
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bunless burger with sautéed onions and blue cheese crumbles, French fries (which I didn&#39;t order) and coleslaw.
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ocean Eight wings (husband already ate some before I had a chance to take a picture).

ox_FqxnGpurzU7lDwYzKBw.text: There is a lot of selection in this place and the lunch was all 4.99. Had grilled salmon that comes with mashed potato and vegetable and tasted good. Their hamburger is angus beef and comes with a selection of sides. For our appetizers we had fried calamari and  spinach dip with chips. All in all everything was good and very cheap. Can't wait to be back.

bxSMtb_c_JtYbyz9n4qKKQ.text: So it looks like a cafeteria meets sports bar, but the price is better and the food is wayyy better! I had the Mahi sandwich and the wife had the salmon salad.  Wow! They were great for only $4.99 each.  Mixed drinks at 3 for $10 and draft beers at $3 each. Good deal! And near shopping and fun... who's NOT up for that???

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fGqOBAFnVKpZZikb_tvx1g.text: This is the easiest 5 star review I have ever posted on Yelp.My neighbor Jeff turned me on to this place.I have lived in Las Vegas for 35 years and remember the large amount of deals and discounts that used to be available in the bygone days.Imagine my surprise when I see lunch entrees for $4.99 and cocktails at 3 for $10.00.This is definitely a throwback to old Las Vegas and when you consider that this is a business on the Las Vegas Strip and not some place far off the beaten path that is offering these deals,that is even more amazing.I was quite satisfied with my meal and drinks and I will be singing my praises to all my friends and recommending this place.The $4.99 lunch entrees run from 12:00 pm to 5:00 pm(I think;double check just to be sure) and the 3 for $10.00 drinks are all day long.You cannot and will not go wrong with this place.

jDFUWRGm3WfP6DnFzCQYgQ.text: Unbeatable prices. The food is ok for the money but you will get the best value buying drinks. Can sometimes be a line to get in here but it's one of the cheapest places on the strip for a snack/drink.

x8O-7wR4GcuqHtwyDPG3KA.text: Got dead lettuce on my Mahi Mahi. Food is pretty bland. Prices are great for strip just wish food was better

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dead lettuce

JeyUt3YCb5qAo-hWRyrPAg.text: This place is seriously awful. Feel the plates when they come out: they're piping hot because they microwave everything, including the nachos. Have you ever had microwaved sour cream and guacamole? If you haven't, spoiler alert, it's disgusting.  Calamari was rubbery, and for some reason, they put the marinara sauce at the bottom of the plate and pile the calamari on top.  This place is best suited for drunk people and foreign visitors looking to buy American "food" on the cheap. I should have trusted my gut and walked away at the beginning, especially after asking the server what she enjoyed on the menu and her responding "everything".   3 for 1 drinks may sound like a deal, but you're in Vegas. There's cheap/free alcohol everywhere.

jnm59e0PbvpsBaCMUtwopA.text: Hidden gem and prices are great for Vegas. Must try this place for breakfast! We ordered the Spanish omelet and biscuits/gravy. Both did not disappoint. And I'm picky about my breakfast! Sabino was a very attentive server also, no complaints.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great prices, food and bloody marys!

lv9WALSd537YyqIipf8Ynw.text: MANAGEMENT IS RUDE AND SHOULD BE DEMOTED ASAP !This was a total disappointment and the manager this particular evening (Rufat)should NOT be in this position. I went with a group of friends for a birthday party. I am from Seattle mind you so what I'm about to explain make it that much worse. One of the waiters accidentally dropped a plate behind my party and the sauce and butter splashed all over the arm of my jacket which I had purchased only 1hr earlier. The manager was called by our waitress, who was lovely by the way and when I explained to him what happened he said to " take it to my in house dry cleaner and bring them the receipt to be reimbursed! So, he wanted me to pay to get my own jacket cleaned and also pay for a cab to come back and bring a receipt.....WOW ! What a rude jackass! Then when I explained I was not from here and would be flying out the next day this prick said" Well, nobody is"WTF! I'm not sure what qualifications are needed to become management at this establishment but I would not even hire that guy to sweep! I mean he didn't even offer a free drink or appetizer which wound not have solved the issue but it would have shown he understood that I would be spending money for cleaning when I get home so this could soften the blow. Word to the wise don't go here if you like being appreciated as a customer. Also, I didn't eat or drink at this establishment due to the incident. I also posted a pic of the table after I wiped my jacket on it !

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That is what came off my jacket after wiping it on the table a few times and it smells like seafood !

fSyUwDMmIndIsNxhp8zaQg.text: I ordered the crab cake and it was burnt on the bottom. I brought that to the waitress' attention and she tried to tell me that it's supposed to be that way. I couldn't even get me fork through it! Hubby ordered a burger done medium and it was well done. I asked for a manager and he said the crab cake was half eaten. I had spread it out on the plate after 2 bites.  I handed the manager the plate and told him I wasnt going to argue with him anymore!!! Definitely wouldn't go here again. We go to Las Vegas every year! If the food is bad they'll make an excuse.

Y8uCyrrE5nwzszzeCTXyew.text: Meh.  It was breakfast.  I mean truly, how can you fuck up breakfast?  Even Marine Corps boot camp got breakfast right.  But Ocean One Bar & Grille said, "Hold my beer.  Challenge accepted."  1. Service near non-existent.  I had to walk through the rugby scrum of servers to get a coffee refill.  They need to work on their rugby skills.  They parted for me like the Red Sea parted for Moses.  They never saw there was an issue.  2. Server asked if we wanted jelly for the toast.  Seems like a reasonable and nice offer.  Sneaky little wanker fooled me.  Never came back.  So off I went to the kitchen to ask for jelly.  Finally got a little help...from the cute bartender.  Which is perfect because at this point I needed both eye candy and a stiff drink.  3.  My wife had eggs shells in her over medium eggs.  Maybe that's a local delicacy.  Usually we always order eggs without shells.  4.  As a positive, there is free Wi-Fi, the network and password is on the menu.  It worked for my phone, my wife's phone, and as I sit here watching the staff look at the phones and giggle, I'd guess this server is fan-fucking-tastic!    5. Two coffees, two eggs, and two pancakes came to $24.82.  Paid using credit card via the server's iPad.  The restaurant provides the auto-calculate service for tip percentages starting at 18%.  Seriously?!?  6.  Finally, other than the cute bartender, one of the servers, Elvira Banuelos, was courteous and helpful.  It was the male servers and staff that were lazy douchebags.  So the test question was who can fuck up breakfast?  Answer: Ocean One Bar & Grille

5JHS9rkqDZ8lk6Lh3Axz2A.text: It is a testament to them that we went there for breakfast three out of our four day stay in Las Vegas.  The location, price, and food are the best.  The staff is friendly and the atmosphere is bright and calm.

avLLnv9Q9agCzTozuLB01Q.text: Poor services. Said they were closing at 11:40 & it really closes at 12. I'm never this person to leave a review but the service SUCKED!!!!

TtSwOv6iWyop2zrO4HcO4w.text: My party came in and my sister came in and ordered the chicken pasta Alfredo she asked previously before the waiter took the order was it the white Alfredo sauce. He said yes and pasta was brought out and it was not the flavor she expected so we asked kindly to switch the order and have the BBQ pizza instead. shortly after the manger Hector came to out table and told us he would "do it for us this time" very condescending. Making the issue much bigger than it had to be. Saying nothing was wrong with the pasta and the menu says what's in the pasta. When the problem was she felt mislead and didn't enjoy the pasta.

1O0FHaKiF7evNVxkKUSf3w.text: The customer service was horrible they brought the food out to us which was the Cajun Alfredo pasta and we were not pleased with the taste so we asked the waiter could we switch it out with something else and the manager came out and was being top of the line disrespect stating that there wasn't anything wrong with the food it was perfectly fine and that's when we started your not our taste buds so you would have no idea on what the taste was and he kept saying smart ass remarks so we just asked for our tab and kindly left

jn6WUWD6ETqZBp4V9dGVZg.text: I was told **LUNCH HOURS 11:30-5:00pm ** but it is not posted anywhere so it maybe subject to change.  Today is Friday that I am posting this. Wish I could take a photo of the official lunch time.  I am here for the $5 lunches but the service gets slow at mid day, so I want to come at a late lunch hour to avoid the rush and get fast service.  Seems 4:00pm is a good late lunch early dinner time.  Best price for food in Vegas on strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shows some games on the tv with a bar for cheap drinks

auGB6U5rING7lnSVLLoC3w.text: Avoid this dump. McDonalds has better quality food than this disgrace of a place. After looking over the tacky menu I decided on the the chicken club. It comes out  on a small scuffed up plate. The fries are cold and soggy. The chicken is extremely dry topped with a browning piece of lettuce and a watery tomato. The waiter gave us no refills and had zero personality. I received the check on saw automatic gratuity added. Automatic gratuity on a 2 top ? What an insult. No wonder why the service sucks, they just slap on gratuity and call it a day. Horrible establishment.

30ECimMlNKOc73SF1PijpA.text: The food, drinks and service and were amazing and quick! The 3 for $10 for drinks was an ideal price for a place that can be so expensive. Also the to-go sippy cup was clutch for when we couldn't finish the rest of our drinks. Highly recommend!

9jnNzCe_qIwBT52DE8qgLQ.text: The 3 for 1 drink specials were bomb! That's such a great deal. Glad we found this place and loaded up on drinks before New Year's at midnight. We drank at the bar.   This place is in the Miracle Mile shops at PH. The staff were friendly. The prices are reasonable, especially on the drinks. I'd come back here for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OheHj1-w_gafBrroXxfCbA.text: Highly recommended and I would definitely go back again.   Best drink offer that I found in Vegas 3 drinks for $10!  The Caprese Salad was the bomb!!!  The lobster tail on my surf and turf was very well seasoned.   The mashed potatoes were blend.....  Service started out slow but once our waiter got to our table..... everything came out of the kitchen perfectly on time and hot!  Portion size is very good as well and its not expensive

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet Mignon
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Classic Surf and Turf
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caprese Salad

rzTJlCT_pziI4tpLN7cQ9Q.text: Convenient location , lunch is awesome and I cannot complain about the service,  prompt and professional!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

54SyV_pIDjUAWPCjgRDkQw.text: Food - 4 stars.  We went for breakfast.  Good (big) Omelet, wife liked her meal and the daughter loved her Eggs Benedict.  I liked the crunchy potatoes too...though they are a little cheap.    Service - 5 stars.  I saw where people had slow service but we came Black Friday morning at 9 am and got seated right away.  Service was prompt and attentive.   Ambiance - 4 stars.  Kind of cool in the Miracle Mile shops and sort of fancy for as cheap as the meals were.  Price - 5+ stars.  Not the best meal you will ever have but for the price on the strip it may be the best value there is.

637tP5iM2r6jO8AR16FevQ.text: Usually a good experience. Today not so much. Calamari arrived COLD...was seated at table with no utensils..food arrived before utensils. Sunday approx 12.30 not busy at  all. But server was personable and attentive. Rice was undercooked and crunchy aldente style.

YSobUW_tpvmiyXwMXeb1JQ.text: The happy hour here is awesome - $5 everything. However, it's nothing phenomenal. Fun place to go with friends and get a decent bite to eat for great prices on the strip. Portions are also decent for it being $5. It was very busy when a group of us went but we were greeted and seated right away, our food also came out very quickly. I would recommend and be back when/if in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dkgAkENNjzGktRke2bR9sg.text: Don't come here unless you want to wait for the two young and annoyed hostesses to stop their conversation to seat you, wait 15 minutes for coffee, a goofed up order and cold lifeless food.

lLle4Luequq-K7Ql5u8K5Q.text: This place is awful. Service is a joke, the food is even worse. The yolk on my fried egg was so over cooked that when I cut into it dust flew out. Don't waste your time here. With so many other options in this town eating here was one of my biggest mistakes.

-WVdTMM5D_Dn8kTH2lYwKg.text: One of the best meals for the price I've had in Las Vegas! I had their surf n turf which was delicious! And for a great price of $18.99  Although I don't drink, other in my party do and you can't beat the $3 specialty drinks, 3 for $10 spirits, or $3 beers. Definitely some of the most reasonably priced alcohol in all of Las Vegas.  We also got to sit outside on the patio so we were able to see the "Rainstorm" show in the Miracle Mile shops and be surrounded by a nice atmosphere.  Overall the food was great, the pricing was fantastic, and the atmosphere was lovely. Will definitely be back next trip!

2vKmxXjZl5O0zyFHsnxrfA.text: Should have checked yelp first!  Food was decent but server brought out wrong wine first, then next one had a dirty glass (some kind of chocolate (I hope at least) on the bottom of the glass) and then the next one (replacement) was obviously not clean. Perhaps the bartender was drunk.

rdzLW5Lhju7nQ9QlGSSYyA.text: The wait was 40 minutes on a Saturday, being a local I was ok with this because I know how the tourists get, I got sat within 40 minutes so that's great, our server didn't stop to help us until 10 minutes after sat which was kind of disappointing, the food was ok I couldn't really complain because everything on the lunch menu was only 5$. The Caribbean Mahi sandwich was really really dry, which is common in Mahi but to dry to even eat. My bill wasn't to big so I was happy and I still left 20% tip.

mpos77Dp3sOAKpbA2mk97g.text: Food at Oceans One isnt too spectacular ! The price was somewhat decent for the burger since there was a special. Strawberry daqouri was pretty gd aswell. Fries where blatently old nd reheated.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger

8tam7f3_iBqQpOihYicUMQ.text: If you are looking for an affordable yet good food I highly recommend this place. I've been here twice and left happy and full. First time here my mom and I had two entrees with sides all for under $11. Our second time here we had two entrees with sides and   4 Ketel One Bloody Mary's all for $41!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jCbPhb9rTZ_rFRpjBH-Ifg.text: Came here for drinks after a show at V Theater. We heard they had killer drink deals so we decided to check it out. We found out they have a 3 drinks for $10 special, mix and match, just no sharing! That has GOT to be one of the best drink specials out there! They also have frozen drinks at $3 and other drink specials.   Our server seemed to be a little confused about out drink order, but it came out ok. We did have to do a few additions of our own (adding soda water) but it was still decent.   Food was ok. We got spinach and artichoke dip to share and i got the crabcake sandwich. Both were pretty good and the fries were great. Nothing to shout home about, but not bad.  Overall, service was so-so. We were looking for our server a few times, it wasn't especially busy so i cant imagine what he was doing, but we were able to pay our check right at the table with an ipad so that was pretty good.  I was going to go with a 3 star, but changed it to 4 because of their amazing drink specials!

Vu1_dcUMpEC0MR5lBB-78w.text: I believe they shouldn't have the $3.99 order online deal. They do not treat people who order online like normal guests. I ordered food last night and 50 minutes passed and I received no email that my food was ready, it usually takes 10-15 mins so I was concerned. I then called 2 times and no answer. So I had to walk over there and my food was just sitting there ready, but they never sent me an email. The host did not care nor did she apologize or empathize. My food must have been sitting there for a while because it was cold. Plus, the owner is rude and disrespectful.

LCJ4k7F3dHPd9ABMcMPDTw.text: The service was fast. The price was good, but the portions were small and the biscuit from the biscuits and gravy meal was rock solid to the point that you couldn't even saw through it with a knife and fork. Yikes. I don't expect much from Vegas though.

eBDsGTIXFJEFSapgQfwbiQ.text: Okay so... I am a Vegas local. I am originally born and raised here. I have had wonderful food and I know what seasoned pasta and chicken should taste like. So I went just yesterday with 2 friends to eat and day drink a little. My friend explained to me that this place was the best for the drink prices for the 3 for $10. Okay cool. However, she said she had never eaten there... I was worried after that but do to the setting, I decided to order the rigatoni pasta with chicken for an extra 1.50. Now, why it's 1.50 to add chicken, I dont know haha. Kind of felt like it should be added but anyway, I ordered it an a sour apple cocktail. The cocktail was good and strong so I figured the food would be icing on the cake. So I waited about 20 minutes for my food. It was a little busy inside(which was another good sign) so I was considerate of that. Anyway, I got the recommendation to get the rigatoni from one of the bartenders. She said, "oh yes, it's really good," and with her "genuine" reaction to it, I ordered it. Let me tell you as soon as the plate hit the counter I was through. I immediately looked at my friends and then the bartender and I immediately knew I was sending the b.s. that came on the plate right back to the damn kitchen, okay! So as soon as the random gentlemen with the black outfit came out to serve "just me" when my friend also ordered the chicken Cajun pasta I was confused and hoping that he wasn't trying to show face like his food was great. Because, it was far from that. I took 1 bite just to see if I was being a brat and let me tell you it was so watery ! The pasta sauce was yellowish and the color of chicken noodle soup. The chicken appeared like it was cut up slices of ham that you put on a salad or something .There was peas on it ! And the pasta had absolutely ZERO FLAVOR ! OH IT WAS DISGUSTING. I SENT IT BACK AND ASKED NOT TO BE CHARGED AND THE BARTENDER THAT RECOMMENDED THE B.S. SAID SHE WOULD ASK THE CHEF IF SHE COULD REMOVE THE CHARGE !!! I WAS DONE. Meanwhile, my friend is STILL waiting for her pasta... It's been at least 30 minutes now. Everyone has their order but my friend... Anyway the bartender comes back out and says that she could remove the charge and that "it does say peas on the menu"which was unnecessary to comment on after the fact..Point is that she took that damn charge off. She also told me that the CHEF! AGREED WITH ME THAT IT WAS GROSS AND WASNT SUPPOSED TO BE MADE LIKE IT WAS ! ANOTHER RED FLAG ! LMAO. I thought about that and was like well wtf ! He made it! Lmao ! Anyway I ordered again and instead I got the pasta primavera.It was better. Only because garlic and lemon had the pasta drenched in it but it made up for it. However, MY FRIEND WAS STILL WAITING FOR HER PASTA! So her pasta finally comes, same situation.DISGUSTUNG,WATERY, NO FLAVOR.WELL THE FLAVOR TASTED AS IF THE PASTA WAS SOAKED IN WATER OR BOILED IN WATER WITH BACON OR SOMETHING .THAT WAS THE ONLY TASTE. The pasta was dripping on the saucer as she was taking small bites. I begged my friend to return it. SHE is the type to settle and act as if she is bothering someone so she was too afraid. And kept eating it. She felt a little forced so after a few bites she didnt want it anymore and her stomach started to hurt. We asked for our remaining 2 drinks and left . Let's rewind a little bit now. In the beginning they took our ID and NEVER returned them.. My friend told me ...they keep them until you pay... [RED FLAG !] Thats insane but okay... Listen we parked on the 8th floor ! We got all the way to and inside of my car and my friend screamed about our ID's. So now we had to run back. ALL THE WAY BACK TO THIS WACK ASS PLACE. AND THE GIRL WITH PIGTAILS WAS TAKING A ORDER. I ASKED FOR OUR ID's and she said, "oh sorry." I will not ever eat here AGAIN! It has a nice atmosphere and good prices but ...its just to prepare you for the shit show behind it all. This place was a waste of my time,money, and even appetite. I kid you not.. I left this place paying damn near $30 for shit ..Don't waste your time ! Only drink !

XX9kDMKAXnRwweHksRHQMw.text: Wow, amazing wow! We came in from Dallas, and ate here more than once! Jaymi both days was above stellar! Service was quick, her response was always on time. We never had to want for anything. Wish this restaurant was in the DFW! Great value! Great food!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum

AB10OfU8g2drOCv5OSxgZw.text: Lunch was pretty good for the price but the service is terrible! They couldn't split the checks or give us silverware in time for our food to come. Also my waiter was trying to be sarcastic but it came off rude and unwelcoming

9YCzGZOfTh8r2ZuD97rp9A.text: Best Lunch spot in Vegas. Looking for decent food and great drinks at a reasonable cost? This is it. We were hesitant at first but we walked out of there very pleased. The lunch menu is $4.99 plated meals, I got the steak and my husband their chicken. We both enjoyed it! The drinks were pretty good, especially when you get 3 for $10 and they are hefty pours. The service was wonderful, our waitress was real friendly and fast. I couldn't finish my last drink so I got it to go! Don't let the other review fool you, try it out!

A9308Tr40UB6Pc_xOnKbPw.text: Great place to come catch a good bite to eat. Drink prices are amazing. Not to say that food prices are not just as amazing. Comfortable fun and great atmosphere. Breakfast lunch and dinner. As for Franky she will give you a great experience and excellent service.

cDYMsOkPqbU6cOD-9SLlFw.text: Worst service ever... Ordered breakfast, after getting our main dish it took over 10 minutes for us to get the sides and the orange juice. We had to ask for it again and when they finally came out with it we were already finished... And they didn't even apologise.

I9Zs6j23NVkQrwNhviWiCw.text: The food is a great bargain. But if you get Tracy as a server, lower your expectations. Standard what do you want to eat, here's your food, here's your bill with a ton of rudeness on the side.

O8gHLqMRq3onrTW_MKVyxA.text: Great food, three for one drinks, and awesome staff. What else could you want?  This is the best place in Vegas for drinks - you can't beat the value. They are also the only place I visited that knew how to do a flamed orange twist. I asked them to make a drink I created, and they are the only ones who were able to do it! And it was delicious!  If you get Cody and you like gin and grapefruit, ask him to make you his favorite drink!

u75a2ltQXIJUluRfoS_V0g.text: I don't know what the fuss is all about this place. Yes the $ood is not 5 stars but in the center of the strip, and for $5 per portion which is a good size and well made.  And our waiter was very attentive. Probably ymmv but really good place and value. Highly recommended

PRm6AiA9xYoLAxZBIVLXLA.text: Food was awesome for the price and cocktails are great highly recommend this place we went back for breakfast next day also really amazing and great waiters

fU3BVrVyiS8wwOwtEkNShg.text: Meh.  I had their Chicken Caesar Salad.  I wasn't impressed but the food that the people sitting next to us ordered looked good.   I'll have to go back and try something else. They had a 2 for $10 drink special.  I ordered one mojito and immediately got a headache.  Bummer.

WuFWcH2DBB0fgDrl-uJ49Q.text: The worst dining experience I ever had in Las Vegas.  The large plastic menus should have been a warning sign. The crab cake was ok, but the menu was completely unimpressive and so I had a Caesar salad and crab cake. Seemed safe. Salad tasted like wet lettuce.  This may be the first time I ever added salt to a salad.  Ever.  The bartender was clueless as to basic classic cocktails that every bartender should know. If you want cheap, bland food and well drinks, then come here.

ncui7379chbtuYzf9y3ywQ.text: In this miracle mile mall there are several places to eat. This place is the best that we have found there. For what you pay here, and what you get, this place is a real bargain. Fresh seafood, prepared well, and reasonably priced. They have several daily specials that are reasonably priced and very tasty. They also have cocktail specials that are very tasty and relatively inexpensive.

ByfCTkEym6A1DBqBKmHStA.text: Sheesh. This place was half empty today and they took an hour to bring me the wrong dish. Baked chicken on Caesar salad. The chicken was cooked very well, but the romaine lettuce was sloppy and old.

0J9sHA7vor1IXbBLuBAr1A.text: Very disappointed.  Horrible service. Took around 30-40 minutes to get breakfast.  I ordered eggs Benedict's and the sauce was broken and the muffin was burnt. Potatoes were room temp. Everything was bland. We will never go here again.

jVfk4JqZ_htDn8eM5HREQg.text: This is one of the few places in Vegas that does not try to rip you off. I think the best time to come to this restaurant is lunch time. They have great lunch specials at $5.99. I ordered grilled chicken with mashed potatoes and vegetables while my friend ordered the mushroom penne pasta. I think my grilled chicken was better than her mushroom penne dish. The chicken was a little dry, but immerse it in the mashed potatoes and all of a sudden it becomes okay.  The most annoying part about the experience is that there is a lady who comes over to your table and asks you if you want your picture taken so you can have a souvenir card. However, as much as this sounds enticing, it is a nuisance because once they bring you the postcard, they also try to sell you your picture. Beware, just kindly decline when this lady approaches you. I do not know why they do this.   Also, the seats on the outside of the restroom are uncomfortable (they are plastic chairs). The seats in the restaurant look much more comfortable and I'd recommend sitting inside.

JT2DGY3vQ6ZYa8z0yNoL5A.text: This place was odd.  Not in a bad way necessarily but just odd.  It is like it wants to be something but cant decide and tries to be everything. I waver between 3 and 4 stars.  The ambiance, look, and layout of the restaurant are as if it is fine dining. But they bring you a plastic sticky menu with very ASSORTED choices.   Pork chops, pasta, mahi mahi, teriyaki?  There arent many choices but all none of them lead you to believe that the restaurant is American, Italian, Greek, whatever. They are all over the board. But it worked for me. I had the goat cheese salad which was plentiful and delicious and reasonable. We also had the spinach artichoke dip which was good and plentiful.  My husband had a hamburger which claimed was delicious. We also had the 2 for 10 drink specials and they were tasty.  Our server was very nice, knew the menu and offered suggestions, and was efficient. She took great care of us.  I think we would go back but maybe not.  I cant put my finger on this one.

CDHcaqRbg25ZgXtxtA6CmQ.text: Finally an affordable place in Vegas to eat. Food was great, service pleasant and big screens everywhere for sport. I'm now back for breakfast and not breaking the bank!

DtwDIydD_XM2ONWH6AycvQ.text: Not sure how this place gets good reviews. Had the hamburger and fries. It was dry and tasted like they use frozen patties, not fresh. The fries were scarce and I'm sure they use the frozen ones too. The others in my party weren't impressed either with the pizza and pork chops. Overpriced for mediocre food and service. With so many great restaurants in Vegas, skip this one. The only plus was that there was no waiting for a table. Now I know why.

oX_okjjsEjYjx3E7Y8psIQ.text: My friends and i usually head here if we want a quick budget-friendly meal that's not fast food.  Most lunch items are about $10-15 and they have a separate $5 happy hour menu at the bar too. They are pretty generous with the portions and most of the food is pretty standard (burgers, sandwiches, pastas, pizza)    overall average- good if you're on a budget and trying to stay away from the food court

qRgpQ-Ek2AYRxLZrdDTwFA.text: Since we were staying at the PH and it was scorching hot outside, we decided to eat here for lunch because it was in the hotel. The service was good, but the food wasn't. The burgers tasted like those old burgers elementary schools served and the pastas were just simple tomato sauce that probably came out of the jar.  The only thing keeping this place from a 1 star were their happy hour deals. Buy 1 daiquiri and get another for free.  Recommendation: If you have to get something, get a Strawberry Daiquiri

TqW1INhQf7fkKhTsjz-sVQ.text: Food was bad, service was non existent (we had to go find our server to ask for our check), restaurant was ambienceless. No wonder it was 90% empty when we walked in.

Ku-c3dDjbB1zKsdurMVGNg.text: Our waitress was delightfully sweet!! I loved her fun personality, but the food was just awful. The crabcake was soggy and flavorless....and the fries came out lukewarm. Very disappointing.

dEKjvJ9Zv9_ZZ4KMP5nvvg.text: WE went there because Groupon had a deal. The food was ok. The pizza was cold in the middle so the cheese wasn't melted all the way. The shrimp fra diablo was not spicy at all, even though it said "spicy" on the menu.  The service was decent. They added 18% gratuity to the bill. REally? It was just my wife and I, it's not like we had a big group. I think they saw the groupon on my phone. We probably won't come back there.

9ljms5OHktpBKutYO56j_Q.text: Went in for lunch on 7/28.  The place was busy but not slammed.  We were seated promptly.  First observation, the place is filthy.  Look at the floor.  It has dirt ground into a wood laminate floor and they are either unwilling or unable to clean it up.  The menu resembles a used dirty napkin.  The butcher paper over the tablecloth hides a tablecloth that should not be there... The drink specials and food specials are a huge enticement and it is clear that cheap food and cheap drinks are keeping them in the game, but the service is insanely bad.  We sat for over 15 minutes waiting for a server, never got one.  So we left.  Probably spared ourselves a good stomach flu...

8Nuk8O7D4swppPwNLRWGUQ.text: Stop by for a quick dinner before the show. This place was half empty on an early Friday evening. Our waitress never greet us, just took our orders and played ninja until she brought us food. Never come back to check on us until we asked for the check. She seems mad about something, maybe have to work??!!! Was not going to tip her but my wife felt bad for her. No a good experience at all, will never go back!!

F7eGO9q52a8WiZz2zhKxng.text: I thought a three star was to low. Server was in it. Breakfast was good and great price. Not sure about lunch or dinner.

Qmzczl6n24nifcp7Nc3cvQ.text: Cheap beer. Cool bar tenders. Not bad all in all for a bar on the strip. Food's ok. Hop in

9UcGAYcum8XIL3RmLLDhIA.text: FRAUD ALERT  After visiting in early June with a large group of friends, several of us who paid with credit card at this establishment were hit with fraudulent charges, both from the restaurant and from a location in the country of Turkey.   After calling the place, the girl who answered the phone confirmed that she's received several reports of this during the past week.   Apparently there is/was an employee lifting CC #s.  Food-wise, it was so-so. Value-wise, the food was pretty great, compared to other locations in the mall.

Y2SBEMK4TP_ZAssIffZLuA.text: Great Valentine Day meal. Was not our first choice but after going from restaurant to restaurant without a reservation and the specials were sold out of most joints.... we kind of ended up here as the last resort and just plain tired and hungry. We were pleasantly surprised. The wait staff warmly greeted us even though it was close to closing, the happy hour drinks buy 1get 1 free were the bomb, my steak was tender and juicy. My new fave when I come to town. I am liking this spot a lot! Best Choice

R5_SXKbs65t100DNA4Rppg.text: While wandering the shop area by PH looking for some food I noticed this restaurant that had a nice cafe vibe to it and wasn't at all busy, so decided to give it a shot. The moment I walked in the hostess (or possibly manager, because she wasn't wearing the same uniform the rest of the staff was wearing) looked at me like I was bothering her and didn't say a word to me. I said "two please" and she grabbed two menus and walked to a booth table, and in the same motion placed the menus on the table and continued walking without even a second glance. At this point I wanted to get up and leave because I hate being treated like my business is not worth the service they are being paid to provide, but alas I decided to eat anyway because the other choices nearby were not what I was in the mood for.   They offer an "express lunch" menu which when I inquired about the express 5.99 burger meal was told it's a 3oz pre-cooked, well done burger patty (Isn't that a slider?) so I went with the 8.99 burger meal instead. It was a good-tasting burger and the fries were alright. The waiter was very nice but seemed to disappear for long periods even though there were maybe 20 customers in the entire restaurant.   All in all, this place doesn't really seem to value great service, and for that there's no way I'll offer them my business the next time I'm in Vegas.

tJVw6VlDXpODpVAGaIN5fg.text: 01.22.12  Sunday afternoon.  Checked out of hotel.  Checked baggage until takeoff.  Hungover.  Need H2O.  Need food.  In goes the group to Ocean One.  $5.99 lunch specials are the way to go.  Along with a gallon of water.  Not bad for a tilapia meal under $10.

fxOhqS8sS4nqRBbxPaNxxQ.text: Like most people here. I got suckered in with the $5.99 lunch special sign. On a busy Saturday afternoon in Vegas all restaurants had long lines and the only place that had immediate seating was here. I should have taken that as a warning sign. Plus, I didn't bother reading the Yelp reviews, my bad.   We got seated in the "patio" area in the mall along with 5 or so other tables. Next to us was a bridal party with a bride in her tight boob popping dress and veil along with her bridesmaids who had the same type of dress minus the veil and in black. We waited awhile for the waiter to arrive and when he did we placed out entire order.  My boyfriend and I each got the grilled chicken $5.99 lunch special, the spinach artichoke dip and waters. The drinks and appetizer came out quickly. The chicken came out shortly after. The chicken was good as was the appetizer.  The one star review is not based on food but the service. We only saw our server at our table once, when we ordered. The reason being was he was at the bridal party table flirting with all the ladies and helping them figure out the best deal for them to drink as much as they could for cheap. I do understand that when you are celebrating a wedding or another special occasion you will get some special attention. However, not to the point where you are giving all the other tables on the patio a big FU.  How bad was the service? So bad we didn't even get a refill on water. In fact, I had some water bottles in my purse to drink while walking the Strip. Instead we used the water bottles to refill our water glasses.  The total was $26 so we paid and took off. I noticed when we left the patio area everyone else that was still sitting there looked just as pissed as we were.

9ixKPHIRt_dSUQ1mZVBVZg.text: Yes the prices are super cheap, and that's what originally brought us there. However, you get what you pay for. There is never a wait, and there is a reason. The food is very average, and some is just bad. I swear my breakfast toast had mold on it. Everything was dried out. Tried them for dinner and again everything was average. The 3 for $10 cocktails are worthless if you actually want alcohol in your drink. $3 pina colada was like a milkshake. The salt shakers and table cloths are dirty. Service is slow. If you are on a tight budget, this is your spot though.

J6MNznKjo8FvjqB32450gA.text: Nice happy hour. Fast service. Never a wait. Great place to go in PH prior to a show.

uCD-JwX7MxzukJj3Vj-hDA.text: Great prices, reasonable portions and Manuel was a great server. We went for lunch on a Sunday, had a 15 minute wait, definitely worth it.

H0fmvWSuFemoSONCI5UvkA.text: Reasonably priced food and located in the miracle mile mall in Planet Hollywood. Express lunch meals are a great option if you want to sit and relax just enough to get out and about! The photo people in there a pretty pushy though... Decline the photo to avoid the upsale

6qCzpb8KIsQDn9aOVf4-Pw.text: Do not waste your time! The service was HORRIBLE!! It took 10 minutes to get a waitress for a drink! We tried getting the managers attention and she looked at us and walked off. She was to concerned about standing around conversing with the other employees! She was not what a manger should be. Instead of only 2 waitresses working she could have helped out. But instead I saw her talking to the staff the WHOLE time in a non work capacity and even danced around a bit! Our waitress was great but I actually felt bad for her because clearly she wasn't assigned to our area and was pulled to our table to help out. She had a large group in her section plus other tables and she did her best. She just needed help!! I did realize there were other employees there but they were in a corner booth chatting, playing on phones and then the manager joined them. It was like a big I don't want to work party! The food was brought out by a kitchen person who plopped it down in front of us and took off! The food was only sub par at best and as my hubby said its like chow hall food. Will not be back!

UfXa-QY5jVEuilez1k5byQ.text: We had the mahi sandwich, chicken Alfredo pasta and the cocktail special (2 for 1) and everything was great. Our server, Brian, was awesome.. Super friendly and attentive. Definitely recommend!

rStCapCbVOSxGB7RtYk9sA.text: Inside the PH mall I have had better. The breakfast was okay priced $5.99 for 3 eggs, potatoes, toast and choice of meat. The eggs were cooked perfectly. The potatoes I didn't care for. They had a really strong taste of bell peppers. Yes I saw some small pieces of green bell pepper but the taste of it was over powering. Nice place pretty empty at the time I went. Also I was expecting change from the server but he gave me two five dollar bills back did he think he was going to get $5 tip for a $6 meal?? So I had to get change again. Oh well.

z3FdTo0OXF_ZyLLjrc5S5g.text: There was a hair in my husband's food. Not once did the manager come out to speak to us. When asked for the manager we were told he was busy and he would be out soon, then someone came out and said that they were the supervisor/server and the manager/owner was not here, the name we were given was Ray Bloom. Upset of how poorly this was handled. Will NOT be back!

Qz73bRFwwdpZKbJA4QMfxg.text: YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR. We walked in with my friend before leaving the hotel to the airport because of their decent price ( 4.99 lunch). Their system was down when we walked in, and the host already acknowledged us about it, which was okay. However, It literally took 20 minutes for the waiter to show up and take our orders, and the restaurant was not busy at all. After taking the orders, we had to wait for another forty minutes for the disgusting frozen food to be ready. Absolutely horrible service and food and will never go back to this place.

yh89fk3ys2V0YXfM_zg7kg.text: The food wasn't good due to the overcooked level of texture on fish and burger that was ordered. This was a bit disappointing from the fact being a full service restaurant located in the mall in Vegas.

-suoXEbvKeptm7MOZshUJQ.text: Cheap prices, free WiFi, and a recommendation from Tetsu...inspired us to try this place (twice) in the Miracle Mile Shops at Planet Hollywood.  Lunch starts at $5.99 and dinner at $8.99.    The Island Salmon Salad was my favorite.  The mango vinaigrette and marinated onion not only blended with the greens, but worked well with their salmon filet that was cooked just right.  The pistachios added crunch and flavor to this dish too.    The half pound sirloin burger didn't look like it was half a pound, and taste wasn't all that either.    The wild mushroom pepperoni pizza was good in size, but lacked mushrooms and pepperoni.  A crispier crust would've helped too.   As for the Grilled Chicken Club...I've had better!     Service was above average though.  Tracy rocks!  She put cherry flavored syrup in my diet coke and allowed us to plug in our laptop into the wall near the kitchen.  For low-cost lunch with nice ambiance ON THE STRIP....I'll be back!

09XojFIwNbQyh_TI2waBLQ.text: Breakfast is a fine time to eat here. Don't eat here any other time. The supposed brick oven pizza is soggy and nasty with unripe tomato. The other menu items must come from a bag as if you ask for the fish, say, not blackened, this is not possible. The pasta was decent and even al dente but the service surly and got drinks wrong. Really you mess up Pepsi? The guy for breakfast was so nice we came back an we only have regret. Only good for morning.

gRB-5npXg-yrnQ_wHhbTFw.text: Here's the thing. It was 8 a.m. I had been up since 3:40 a.m. to catch a flight to Vegas. I was starving. Ocean One was the first restaurant I saw. Egg white omelet with veggies. Shit ton of salsa. Gallons of diet soda. Great service. CHEAP.  Can't speak to anything else, but breakfast sure as hell hit the spot.

d5ywglIwHBUxXF5QIGQW6A.text: Ordered French toast. It was hard and cold. Sent it back. Second order was burnt. Third order was ok but not very tasty. Service was slow. Will not come back here again.

6UCkF8cT7Mf1q9tggkMzYg.text: Very poor service. The food was average, and the price was average. But our waitress was very disinterested towards our table, accommodating other tables two-three times before returning to us. No chit chat. No asking if we needed refills. And she applied an automatic gratuity far surpassing what we'd give her. Poor experience.

Su9Frh1RbZ5Y0PmpRe9qbw.text: Our service was great. Oceans One Bar & Grille is in a great location, especially if you're going to see a show at the V-Theater or Saxe Theater in Miracle Mile. The food was okay. Price was cheap. Absence really nice. It was an open space that was comfortable. Payment process is a little awkward because you pay at your table with an iPad. Overall, not a bad place to eat.

nL5_sTRNprjrzgPwdC_SrA.text: Decent sit-down restaurant in the Planet Hollwood/Aladdin casino Miracle Mile mall for $5.99 lunch or $8.99 dinner.   Was looking for a nice casual and not-so-expensive bite for lunch within the Miracle Mile and found this place. It's a big attractive place with seating outside the restaurant where you can relax and watch the people roaming around the mall.   They have these lunch specials for $5.99 (a couple of sandwich selections for $5.99) and also dinner specials for $8.99. I had a satisfying grilled chicken club sandwich for lunch that came with a nice mound of fries for $5.99. Service was friendly altho not the fastest - it was one woman with a Ukranian accent covering quite a few tables by herself but she was hustling.   Bottom line: Nice option for a casual lunch or dinner and people watching in the mall - won't wow you but should satisfy you. And lunch and dinner deals leave more $$ in your pocket for the blackjack table.
