LULvA02UGj9wb5_ZdPstyg.text: With 4.99 lunch meal with great , fast , friendly service and tasty food ... who can beat that?

fp2-dILJccR1rGovQAxGNA.text: This is probably the worst restaurant to dine at in the miracle mile. Horrible food and even worse customer service, the main reason they are consistently busy is because of their $4.99 menu items.   & to add, my husband my son and I all had stomach aches after eating there.   In conclusion they're food is trash and the staff is trash.

8vcssfGbVVsVoZ8ee3P2cQ.text: So the food was a 2/5 and the drink specials at a 5/5. 3 for 10 cocktails in Vegas? Score!! Included beer wine and mixed drinks including a Long Island! So, do yourself a favor, Skip the food as it was bland and mediocre, but grab yourself a cheap cocktail at the bar and I promise you will get your money's worth.

oNW0lQW5X7S_qoaRc7AVcw.text: This was an awesome place for a vacation meal. We ripped upon it and saw the $5 meals and appetizers with the $10 for 3 drinks... PERFECT! It was perfect for before before the Hitsville show and good enough to make a special trip back for lunch, 2 days later! We've had Crystal, and now, Evelyn, for our waitresses a ND they were both excellent. Attitude is everything and theirs were great!!! Thank you, ladies!!! Sincerely, "Chesapeake's 5"

WOMOG0_xhnMK_OXN8xiI1Q.text: This orecchiette pasta with bacon was delicious! I'm glad I ordered this. It was very filling that I had to get a to go box. You can't beat the prices here.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Had the orecchiette pasta with bacon added. Delicious!

dyMpOwAaZOzoxHyJJ0Vi3Q.text: Food and service were exceptional.  Tracy, our server, was great.  Overall service was top notch.  Drink specials are crazy good.

K6UhHhUwWiSzxvVkvKtHMQ.text: This place is amazing. Don't miss their lunch deal. My wife and I visit this place while getting our shows tickets. It's conveniently located at Miracle shops. We had an amazing steak and salmon. For an appetizer we had wings. Wonderful service. Mario did fantastic job serving us. Will come here every time when in Vegas.

_WTuOQUl1-5qOl8ck3-_Xw.text: Loved, Loved, Loved Maria G. Customer service. She was a great waitress hands down. She saved the day because the host Stephanie with black & blond hair when we first walked in.... was a total B**** with a very very bad attitude & she refused to sit us in a area we requested... huffed & puffed in our face & walked away.  We ended up going to a table we felt comfortable at & asked for the manager which was Milcah M. She apologized to us. Maria G. You rock... thank you so much for your great customer service. We will be back... food was delicious.

IW8rbrWXJwQ1yCG9vv_A5w.text: Me and 10 other friends & family members came here for the $4.99 lunch. There was a large selection of food for the $4.99 price, good sized portions & everything tasted really good, which is surprising for such cheap food. HOWEVER, the service is pretty bad. Idk if the problem is that the staff is overworked with so much traffic due to the cheap prices, or if they are just not very customer friendly, in which case you would think that they would not be serving and interacting with guests. Our server urged us to quickly order in a specific manner which was confusing to many of my non-english-speaking family and he came off as rude trying to rush them while he was taking all of our orders stating that we should all know exactly what appetizers and entrees and drinks we want in that order per person. Which was very weird since they were 11 of us and we planned to share appetizers, as groups of friends and family often do. When the food came out our main waiter's assistant never ever knew which food went to who and as we were having conversations, enjoying our time in the restaurant, he would stand there looking annoyed and making sighing noises because he didn't know who ordered which dish and we weren't all listening to him. I thought that was inappropriate since I used to work in a restaurant and was specifically told to not "auction off" the dishes and that we should be paying attention to which seat number ordered which food so that we could put it out in front of them and not have to interrupt their conversation. The fountain drinks there are something like $3 which is fine because they include free refills...that is, IF you are able to get your server's attention in order to order the refills. We did not receive any refills on drinks or water unless specifically asked and sometimes we had to ask more than once. Our server looked rushed almost the entire time and the main waiter's assistant always looked annoyed. If it weren't for the fact that the lunch food was such a great value and tasted so good, I would never come back to this place. So the food gets 5 stars & the service gets 1.5 in mine & my fellow diners' opinions.

h_k2ayByabcBNj-tSYn2pA.text: The restaurant is nice but the service is terrible!  I ordered surf and Turf with a medium Steak. My steak came out well down and small piece was medium  My hubsand ordered steak the same way and his also came out almost well down.  We called the waitress out and told her . She asked us what was wrong We both said this isnt what we ordered. I then asked for butter for my lobster and she brought me cold butter. Forgot to mention the calimari was tough too.  I can onlu say Good luck!

Fb9obC1hsfIizpXUgv6Osw.text: Came here on a Monday and they have a good lunch deal for 4.99$ on any of the entrees on there. They have 3$ draft beers as well! I don't think this deal is good on weekends maybe only on select days.  We ordered a Stella (on draft) and Amstel light. The skirt steak that came with mashed potatoes and sauteed veggies in a Cabernet reduction. The steak was a little chewy but still good. The sauce was delicious esp soaked in the mashed potatoes. The 3 cheese omelet with house potatoes. The potatoes were well seasoned and crispy! They were really good. The mahi mahi tacos were pretty good and it came with salsa, pico, and sour cream. For 5$ entrees and 3$ beers you can't really go wrong. They had a lot of other dishes on there that is definitely worth a try like the burger.

SMu4xvKnaM56f8GWNBJ46A.text: My parents and I were a bit hungry and we stumbled across Ocean One Bar & Grille as they advertised great lunch and happy hour specials. For drinks, we ordered the Pacific Wave, Mojito, and Strawberry Margarita. The Pacific Wave was served frozen and consisted of pina colada, mango, and melon liquor. It was garnished with an orange slice and cherry. It was sweet and refreshing. I feel like I was on a tropical island. The Mojito was served over rocks and consisted of Barcadi Rum, club soda, and mint leaves. The Strawberry Margarita was served over rocks but didn't really taste good.  For entrees, we ordered the Orecchiette Pasta and Margherita Pizza. The Orecchiette Pasta consisted of orecchiette, artichoke hearts, onions, tomato, spinach, and parmesan cheese in a lemon garlic sauce. The pasta was garnished with freshly grated parsley. The dish was flavorful and had a fragrant aroma. We felt that the pasta was a bit on the doughy side and slightly overcooked as the pasta was stuck together. The Margherita Pizza was a thin 10" square pizza that tasted like a cheese pizza with shredded basil and sliced tomato on top.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orecchiette Pasta
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 10&#34; Margherita Pizza
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pacific Wave (Delicious)

kX4AhYHcbVYEnIcQlCwAjw.text: 3 for 10 drinks and the. 5 dollar lunch! You can't beat it with good food, drink and location! Must go

7HE6b0nXSwzgW659qWvoOA.text: Really good food. Super friendly staff an great prices. Ate there twice on our vacation.  Once for lunch an once for breakfast.  Check it out

On9f0t_sEsW4bq65RG5PoA.text: Breakfast on the Vegas Strip is not cheap. Even national chains are $1 - $2 more than other West Coast areas. We were drawn into Oceans One by their advertised breakfast special. Big mistake!  This place is popular because of their reasonable prices. We were seated promptly with quick attention by wait staff. After we ordered we watched a number of people who were seated after us receive their orders. We waited about 40 minutes for our food. One 2 egg breakfast with ham and Florentine eggs. When we were finally served they brought bacon instead of ham and the toast seemed as if it had been reheated in the microwave. I think they had to grow the spinach because it took so long. Excuse by wait staff was that the Florentine takes longer to cook. If that is True it should not be on the menu when everything else is 5 to 10 minutes.  We were in Vegas for four days and did not return to this place.

kAkn6JgPKFAKSVcG4iqgww.text: I came yesterday with my coworker. We we're both expecting a great experience since we heard such great things from promoters on the strip. We had to wait over 30 minutes to order our drinks, then an hour just to get our food. Our server, who was very kind, offered to comp us for having such a delay. However, the punk ass owner, decided that we didn't deserved to be comped for our time being wasted. Overall the experience was horrible but our server was so nice and trying his absolute best it made the lunch somewhat more enjoyable. If you go here the food is great but the owner just a greedy asshole that wants to take advantage of his customers since a majority are tourist. @ the owner if read this, take care of your customers and don't you ever yell at your employees for trying to take care of mistakes that YOUR kitchen made.

PST8UYBAnWnJWgEudpl4Ew.text: This place is amazing!!! Their prices are amazing and the food is delicious! The 3 drinks for $10 is such a great deal especially in Vegas. I

WQ0WH23xVT1nIMbu3stQOw.text: I can't believe this place only has 3 stars!! This place is a hidden gem!!! You get cheap alcohol AND food... and the staff here are great!!! $4.99 for lunch per person... good amount of food, so you won't be stuffed with food, but alcohol instead. ;) Just kidding. My husband and I ate here twice. I highly recommend their NY strip steak and grilled salmon.

RrTvYz1M-SQD-2iaaR9Vkw.text: Came on a Monday for lunch.  Originally didn't plan to come eat here since my friend was looking for the place right across from it.  But we saw the $5 specials and they got us.  We were all shocked to find out that the entire menu was $5, not just a few items.    The spinach dip was a good appetizer to share amongst the 6 of us.  I got the mahi-mahi sandwich and while it was a bit on the dry side, I won't complain much since they made up for it with the size of the dish.  My friend got the quesadilla  which he said wasn't bad and the 2 girls who got the salmon enjoyed their dishes.    I always thought that great deals in vegas for dining were dead but they are alive here!

o402DGe2V0IOwQje7Ha2MQ.text: Delicious breakfast and great location in Miracle Mike Mall.  It was a short wait to get to a table, and the decor was nice too.  Prices were reasonable.  Better yet, ask for Frank and get the best server in Vegas!!!

6JEjTgNm_vro_LFzrFxm8A.text: They get 5 stars for sitting us immediately even though they're located in the miracle mile mall which is super busy and so crazy you have to elbow your way through. Our waiter Jerry was amazing, friendly and fast and so nice. The prices were amazing for their lunch specials which runs up to 5pm. Everything was $5 and all beer was $3. We ordered a handful of plates because we assumed they were appetizer sizes based on the $5 price and everyone wanted to share. Nope!!! They're full size servings and excellent quality. I'm vegetarian so I only ate omelette and some salad but the rest of the fam loved everything from the chicken Greek salad to the calamari and the salmon. My dad said it was way better calamari than many of the places he's tried the last year. Fresh and not over cooked and not smothered in panko. I wish we had found this place before the last night when we had to leave but now we know it's there and it's great so we will definitely visit the next time we're back in Vegas. Thanks for your wonderful service Jerry!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 cheese omelette and house potatoes
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orecchiette pasta
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mashed potatoes and skirt steak

via3UL2XwOjk2uRvAY3-xA.text: Value and price, you can't beat it. I was skeptic with price on the quality of drinks and food and they did not disappoint.

lputvDcy-7sfxMEcyJH9FQ.text: Best high quality grub at a low budget cost. One of my favorite places to eat whenever i work at the planet Hollywood location for work. Staff are all pretty chill, highly reccomend!

VoujvoYIVzVRhoqBxUluiQ.text: $5 lunch from 12-5pm and 3-$10 drink specials. The food is good but for $5??? Fuggedaboudit!!! It really is the best lunch deal on the strip. The Asian style wings were great and the fries were perfectly crisp. And they dont skimp on food or alcohol portions. I give it 4 stars as taste balanced with cost is great. And there are enough food options to make most ppl happy.  It's inside the shops at Planet Hollywood with plenty of seating.

gfu9CvQkldi0RRqpiq5A1Q.text: The bartender ALEXCIA at Ocean Bar in the Miracle Mile at Planet Hollywood is great at serving drinks FAST, she's super friendly, and JUST what makes Las Vegas such a fun place to visit!!  Ocean Bar was very busy during the Saturday afternoon we visited but sitting at the bar and being served by Alexcia allowed us to enjoy our food and drinks much faster than if we waited to be seated at a table in the restaurant. Plus the bar was a lot more lively and fun! And our food and drinks came quickly. And tasted great!   The bar had 5 bartenders working hard to fulfill drink and food orders, but Alexcia was the only bartender working extra hard to take care of all the bar - at least 35 people - with a smile on her face, to boot! We enjoyed her service has will be back, that's for certain!!

67on83rw1po4UfXBEx85sg.text: This is my go to spot to start my Las Vegas layovers. Let me just start by thanking the powers that be for this lovely 3 for $10 drink special that includes Jack and coke. All of the drinks are very goid and not watered down scrappy grade alcohol. I also suggest my favorite appetizer the chicken wings. Only one flavor choice but the sauce is to die for. I think my colleague tried the shrimp eggroll and dipped it in my wing sauce and it was love at 1st taste. Sometimes it gets busy and service levels lack a tad BUT they are always nice to us. I feel like being nice and kind will always overshadow the downside of the situation. I'm sure I'll be there again several times this summer.

siPJL7nSLj73YmGXd5d1SQ.text: This is the MOST reasonable priced place in Vegas. Best drink specials (3 for $10 cocktails, $3 beers, $3 frozen drinks). You won't find specials like that anywhere in Vegas. The food is great and reasonably priced. Definitely recommend.

QBPDSX_sjqEpR1Fe9UiYlg.text: Sub-par. Competitive prices (for Vegas breakfast) drew me in. Convenient location (in Miracle Mile Shops) cinched it. Not worth it though, not worth it.  I got the steak and eggs. Steak was unlike any beef I've ever tasted.  Like a McDonald's McRib mystery meat--except this was whatever the polar opposite of tender is. Eggs were from a powdered mix.  Go for the over medium instead of scrambled, then at least you know it's an egg. The toast must have been baked in the smallest pan known to man. Never had a piece of bread that literally fit in my palm. Potatoes were the only saving grace. Everything was tasteless,  except the potatoes.  Service was polite, attentive,  and prompt.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cocoa half the price of breakfast--no refills!
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and Eggs (w/ potatoes and rye) and hot cocoa

Km9lQKP1WoKQ_-EvAm4uGA.text: The lunch menu was great! For $5.00 you can get a really great lunch, I had the salmon and potatoes and my lunch buddy had a delicious chicken salad. Also you can't beat the drink deal, 3 drinks for $10!!! Defined the best deal in Vegas!! The only thing I didn't like was how filthy the bathrooms were. For how busy that place is and for how many employees are working there, there's no excuse for the bathrooms being so gross.

VI5gXvrLGyYqkYTurwZYmg.text: See down below for update...  This was my second time "eating" here and will undoubtedly be my last. The first time everything was marvelous, great food, good service, great prices, this time not so much. No greeter and a couple minutes later she emerged. I waited a whopping 15 minutes to be contacted and then I had to flag the greeter to ask to put in my order. Another couple minutes later a waiter emerged with no apologies for my wait. He takes my order, I ask for a manager. 5-10 minutes later no manager no nothing. What's crazy is that it wasn't even busy! I didnt even drink the water on the table I just left. Gonna head to the golden arches for breakfast where they respect my time and my money.   Update: Ok so I lied. They hooked me again because the buffet at Aria was stupid expensive. The food was good but that wasn't the problem before. It was the service. This time my service was great like the first time I came. My service was nice and attentive but playing devil's advocate, I was one of the first people here. Great f'n value for the price and good tasting food, in general and especially for Vegas where cheep good food can be hard to find. I got 3 drinks and breakfast for under $20 with tax. For price alone, worth a gander.

uJU9QInuzr5nsw6K-7WdcQ.text: Can I just tell you again that I love it here?!?!  A triple shot for $10.  How can you beat that!?!  I came here twice on my last trip.  I had to go to the box office twice, and Zappos theater twice, so I was at Miracle Mile a lot.  One of the best drinks I had the whole time in Vegas was the Smirnoff Peach and Sprite that I got here, and it was the cheapest!  I got my drinks to go and walked around the mall with them  Perfect. :)

TPSPsvP2m9lxEzCGA3ZiCQ.text: This place gets five stars for me because of the value for the food and the portion size. The food is above average as far as taste and quality. This place was extremely well priced. Two entries, an appetizer and dessert were only $29.    Do yourself a favor and eat good and cheap.

ERKry57UTGe3kW-YvYWstw.text: Oh my gosh! Lunch was fabulous! I had the flank steak and hubs had crusted pork chop. Veggies are amazing. Mash potatoes were to die for! Flank steak was flavorful and the chop was very nicely breaded. We shared a southwest salad which was great but skip it for dessert! We had cream brulee and the chocolate molten cake...yes yes yes! Service was superb! We made another reservation for another trip before heading home

KWhGsIrqW7mgfdXymb0FOA.text: Great food and excellent prices. Also a really nice atmosphere. We have to force ourselves to eat at other restaurants when we are in Vegas because we love this place

TZsb2R65sTqgno_6UpfuTg.text: This place is amazing for lunch. All items are $4.99 and each serving is a pretty good portion.  It's amazing that you can still find this deal in Vegas. I actually made a mistake expecting the food will be in small portions so I ordered a lot, to my surprise it's a pretty good portion size. Well, more food for later.  Definitely a good place to visit for lunch if you already lost a lot of money from gambling.   In addition we had a great service from Elvira and to add to these  alcoholic drinks are 3 for $10.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wow! What a great deal! Amazing price of $4.99. The food taste great and the portion is big. What more can you ask for in Vegas

bLk1diPpNBjqsMFY2CdGeQ.text: I am the Sherlock Holmes of finding a deal...my kids  would say my favorite saying is 'too much money',  so when we found Ocean One's $4.99 lunchtime special we were excited to try it.  First let me say their marketing group is smart.  You could have had a $5.99 burger or $6.50 pasta dish but somehow a blanket $4.99 lunch grabs you like a Dollar Tree sign.  Walmart May have the same thing for 88 cents but hey it's a dollar let's get it.  The place was packed on the Friday we arrived but our wait wasn't too long.   The restaurant is big and there are tons of service staff.  We ordered sodas and a wing appetizer, my wife had pasta with chicken artichoke spinach and other stuff in a cream sauce and I had a cheeseburger. Wings were quite tasty as was the pasta.  My burger was a burger but he fries were hot and seasoned well.  They also had a 3 for $10 drink special which included a wide array of drinks.  Also a $2.99 frozen drink special.  I'd come back again for lunch as the menu was varied with lots of stuff I would gladly try.  And it was tasty enough to hook me in yo try dinner as well.  Hey you could spend $5 on a fast food burger or taco, why not sit in a nice restaurant and have a real meal for the same price.  When in Vegas....

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger.  Period.  I&#39;d do something else the next time. A bit bland.
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orichette (sp?) pasta with chicken, spinach, artichoke and onions.  Quite good!

Hdb-Z9aRdPZxe05hpiFcPA.text: It always happens when you bring someone to restaurant and you brag about it on how good it is, but it turns out horrible.   We've had good food and especially the drinks here in the past.  This time around, all o can say is disgraceful From the food to the rude waiter and his terrible service I don't think we will be back any time soon unless it's for the 3 for 1 drinks at the bar.

Sx6IrRFZdkPyp9cWo2aqQA.text: You get what your paid for.  The waiter was very rude and seemed to be not interested in working there and took our menu's away before we were finished ordering.  Kind of weird since the tip is based on how large your bill is.   One of the other server's there also looked liked she came off the street with all of her tattoo's showing.   If also felt like if you were weren't Hispanic, that you were not welcome there become a majority of the people who worked there did not speak English.   We tried to ask for a manger and the they didn't even know what the word manager meant.  The chicken club had wilted lettuce and black and burnt bacon.   The price was around $6.  When we tried to send it back, they gave excuses on why it was perfectly fine.   This is a perfect example of getting what you paid for and end up regretting it.  Just go to Fat Tuesday's where you can get drunk for the same price but with much better service.  Needless to say, this isn't the place to eat if your looking for a good meal but rather a place to go if you want disgusting food and don't care how poorly treated you are.

OtCBRAZY9Vp0hJV58XTv9Q.text: Hubby and I stumbled upon Ocean One Bar & Grill inside Miracle Mile Shops In Planet Hollywood. The gentleman recommended it as we were looking at Mal Legend. At the ABC store, the young lady recommended it again. So we set off on our journey for lunch.  When we arrived, there was several people waiting ahead of us. They took our name and gave us a considerable wait time. 5 min. They were fast. People were seated. They were efficient. If they called your name and you didn't come up front, they moved on to the next waiting persons. It pays to sticks around.  We sat, immediately our server gave us the menus and brought waters. You can't beat the food choices for $5. Appetizers range from, spinach & artichoke dip to ocean eight wings. 3 different salads to choose from. 3 different taco choices: grilled chicken, Mahi or Shredded Beef. An array of sandwiches and wraps. The chefs specialties, oh boy! Herb crusted chicken breast, grilled Atlantic salmon, penne steak, orecchiette pasta & marinated sliced flank steak.  There's something for everyone here and it's all under $5 before 5pm John has the Caribbean Mahi Sandwich. 6oz Mahi Mahi grilled to perfection topped with lettuce, tomatoes, onions, avocado, House Made mango habanero aioli sauce. You hungry right?  I was so full from my 1/2 lbs angus burger that I didn't have room for dessert. John had the sinfully delicious Chocolate Lava Molten Cake with Vanilla Ice Cream. Whoot! Whoot! That was John tooting his own horn he was so pleased with his dessert choice...Lol.  This definitely goes down as one of the best cheap eats on the Las Vegas Strip! Too bad we only found them on the last day of our trip. Will be back soon

PsF6qBh4dCYowJTANDjUVw.text: Came here for drinks only. $10 for 3 cocktails. That is $10 for 3 drinks, NOT $10 PER DRINK. Amazing deal on cocktails, but I wish they would make the drinkers stronger. But cant complain for the price. You can even get your last drink to go and walk the strip etc with your drink! How awesome. Would come here again for my 3 drinks!   The paradise punch was my favorite although I liked quite a few of them. The almond joy one seriously tastes like almond joy, such a tasty dessert drink.

t5IHoQ3s3c96GD5e1j_cnw.text: Disappointed for the poor service, too busy I guess. And the quality of French toast was not so satisfying.

WkMB7Qhef4krsJVWhbW5bQ.text: I would only come here for their $5 lunch. EVERYTHING on their menu is $5. Salmon $5 , tuna tartare $5,etc. But as the saying goes "you get what you pay for". And we paid $5.  Salmon salad wasn't bad a little to soft in texture. Wings too soaked but decent. Tacos  no good. Don't even. Tuna tartare also not the worst. So if your tired of spending ridiculous money on food in Vegas it is a delight to your pocket.  Also 3 drinks for $12.  Advice- Just order the 3 Straight and get the chaser on the side. Can't go wrong.

sWJieduV8nHv6va6T5U6WA.text: I still LOVE this place. 3 for $10 cocktails are consistently good and decently strong. Service continues to be very friendly and pretty attentive. The food leaves something to be desired at times, but who's coming here for the food?! Lol. If you are seated before 5:00 you can take advantage of the lunch menu- everything is 4.99.

1fcvWar3cpvsymCg-Nc44Q.text: $5 for every item on the menu for lunch?  A friend mentioned that there's a restaurant on the Strip where everything on the menu is only $5 for lunch.  I had to check it out during my recent Vegas trip to see what this $5 deal was all about.  Ocean One is in Planet Hollywood/s Miracle Mile.  As you walk up, signs promotes its $5 for all lunch items and 3 cocktails for $10 and all beers for $3.  We arrived shortly after noon and the restaurant was crowded.  We placed on name on list with the host and were seated in about five minutes. The lunch menu includes appetizers, tacos, salads, sandwich & wraps and chefs specialties.  With the LV heat, I started with a cooling frozen margarita for $3 before placing our orders.  After checking out the menu, we gravitated to the chef's specialties of herb crusted chicken breast, grilled salmon, marinated sliced flank steak, orecchiette and penne pasta and spaghetti & meatballs.   Our orders: Grilled salmon with mashed potatoes and sauteed house vegetables with a lemon caper sauce. The 6oz salmon filet was well cooked and was moist.    Marinated sliced flank steak - cooked medium rare as ordered and came with mashed potatoes, sauteed vegetables with a cabernet sauce. The steak was grilled and tender.  So a $5 lunch does exist on the Strip.  Inexpensive meals virtually disappeared in the 90's with the introduction of the mega casino hotels. Nice to see good food and drinks in normal portions at inexpensive prices.  Service was friendly and efficient too.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Marinated sliced flank steak
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled salmon
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frozen margarita

y-DJURyPMm8OQcdj10Nz3w.text: Unbelievable value for good food and good times @ Ocean One Bar and Grille, located inside the Miracle Mile next to the Raining Water Fountain.  (near ALDO retail store)  There's no shortage of good food @ Vegas... but Ocean One, located inside Miracle Mile, beats out its competition by a mile!   Where can you possibly find their lunch selection for just $5!!!  Unbelievable quality food at great service for $5 lunch!!!   Nope, I'm not talking about a $5 soup or salad discount.  These $5 menu offers are exceptional values!!!! Think:  HERB CRUSTED CHICKEN CHOP Served with Mashed Potatoes, House Vegetables and Natural Au Jus  GRILLED SALMON Served with Mashed Potatoes, House Vegetables and Lemon Herb Sauce  MARINATED FLANK STEAK Served with Mashed Potatoes, House Vegetables and Cabernet Sauce  ORECCHIETTE PASTA Chicken, Artichoke Hearts, Spinach, Onions, Tomatoes, Lemon Garlic Sauce  PENNE PASTA Chicken, Mushrooms, Tomatoes, Caramelized Onions, Pomodoro Sauce and Parmesan Cheese  I've tried them all as my favorite is the ORECCHIETTE PASTA, without cheese and go light on sauce.  They don't spare or go light on the ingredients.. it's a full size dish at just $5!  Wish I have an Ocean One near my house!!    Because of this exceptional value, I would usually also splurge on appetizers.  I've tried all of the following 3 and hey don't disappoint.  My favorite is the Ocean One Wings where the glazed sauce is so yummy!!  TUNA TARTARE Diced Ahi Tuna, Chili Oil, Sriracha, Mayo, Scallions, Avocado, with a Touch of Wasabi and Eel Sauce, served with Crispy Wanton Chips  CRISPY CALAMARI Wakame and Szechuan Garlic Sauce  OCEAN ONE WINGS Mahogany Glazed Lollipop Wings tossed with Scallions and Sesame Seeds  This is also a very popular breakfast / brunch spot.  Expect a short wait @ peak hours but i've never waited more than 30-mins.  My favorite spot to sit is @ the "outdoor" tables doing some people watching and watching the rain fountain.  So much fun!!  So kick back, relax, do some dining and enjoy their 3 for 1 cocktails for only $10 or a $3 beer!!  This place is awesome!  Oh, and their service is always quick and friendly.    An awesome 5-star restaurant for good food, good service @ exceptional value!!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You just can&#39;t beat the value!!!  $5 for this vege wrap!
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. ORECCHIETTE PASTA $5 @ lunch!   Chicken, Artichoke Hearts, Spinach, Onions, Tomatoes, Lemon Garlic Sauce
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari $4.99 Lunch Special - So good and excellent value!

w1dpDBs_2DdG27EF1vK82Q.text: TLDR: When in Las Vegas, I highly recommend having lunch at the Ocean One Bar and Grille! Take advantage of their super cheap and great tasting $5 lunch specials and 3 for $10 drink deal!  Located in the Miracle Mile Shops (connected to Planet Hollywood), this restaurant was super easy to find - there is usually a line up during lunch hours, but it goes by fairly quickly. My friends and I came here for lunch a couple days in to our trip to Vegas (we saw that the restaurant was super popular, so we thought to try it out - and... who doesn't like affordable food in Vegas!?). I ordered their Deep Fried Calamari (for $5... IKR!?),  Mahi Mahi Tacos with a side of salsa and chips (comes with a side), and Orecchiette Pasta (consists of chicken, artichoke hearts, spinach, onions, tomatoes, lemon garlic sauce, and parmesan cheese). BTW, I did share this, haha!   Deep Fried Calamari - for $5, I cannot complain! But, the calamari was overcooked, very dry - it comes with a tomatoe-y sauce on the bottom, but it did not help. I ended up asking for tartar sauce on the side - I recommend that if you like tartar sauce (I think it was also made in house, yum)!  Mahi Mahi Tacos - comes with three tacos, pretty bland - it definitely needed some sauce...   Orecchiette Pasta - DELICIOUS. A must try. I thoroughly enjoyed it, even though it was a tad on the salty side, it was overall very, very tasty!   They also have a selection of alcoholic beverages for a very decent price (beers $3, frozen cocktails $3, etc.).  Because I loved the restaurant so much, I came here for a late dinner and ordered the Grilled Ribeye ($24.99) - it was hands down the BEST ribeye I've had.  Overall? I loved it :)

F9nNBEGbGNaZ5G8bS5aekQ.text: I've been wanting to check this place out for awhile now. For the strip, the 5$ lunch special can't be beat.  We stopped in about 2:30pm and we were seated right away. Nice atmosphere in the restaurant. HaThe waiter came over promptly with some waters. We had already looked at the menu so we were ready to order. I got the chicken chop and the BF got the chicken club with fries.  I really enjoyed the chicken chop. It was cooked perfectly. The veggies and mashed potatoes went well with the jus on the side. The meals were perfect lunch size portions.  The Fries with the club were seasoned well. The sandwich was ok, but the BF felt that it could have been better seasoned.  We were in and out in an hour with our appetites satisfied.

Yxn5QsFGFSFp9R6kw-4bxA.text: I definitely recommend this place!! They have lunch from 11:30-5, and all of their dishes are only $5! I got the baked salmon which came with veggies and mashed potatoes, the salmon was moist and cooked perfectly. Very good quality food for an even better price! They also have alcoholic beverages for $3! Super great place if you're on a budget!

ioWUKc-EbxlGcNWlcz-GiA.text: About what you'd expect for $5. Everything is okay, not amazing but definitely worth 5 bucks lol. The chicken wings were actually pretty good. Our group got a bunch of appetizers to share and each got our own thing.   Best thing about this place are the drinks! They're so cheap. It's 3 for $10 cocktails and if you only drink the first one you can take the other 2 as a double to go. Beers are $3 so that's also nice.  Service is friendly, my only gripe is that they don't clear dishes even if they see it. We stacked all our appetizer plates in the middle and they just brought out our next round of food and put it around the dishes. Made it really cluttered.    if you're ballin on a budget this place is worth going to for food and drinks.

jHwor_dj1dPfwproOyM00Q.text: Wow! The prices were almost scary. All lunch items were 4.99 and there was a nice variety to choose from. Also they had a 3 drink for 10 per person and you could mix them from a large list of choices. Breakfast items were fantastic- eggs Benedict and steak and eggs, and prices were very reasonable for the great quality. Steak was at least 8 oz and perfectly cooked- very juicy, tender, and flavorful. Servers were great.

9EIemwFFlkxWBtNyp_OMgQ.text: Ocean One is amazing!!! The food is great! A hidden gem inLas Vegas.  $4.99 quesadillas is the bomb!!!! The buffalo wraps are amazing! We had a waiter Megan who was amazing! she continued to ask is of we needed anything. Very attentive! The 3 for 1 drinks are amazing! Order the purple hooter or blue Hawaiian!

lKF7W5jmikstXcY6hfiYyA.text: Me and my family stopped her for breakfast. It was amazing! The food was delicious and plentiful. The service was perfect as well. Our server was attentive and really took care of us. I also had the 3 for 10 drink special which is a great deal in Vegas. They had a big drink menu and they were well made. I only regret that I didn't make it back for dinner or the famous lunch special. It was well worth the stop.

lGvneH78etC6CB0mgQoRkg.text: terrible!!  service is despicable and disrespectful. i spent 45 minutes just sitting there and the bartender said, "i didn't know you were ordering something..." don't go here unless you wanna wait 2+ hours for your meal! thanks for wasting my time ocean one! Also I'm a Las Vegas local, and I'm going to insure that anyone that mentions this place will be given an honest review. You pay for what you get. A $3 Beer means a 30 minute wait. A $5.99 Club Sandwich means a "F*** the Asian guy!" and just forget to put the order into the kitchen.

5yrtsgqS1t2tpCKM8wgzMg.text: $3 beer, fast service, and buy-one-get-one cocktails are all nice perks. But you also get what you pay for. The Moscow mules are in glass, not copper. The old fashioned is decent, but nothing to write home about. The spinach artichoke dip is heavy on spinach, light on artichoke. I'd come here again, it's cheap and quick for the strip and the ambience is casual but upscale, with plenty of TVs if you want to catch a game.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old fashioned.

TvzKa-I-gN5xizxa6QmJew.text: Not the worst food you'll find but far from the best you'll find in Vegas. They have a small selection of affordable breakfast omelets (no substitutions allowed) for 8.99 which come with potatoes and toast. After 2 breakfasts there within a week, I can tell you they're pretty bland. Pass on the coffee and get that from the Coffee Bean coffee shop further within the mall. Service wasn't so great either time, but generally serviceable (they aren't very engaged).

dgTbB65mBgqGU357EFzkhA.text: Came here on a co-worker's recommendation and I have no idea how I hadn't found this place sooner. I had a $5 salmon salad that was pretty darn decent. It was a little salty but it was overall good and would have easily been $15+ anywhere else. Huge selection with plenty of other stuff if rabbit food isn't your bag. Portions are just right.  Oh... And the best part.  All cocktails are 3 for 1. Mix and match and not crappy well liquor either- Ketel One, etc.   For $15 I got 3 cocktails and a salad... That doesn't suck. Service a little slow but really nice and they were really busy. Lunch everything is $5, dinner it's $10.   I'll definitely be back for a cheap eat and drinks. And they have wall outlets at there bar so you charge your devices. Sweet!

v5mpifVpL1XODu8ImC6r_w.text: I sat without as much as an "I will be right with you for over 10 minutes".  I gain the attention of a waitress and she says she will be right with us.  Five more minutes roll by and the hostess who sat us comes and rudely tells us the section just closed (the table next to us just got up to leave) and we needed to move.  So...why did no one bother to tell us this while we sat for that entire time and why did she sit us there in the first place?    Terrible, rude "service".  Do not waste your money.  You're in Vegas and there are hundreds of other options.

WBHkAMrhDyzyUnwAtj0YxQ.text: This review is only for the bar and the 3 for $10 drink special.   You can order cocktails, beer, wine, or martinis, pretty good deal. I went with two friends and we each had three drinks, it's more than I usually drink but I wasn't driving home that night. I had a strawberry lemon drop (not on the menu but the bartender offered to make it), the Creamsicle martini, and an Hawaiian Cosmopolitan, with pineapple vodka. Yum.   One friend ordered a Moscow Mule and they needed to keep his ID, apparently people steal the cups, lol.... Uh, okay.   Definitely one of the best drink deals I've seen ever, let alone in Vegas.

xXGJ96UfdNapJrBpk8_DTQ.text: My husband and I both had a great dinner. The best part of the experience though was our server Matt. He was very attentive, explained the menu and how the drink menu worked since this was our first time eating at this restaurant. He was very busy with a lot of tables but he took it in stride. There was another party in his section sitting next to us who were very rude but he handled the situation very professionally. My husband  comes to Las Vegas somewhat frequently for work and we will be coming back to this restaurant. Of course we will be asking for Matt!

NpSvJ-9jZD30r0AIz1SDIw.text: A great find outside of the big hotels. The food was delicious and reasonably priced. If you are going for breakfast, anytime after 9 am will be a little wait but before that we just walked in. Since we'll be here a few more days this will be the breakfast spot. Worth coming back. Husband had smoked salmon and I had eggs Florentine. Scrumptious!!

qx8KWZju4VoWvtcugJuyUg.text: This is a nice place located inside the miracle mile in planet Hollywood. We came here for breakfast though probably should have tried the lunch $4.99 EVERYTHING ON THE MENU.  Be aware they stop serving breakfast at 12 and the cash register will not allow the servers to put anything breakfast related in.   If you are in Vegas and want a cheap breakfast this is the spot!

C2fIMtshbWHZTZEkwEzfbw.text: We've been at this restaurant several times over the years, mostly for breakfast. In that time we've seen the food be pretty good to average and the service range from terrible to above average. $5.99 for 2 eggs, ham/bacon/sausage option toast and fried potatoes is a good price in Vegas these days. Of your close it's fine. However it's not so great or consistent that I'd go out of my way either.

kkvAs7CnZhB6HVa_YR74Ig.text: Absolutely wonderful! Elvira was super nice and sweet, I haven't had such great service in a while!  Grilled salmon was tender and VERY delicious, the drinks were strong and tasty. And all that at an unbeatable price: all lunch items (until 5pm) are 4.99 and drinks are 3 for 10 or 12 if top shelf. Chardonnay was soft and crisp, MaiTai was sweet and strong.  I seriously cannot find a single thing to complain about! I wish we had this place in LA! We'd come every day!!!

myoPZD66_sEp1pZyY2uQuw.text: A new go-to spot when I want some great food and drinks at low prices! I came twice over my 48-hour visit. The first time I had the crab cake appetizer, and that was hands-down the best, most fresh tasting crab cake I've had outside of Florida and Maryland. I also got the half pound sirloin burger with Swiss and mushrooms. The burger was cooked to perfection and was thick and juicy. It was late, so I decided to get a few drinks. The Moscow mule was great, and a perfectly balanced between the vodka and ginger beer. Neither overpowered the other. The Long Island was good, but did not stand out too much. I liked the paradise punch-but if you do not like super sweet drinks-steer clear! This one is a very sweet drink. The watermelon jolly rancher was also tasty, without being too sweet. It was sweet, but the sour balanced the sweetness well. The bartender was friendly and helpful and made great drinks, and I was definitely in a "good place" by the time I finished here. I came the following day for lunch, and it was a great deal! I started with the spinach-artichoke dip and it was amazing- creamy, yet still had a bunch of spinach and nice chunks of artichoke. A lot of places will have the dip kind of burned on the sides of the dish it's in, but this dip was perfect and had no burns. The next thing I had was the salmon and it was a great serving size with spiraled veggies and mashed potatoes. It was grilled perfectly! I finished wth a molten lava cake and it was exactly what my sweet tooth had been craving for the last few days. It came out warm and there was a ton of sauce inside. Each of these were only $5, so I was able to leave a $20 and felt full and satisfied and got to have a tasty 3-course meal. I am not sure how they can do it and still make money, but I'm not complaining! This will definitely be a new regular spot to go to when I come to town!
