dYN4msTl_B8m49JXr-x_kg.text: Their lunch menu is extremely affordable! Everything on the menu was $4.99 each! The food portions were huge for the price! We had the pasta and calamari and they were good! We also got the 3 for 1 drinks for only $10! We had tequila sunrise and it was pretty strong. The service was extremely efficient.   You need to try this place!

PKJmNpDzWSXyjZ_1ZeCNqg.text: Great prices and good food.  Service was pretty fast and reliable.  A little hard to find.  The water we had was in to of his game.  Would definitely go again.  The three drinks for $10 was really good.

O3uxFraJahjLRT0rui4k_g.text: Affordable. Good quality. Good atmoshpere. Ate lobster tail, sirlion burger,  and margarita pizza.

evU3HK-EoDl4qFTf6yQRkw.text: RONNAY is the best bartender ever! We always come here for breakfast...brunch...it turns into lunch, and she will always take care of you! She's the best bartender ever!!! You get 3 drinks for $10.... best deal ever! I got 9 Mimosas for $30 and my husband got 6 Ketel & sodas for $20. Definitely the best bar deal in Vegas.

zCeA-pnk3IoTqg89Vt6pEQ.text: Gave this place 3 stars because the food was not very appetizing the first night we visited, but came in tonight for the 3 drinks for $10 and they were to die for. My bartender was great and she made the best Long Island I've ever tasted. I would visit again for the drinks...don't know about the food. All in all, I am pleased and feeling loverly...lol!

so5lHMJDM9rDpaHzJyp2Gg.text: Four of us and everyone gave it a big thumbs up. Prices reasonable too!  Great people watching spot if you can snag an outside table.

NF0x9IzG389v--VPdQRO4w.text: 5 Stars for 5 dollars!! Wow this place is such a great deal and the food is really good too! Most people are paying upwards of $40 to 60 a plate for Steak and Salmon and I'm over here getting it for 5 dollars. Great place to stop and eat a good meal for the low.

Y2DiW0YjPC1pXnKQOKdCZw.text: The Ocean One Restaurant  is AWESOME!!!  One of the best deals on the Vegas Strip period!!!  Three for one drinks all day.  The food  is absolutely terrific. Great atosphere.  Great prices.  Amazingly great service, they go out of their way to make you feel welcome. Ask for Danny the general manager.  Tell him you read David's review on Yelp and he will take care of you!!!

_ipyC1JdEh7OL3FeVsfyjg.text: Ocean One, you are absolutely AMAZING.  You know how in Vegas, walking is a must? And you know how walking makes you extremely tired? And when you're extremely tired and it's at least 100 degrees outside, you feel insanely hungry and thirsty?   Yeah! Well Ocean One saved my life.  I came here with my parents when we stepped into Miracle Mile Shops and were dying to eat something simple yet filling. We constantly saw ads around the mall for Ocean One flashing $5.99 meals. Not too shabby! So we decided to check it out. When we arrived, we were promptly seated and given our menus. We ordered and our food came in about 10 minutes, so it was quick! But slow enough to let you know they spent some time cooking it. We all ordered from the $5.99 menu because everything sounded so filling already - no need for entrees! Mom was amazed to find that her talapia dish came with mashed potatoes and veggies. Dad ordered a meaty dish, and that filled him up no doubt. I got a chicken caesar salad, and it was definitely very tasty. I loved the chicken and the egg!  Overall, an absolutely wonderful experience. The waiter was extremely friendly and we got to sit in these fancy-looking booths in a fancy-looking restaurant. And our meal turned out to be only $20! Definitely worth visiting :)

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chicken caesar salad :) delicious!

vukkp8YBb5V9nZGWrhSLJw.text: Identity Crisis!!! This restaurant is way past its prime...it appears it once was an upscale establishment that has been reduced to a $5 a plate with $3 frozen drink mall stop. My friends all had various gastrointestinal  responses to their meals. Thanks ...no thanks

XbUgVevU2qXJhtvVWGpL_Q.text: I'm shocked to find this place only has 2 stars on here. I make it a point to come here every time I come to Vegas. Everyone I come with always tells me what a great pick it was. They gave half off drinks which is nice and I always get the pasta primevera. I don't want to hype it up to make it sound like a 5 star restaurant but for the price (and the price of Vegas in general) it's very good. Also nice to watch the rainstorm right outside. Friendly staff, not crowded.

GiMS42OcgquPy59pvhDiKw.text: We were excited to find our first reasonably priced breakfast, but I guess it came with a cost. That means getting mediocre  food.  The lesson is you get what you pay for. Bland potatoes, cold dry omelette missing the cheese, and an odd waiter who was difficult to describe. He Seemed annoyed that I asked for ketchup and hot sauce to spice up the bland food. I'll pass for sure on my next visit.

wu7A_xO7wBMEGTs75xcebQ.text: Only giving this place one star as there is not an option for no stars.  Went for breakfast here. The server was friendly but the food was awful.  I ordered the pancakes and hubby the poached eggs.  When I go my pancakes they were lukewarm at best and dry. The server came over and asked if everything was ok. I said pancakes were cold and he immediately took them back to get new ones. He came back within 90 seconds with two new pancakes and bacon. Definitely not enough time to have cooked a new batch. I suspect that they have these already made sitting under a heat lamp waiting for someone to order.  Do yourself a favor and not eat here.

-HN5HYzDcZSZ5eATcha-pw.text: This was our first night in Vegas and we ended up at the Miracle Mile at Planet Hollywood for a comedy show and dinner.  Very nice place and the service was pretty good. The server didn't know what Eel sauce was when asked and that was the only glitch I found.  We were led to a great seat on the patio, or as much of a patio as it could be, sitting outside of the actual restaurant in the mall area. It was ok though because the scenery and eye candy were pretty darn good.  One of my table mates had a crab cake, which he said rivaled those you find in Md. OK. He's from Maryland so I will take him at his word, even though I never touch the stuff. We had a grilled ahi Tuna done to medium rare and honestly, it was really good.  I don't think you could classify this as fine dining, especially given the environment but it was good. The dirty martini, I mean extra dirty, was good, as well. A 4 olive count and lots of brine.  It is what it is and it is OK.

8cRqpTvSjOuoG03vj_8emA.text: I was wondering around PH following a really, really rough night and my friends and I wound up in Ocean One for breakfast. The place was pretty empty, but we still had to be seated by a server because the hostess couldn't be found.   The menu is pretty cheap, so you are getting what you pay for. My pancakes were OK, very far from the best I've ever had. They came with three strips of bacon that tasted like they were cooked on a griddle that doesn't get cleaned very often. My friends had similar reactions to their food - that it was pretty mediocre. The coffee was a little watery, but overall it wasn't too bad.   I do have to say, we had some pretty good service. Our server was attentive and very friendly. I am definitely bumping my review up one star because of her. The prices are also pretty cheap, 3 breakfasts and 3 cups of coffee came out to approximately $34, which you really can't beat in Las Vegas.   If you are wandering around PH, you might want to try looking for a different place first. If you do find yourself here, lower the expectations.

xlKXEsx-4LcXufbe-Pm-ig.text: We ate here 3 times during our short stay in Vegas.  This is a very well run restaurant with GREAT prices.  That's what brought us back again and again.  It is clean and the staff is friendly.  The food is good and well worth visiting.  It is inside the Miracle Mall which has seating inside and seating outside the restaurant in the mall.

Ov0FS2OUvlBkkZOgY3umzw.text: The food isn't too bad and the price is right. But the service is painfully slow. The bartenders are not attentive at all.

TagdO4YM410Zp7sqraIqiQ.text: Very good prices and great food. They did not skimp on quality! Will definitely be back!

OIuSkCsm3KR5MncpIZ6uVQ.text: This review is strictly for the bar, ANTONELLA was our bartender - she made us feel so welcome and answered every question we tossed her way. We came in for the lunch specials ($4.99 a pop!) and stayed for the drinks! It was good bar food, basic staples - wings and artichoke dip. If you like fish the Santa Fe tacos were more than plenty, fresh and delicious.

Z6neOvRQ05ieEZ7uDaQqBw.text: Worse customer service ever the hostes was rude. We were a party of 5 and gave us a table for 4 we asked if we can be move to to another table and she said there is a wait of 15 mins (mind u no one was in line). The hostes was just rude NO STAR for me

JVili9nV1Ybl24AYbZSBow.text: Food was ok. Not more not less! Servive was a little slow. What i didnt like? The server added 18 c/o gratuity to our bill - we were only two people! When the server returned with his electrical paying thing it suggested to add gratuity AGAIN! I had to press NO TIP so that i wasnt tipping double!

eY8UmopVcCAOzbXXXtbidw.text: Terrible service. Waited 15 min to place an order while sitting at the bar. Waited over 10 minutes when I was finished before anyone even walked close enough to holler at them to give me my check. Food is so-so.

7uue8cFLMBjWEOqGYw6Alg.text: This only gets two stars because it wasn't the worst meal I ate in vegas (that goes to the rainforest cafe).   We only ate here because we had a groupon. After reading other reviews I'm not sure whether gratuity was automatically added to trick us or because we had a groupon. Either way 18% was added and then there was a line to add a tip! No thank you! The waitress was good enough. She paid a lot attention to us, which wasn't hard since there were three or four tables at 6 PM. I have a feeling that she automatically adds tips to everyone's check so she can manage to make a living.   The food was edible. My husband had far more complaints than I did, from raw vegetables to lack of shrimp on his dish. My food wasn't great, but it was hot and freshly made.   I wouldn't eat here again if given the opportunity. There are plenty of delicious places to eat in Vegas, and that includes planet hollywood. Look around, there are other cheap options too.   On a positive note, they make their ranch in house and it is pretty tasty.

0Q_h4gCKoem97JlAfGm0ew.text: I found this place by walking right past it in the miracle mile shops. I got the salmon lunch and a frozen margarita. The food was great and the price was unbeatable. I will definitely stop by again and so should you! You won't be disapppinted.

Z3mnEA9_8Lp6oaZ8jNEWAw.text: 2 lunches, 2 cocktails, tip, $40.  How often does that happen in LV?   Now,  it's not gourmet food by any means but it was decent, filling, and we didn't end up with food poisoning.  They had several options to choose from and our waiter was efficient and friendly.  Score.

1b_LrLsIDba9Serc6o4Kcw.text: We saw this on Groupon and the seared Tuna was the advertisement picture, it looked delicious so we bought the Groupon and decided to go for dinner and appetizers. Well needless to say we ordered the tuna appetizer along with calamari and the crab cake and stopped there. The food came out and the tuna appetizer looked like 1/5 the size of what was pictured, the calamari was dry, over fried and very small pieces, not much flavor and the crab cake tasted as if it was heated in microwave and not much real crab.  We decided not to proceed with ordering dinner so we asked for the check... the Groupon was "processing" so we couldn't use it.  Don't waste your time or money at this place, it looks nice but that's the extent of it.

m1KPA1VOwn1V8rqAADiM6w.text: We had the simple salmon.  It was delicious!  The prices are great and as others have mentioned, the three alcoholic drinks for one price, $10 is hard to beat.  We, fortunately, had the BEST waiter in the house, THOMAS.  I was experimenting trying a new drink (since the price was so reasonable) and I'm not really fond of super sweet drinks so after my first I asked him if it could be made a little less sweet and my second drink was much better, and by the third (yes, I was still able to stand up), it was the "Goldilocks Principle."  It was just to my liking, and it was all because of slight changes in ingredients Thomas made to the recipe.  Also, I noticed that someone said the restaurant was difficult to find.  That's because to find in easily one must enter from the E. Harmon entrance of Planet Hollywood and Ocean One Bar and Grill will be the second restaurant on the left.  We found out about the restaurant from the shuttle bus driver that took us to the Freemont Street Experience.  It's always nice to get recommendations from the locals.

LNPDJQdsKkxvAWrzsmw9Iw.text: What a find!  In Miracle Mile mall. So much more reaaonablr than any other place here. 3 for $10 - really?  Yes, really. And not just watered down so-so drinks. These were really good moscow mules, cosmos, whiskey mash. And I'm still going to try more   Lunch is $4.99 with an amazing menu. Had calamari (99%great jus a couple of really chewy ones), ahi tuna wrap with fries, chicken wings. So much more than yoo would expect!  Definitely will be back. Friendly bartenders. The dinner menu is more expensive but everything has been great

peEbgmOikQToSQvX5g4ZVw.text: They offered a 6.99 sirloin burger.  Two of us got it and both of us got sick. I guess you , get what you pay for. Food and the service were actually both quite poor

6cPnC36pxQmPrrIdM0jocw.text: The food was pretty ok, we had fish tacos w/fries and chicken quesadillas. Don't expect a wonderful culinary experience here, they're just trying to comfort you after your pockets have been violated for all your other meals in Vegas, and I can appreciate that.  The bill was only $16 and it wasn't crowded, which is a plus. Small rant: Just so you know, there's this person that goes around taking pictures of customers (with your permission) gives you a free itty bitty one and tries to sell the bigger ones to you afterwards. Now that part is not the bad part--the bad part is that this girl totally PHOTOSHOPPED our picture and it freaked me alllll the way out-- we do not have nor need a triangle chin. So that ended on a weird note,but if you're into that kinda thing...

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken quesadillas

5qMn5Dw0bMp94RoLYrOiYA.text: I'm here with my mom for lunch. We were looking for something inexpensive and their $4.99 lunch menu was perfect. Can't expect much for the price; the food was decent. I ordered a quesadilla that I didn't finish because it was just too greasy for my liking. My mom ordered a chicken "chop" that reminded me of hospital food. I like that it tasted light and low-sodium but it also lacked in flavor. What really bugs me, though, was the server rushing in and out several times. He came because he had to and left like he had better things to do. He didn't even take my drink order. My mom asked for water, no ice and he said "okay, two waters..." and rushed off. Ugh! That bugs me! I don't expect much out of the food for $4.99 but always expect good customer service. Plus!!! They include gratuity! Don't tell me what to tip!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bill.

tZbjuNuCRiJS7gVIuXAUEA.text: So I definitely see why this place has only three stars which is sad because I actually enjoyed the food is ordered. So my friends and I were headed to a different restaurant when we were walking past and saw they had a 3 for $10 drink special and their food was pretty cheap. So we decided to give them a try. The hostess was polite and sat us right away, however, that's where the good service ended. I forget the waitresses name but EVERYTHING she did took FOREVER! Took forever to get drinks, take orders, etc. Not to mention when we drank all our ways, ginger ale, or alcoholic beverages she didn't even take the time to see if we wanted more. Literally everytime we needed something we had to flag her down to ask. It was extremely frustrating. Upon further observation it was very clear she had way too many tables and she couldn't handle it. However the food was pretty good. I got the filet and added on some shrimp and it was only $23 so you really can't beat that. Also it all tasted really good. They really need to work on adding good service to the good food cause that was absolutely terrible.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet

WpfQxE8WyqDJ0CWHvLgF9w.text: Met my sister over her brunch break from work...Walk at the mile shops at planet Hollywood....found this good breakfast resto and price wise is great.   It took awhile for the waiter to take our order but not too much to say....food is okay and for this price....fantastic! ..nice ambiance!

wH12bAaoZ0BaDbKjtkKF-A.text: If you're staying in Planet Hollywood and looking for an inexpensive meal with inexpensive drinks, this is the place to go! We went twice, one night for dinner and one morning for breakfast. The 3 for 1 drinks can't be beat. The dinner was average and took some time to get the check. The breakfast was decent and again took some time to get the check.

leHpmDSDMbPOws90dz745Q.text: Wow, one of the great bargains in Las Vegas. During a,recent trip I ended up at this restaurant 3 times. The food is excellent and reasonable priced. The filet was tasty, juice and tender and under $20. The next night back for pasta, also excellent. The great bargain is an excellent selection of cocktails and wines at $10 for 3! Yes 3! Mix and match. I had a Martini, a Russian mule and a glass of cab all for $10!!!. Also excellent for breakfast! Bacon and eggs $5.99 !!

rKUTvC3LbxWie2dcW1A2cw.text: 4.99$ lunch special! I couldn't believe it when I saw the sign, but it's real!   I had very low expectations, but the food was acceptably ok,  borderline good! nothing amazing about it except the price.   their Pina colada for 3$ was really, really good. had like next to no alcohol in it, but tasted like a dessert.   service was horrid - waiter was too busy trying pick up chicks than serve us unattractive folk.

uRV4qQmTlULd5NgD6vPzFw.text: The food quality was good and reasonably priced. My wife loved the 3 for $10 cocktails. She had the meso salmon that she loved. Overall, a good pick.

TbcLE11GtoCT0rZR-PAd2Q.text: Food very tasty. Had the wings, calamari (that wasn't hot enough), tuna wrap, pasta dish. Would definitely go back. Drinks were 3/$10. Can't beat that.

hkl7Ihh3HEkGgHSRn3JWBw.text: We stopped in there by chance. We saw a sign that said 3-4-1 drinks... YES PLEASE! The service was terribly slow. The menu looks great but the execution of the food wasn't great. I,ordered a crab cake sandwich and it was like playing a game of hide and seek between the buns and the crab cake.  But the cocktails were great!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab cake sandwich

Xd_kHUas3hs6YeZckN3BKw.text: I really like this place and I think the waitress I had helped alot! The drink and lunch specials are amazing and I was so happy to get food that tasted good without spending vegas strip money!  The other places in the mile shops are quite expensive for the fare but ocean did not disappoint.  If you're on the strip go here!

8wElVEropy2mpbl_wDjs4Q.text: If you find yourself walking the Miracle Mile Shops in Vegas and want a solid inexpensive lunch I would suggest this restaurant. Good food and descent happy hour "all day" options. Good for kids. If you are wearing jeans and not a suit then this is your spot. Service was very good.

Q61pHWRvLNxT_Djbb04eqA.text: Food was excellent, waitress was polite and timely, very relaxed environment. Overall great experience.

XibXmGLghUtJU50VZCt9EQ.text: We ate breakfast here and it was very good and very reasonably priced.  I had the two egg breakfast with toast, bacon, and potatoes.  My husband had the classic omelette.  I think our bill was less than $20.  It was definitely one of the cheaper places we ate at on our trip!  Our server was very friendly.

gXi-sN7deEb4bWxhxWljhw.text: What a great find in Vegas -- found the best $5 meal I could at Ocean One in the Miracle Mile fountain area. Grilled salmon or marinated flank steak for $5... Are you kidding me?? AND cocktails 3 fer $10 -- I'm there

8LN9q83JMdnmlXId1MBjTg.text: Bottom line, good inexpensive food and drinks. Went for an early dinner at the bar. We still got the $4.99 lunch special. Everything on the menu was $4.99. I got calamari for an app and an ahi tuna wrap. Both were very good. Any beer was $3 and drinks and wine were 3 for $10. The only reason it didn't get 5 stars is because the drinks were very weak. Our bartender was great! Very nice, attentive and cute. Overall a very enjoyable experience, definitely will return.

tudtRoU-LYFHZ-6Q0pDHOQ.text: I love this place! We are styling at the Marriott right across the street so this place is placed very conveniently. We've stayed in Vegas for three days now and come here over seven times! It's within the beautiful miracle mile and they've got some nice jams playing inside! When we first came we were expecting a hefty bill because of how nice the place looks and how good the food is... IT IS SO CHEAP! If you come around 3 o'clock they have the five dollar lunch menu in which you can get a big meal for only five dollars! The pasta came huge and scrumptious... for only five dollars! We are very regular customers now and from what we've seen we haven't had too long of waits, later at night it isn't too busy. Love love love love this place and I recommend a visit!

KROWs-F98MX9T8haKWf9wg.text: I am currently sitting in this restaurant! This place has horrible service. It took about 10mins for the waitress to come over to our table. We placed our order. It was brought out. Food is great. Waitress is horrible. We've been sitting here for an hour. We only saw her twice. Once when she took our order, and when she brought the drinks. Has yet to come check on us. Idk, maybe she quit, maybe she went home for the day, maybe she's on lunch. Update: turns out the waitress did go home! She didn't tell her manager (according to him) he said she did mention it to someone. Which makes this incident worse. Because that means they didn't care to cover her tables. It's sad the first time I went to this restaurant 3 years ago. I enjoyed, that's why we returned. Unfortunately, I wont ever return.

BGEsTEUWC1f46oFy-5p8tg.text: Food was average.  Drinks were great!  Prices outstanding!  This was our go to place.  Service was hit or miss.  Sometimes great and other times painfully slow.  Shrimp egg rolls were good.  I would recommend going here for happy hour.  :)

OhqIZ0aAOecYq4js5lHi9w.text: My fiance and I went last night! I had the chicken bbq pizza and he had the sirloin burger. Those were both delicious!  They also had a good deal on drinks. 3 for 1, meaning if you got 3 drinks from them it was the same price for all 3. I had 3 wines which all three were only $10, and he had three mixed drinks which totaled only $10!  Excellent prices, food, drinks, and service! If you come to Vegas and don't want to pay for an arm and a leg for dinner and drinks, you gotta check this place out! We loved it! We will definitely be back!

_La9IhAyKAjKAHKfacpv7g.text: Horrible food but our server was fine (thus the 1 star).  We ordered tasteless French toast & a cereal dish with old fruit & Greek yogurt that tasted sour. Was afraid to eat more & left majority on plate.  Coffee tasted burnt that we ended up at Starbucks afterwards.  Then they placed another party of 6 directly behind us that ended up bumping chairs. This wouldn't be an issue normally but there were so many available tables everywhere else (the restaurant was fairly empty). We were sitting by a wall, no scenic view to explain why they might put them by us.  Avoid this place with the plague.

memLsY3jouXooNjOjOaVuA.text: The server here is pretty good and you can get 3 drinks for $10, which is a steal of a deal on the strip. Drinks are super yummy and the bartenders are friendly and helpful. I order the Moscow mule. The food I've ordered has been just okay, but the entire lunch menu is only $4.99 each.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Island Salmon Salmon Salad $4.99
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Tartare $4.99
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garden omelette

C5JXD-B0TAL8bwqS0elncQ.text: Great value we love the 3 cocktails for $10. Next day, We had breakfast for three $33. The omelette was huge and tasted delicious. The one downer was the restroom are stinky

2Q5WjBOEBLqjbEO70zO0fw.text: $5 any lunch menu item, can't get any better than that. They even have $3 margaritas during lunch!   Only reason why I took away a star was because they charged me for an extra item that I didn't actually order. I didn't check it at the moment because the waitress was just standing there next to me (they use Kindles for payment--if you're paying w/ card). The mobile receipt that they send doesn't list out the items that you've ordered, so I'll just never know what that extra item was. But at least all the items were only $5.

dHXGDV7-BXulGauucmMqHg.text: I saw the sign for $5 lunch and was very curious!!!  In Vegas, $5 lunch specials are rare! So I wasn't sure what to expect but the fact that it had calamari on the menu helped us made the decision.  They also had a cocktail special but we didn't order any. When the food came, I was very glad that we tried this place out! The customer service was friendly too! Must come here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2RSvHrc-t0n7j7HG5wVqDw.text: Deals deals deals and good food. You can't go wrong! My go to restaurant any and every time I'm in Vegas

Mf9HxUjE5Ft2ZZ-2DV_X0w.text: Inexpensive lunch with a great lunch variety menu to please the pickiest eaters. Quick seating, friendly waiters, food is brought to the table in. Reasonable amount of time. Perfect place for families!

W3mP-rTCbiHRNRPdqJMtbA.text: First off, the interior and setting of this place is really nice. If you sit outside the restaurant there are strung lights hanging from the shops and there is a fake sky, which makes the restaurant a really pretty place to eat. The price also came out pretty cheap, 4 main dishes and 2 beers for only $45. The beers were $3 each. The only reason I did not give this restaurant 5 stars is because the food did not amaze me. I had the Cajun Penne Pasta, which was fine but not amazing. The burgers are pretty good though!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun Penne Pasta

8wTFa3rt81jnVbwCmXK1dA.text: Awesome place, great food, great service and grest prices. My number one go to place when i go to Vegas!!!!

QQXMOnOc6D30EQggTN08kQ.text: We ate here for lunch on 6/7/19.. they have a big selection for lunch that is only $5 so I can't complain too much but I have to say our server was a little rude.. When my aunt wanted to change her drink from a tea (which tasted horrible to her) to a lemonade, the waiter whispered under his breathe "what a total waste" and then took him 5 minutes to come back with the lemonade. He took our order and we waited about 30 minutes for our food. We ordered a appetizer and didn't get it till our meal was delivered... I ordered the chicken tacos and the chicken was so dry, and so was the tortilla! I can't complain to much since it was $5, but given that we paid a total of $15 for a Uber it is not worth it. Drinks are $3 each and the waiter only came to our table 2 times so I only got 2 refills. We are from Texas, we came here to have lunch after our plane ride.. we will not be back for lunch here

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shredded Chicken Tacos

3S64FpqHVm8RuUKz4mriJw.text: Best bang for you buck. We loved our servers each time we visited when we were in town.

jN2VbiprQeSg90z7jwpDbg.text: *3.5 Stars*. My family and I dined here while looking a spot to each. The menu looked good and they had some good specials. Located in the Miracle Miles shops, no wait time and open pretty late.   The service is here is pretty lacking. The hostesses were really friendly and accommodating, but waiter service is not the greatest. Wait too long to take your order and receive food. Pretty much have to flag em down to get some refills etc for the table.   However, despite all that the food was surprisingly better than expected our entire  table ordered the surf and Turf entrees($29). The Steak and lobster were pretty good in my opinion and worth the price. Overall, food's food, service could be better.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf and Turf.

s52lLvutkWSMCCTaaWb6og.text: Been here several times. Food is always on point except for tonight's meal. I've always wanted to try the chicken Marsala and for most part, it was delicious until I came across a real tough chicken breast. Yes, chicken breast! It feels like it's uncooked and I couldn't bite into it. Gross! Everything else was good, though.  I would come back, but will not order chicken Marsala again.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5317FWhi9lYOfCiLgm3uJQ.text: Love the wings!!! The salmon is good too!!!! The prices are the bomb!!! Must stop to eat when in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gc4DKQVN-rs5qjzTk11AXw.text: I'm giving it to two stars, just because the service was decent and the waiter was fairly prompt. Since this is Vegas, I guess the main attraction here is getting loaded.  So maybe that's why it gets a lot of 3+ stars reviews. Because the drinks are cheap and the main attraction here.  The menu certainly consists of a lot more drinking options, and the food options are limited to basic every day fare.  But if you're looking for a place to dine, this is not it. The food was definitely sub-mediocre. The food was completely under-seasoned, and almost everything tasted like it came out of a bag off the back of a SYSCO truck. The only decent part of the meal was the french fries, which are pretty hard to screw up.   I didn't try the drinks, so I can't speak for their quality. But for the price if you're looking for a place to drink, I guess this might be a good one. But if you're looking for a place to eat, move onto somewhere else.

xfdfgbE52rUPJ5O164Ps1w.text: $4.99 each lunch item & 3 for one cocktails & $3.00 beers all day.  Can't beat that for delicious fresh food in Vegas!  And it is a very nice restaurant with a view of the beautiful Miracle Mile Thunderstrom Show.  We loved the salmon, the chicken, the mashed potatoes, veggies, Caesar salad, crispy calamari and drinks.  We came several times during our visit earlier this month.  We sat inside for lunch & in the patio for dinner.  Dinner time was much busier but we had prompt service.  This restaurant is very clean with nice seating and a nice huge bar.  Our waiters were prompt and courteous. We look forward to our next visit.

cy8dW5mYha6BM0wvurE-ng.text: $5 lunch meals on the Strip in Vegas? Let's do this!   We were looking for a place to dine before our back-to-back shows inside the Miracle Mile Shops. The bright e-signs displaying the menu outside of the restaurant was what attracted us. Actually, it was that large $5 above the menu that made us look. The restaurant is huge inside and it also has patio seating under the "open skies" of this section of the Miracle Mile Mall.  We went inside and right away we were led to our table and given menus. There were additional selections on their paper menu to those featured on their sign outside. I had the Classic Spaghetti & Meatballs. Just the right amount of food for me as pasta can really fill you up. It was okay, a bit on the dry side, but it was only $4.99. It wasn't a bad deal. Hubby had the Marinated Sliced Flank Steak. He was impressed with his meal and before I could ask him if he liked his meal... it was gone! I guess he really liked it LoL! (or he was super hungry).  The lunch menu is served from 11:30a to 5:00p. We didn't try any of the cocktails... we went straight for the food. I'm glad to see that there are still decently priced food options on the Strip, like, who does that anymore?? Who pays for expensive, tiny portions of food but, hey, beautiful presentation... oh wait, I know some people who do! Anyway, service was good. It won't be our last visit here for sure.  Review #1356

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 05.04.19 good deal!
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 05.04.19 Marinated Sliced Flank Steak
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 05.04.19 Classic Spaghetti &amp; Meatballs

OpiQoxTYbYO1zN1YAWU9kw.text: Ocean One is one of the best places in Vegas for people on a budget. We went for breakfast because they have great breakfast and lunch specials. They also have 3 for 10 drinks! You can't beat that. The food was absolutely great and you get a great portion. My boyfriend and I got two breakfast entrees and 3 drinks a piece and paid about $45 for our bill. That's one of the cheapest dining experiences we've had in Vegas and I would absolutely come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tequila Sunrise
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omelet

edW-JgyW3VUmW5YgoPqJIA.text: Unwritten theme of this place:  No substitutions!    We visited for breakfast and ordered the $5.99 egg combo, which comes with 2 eggs, house potatoes, toast, and meat (bacon, sausage, or ham)  Substitute any other item (even lower cost one) for the meat?  No Substitute English muffin for the toast?  No, unless you want to pay an upcharge Request unsalted potatoes? No, they are pre-made and pre-seasoned Substitute any other flavor jelly for the strawberry jam?  No.    Not only were they totally inflexible, the food was not very good:  * The scrambled eggs were inconsistently cooked, with parts being well done and parts being runny. * The toast was inedible.  It was stale and hard as a rock, even though it was lightly toasted.  We had to ask the waiter to replace the toast. * The potatoes weren't freshly prepared.  They were pre-packaged and pre-seasoned cubes of potatoes.  Very disappointing.  The restaurant shouldn't call this item "house potatoes" if they aren't made in house.  There were no jellies or jams on the table and none were brought to us with our meals.  Maybe the stale toast wasn't worthy of any jelly?  We had to ask the waiter for jelly and he offered only strawberry jam. Take it or leave it.  Overall, a poor meal.  We had thought about going to Ocean One for their $5 lunch, but decided against it after having such a bad experience at breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8mkjHEOGDV8UY8-rJTwT_Q.text: In Las Vegas it is possible to find "cheap eats" just off of the strip. Ocean One offers a nice selection of dishes for just 4.99 each. They have 3 cocktails for just 10.00.  Focus on the wraps, and flank steak. Both not bad for just 4.99.  The staff is always friendly and the service is always good.  Due to the prices, get ready to wait. People are always looking for a deal on the strip itself.  If you venture off the strip, you will find cheap eats.

y-3ETmLOGsw54YlELN40QQ.text: One of the best restaurants every tourists or even locals must go and eat! I'm the person that loves lavish restaurants and been to multiple restaurants in my lifetime and this is very comparable to $$$ restaurants.   Idk how they make money on lunch special $5 plates but it is absolutely amazing.   P.S: must order 2 orders of wings, best wings ever with their ranch sauce!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HKPX-ZTqKufiiU0aCEPpkw.text: I'll make it easy for you, this is not the Vegas food experience I expect when I visit. We met some family here after a day of travel,  not our choice but they could get a big group in so that was good.  The location is great and the views are nice. Our waiter was kind, attentive and split a check for our groups which I know can be annoying.  The Caesar salad had potential but the lettuce tasted wilted. My husband did not like the pizza at all. Much of our group kind of played with their food and pushed it around the plate. My sister in law didn't even eat her green beans, they weren't cooked long enough. I had the scallops which wasn't bad, not amazing, it came with some beets also that were really good.   We paid about $100 for four people with tip. The food just is not worth a return trip for us.

8cc-JO9AGnal666d6l0_jA.text: Good food for a very good price!.$4.99 lunch daily from 11:30-5pm. Food serving is huge. Waiting time to be seated is 5-10mins and tou see your name on a big screen. The staff is okay but over all,a good place to grab lunch if buffet is too much for anyone to handle. I definitely recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All these food. $5 each. Yay!
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch menu 11:30-5pm daily

61reRZGDYYMOTr4W6g4Mdg.text: Let me just skip the fluff and get to the stuff you care about. 3 for $10 drinks and I'm not talking bottom of the bottom shelf either. Decent alcohol choices available. Want top shelf? 3 for $12 or 3 for $14 depending on what you want. You'll struggle to beat these prices in Vegas.   But wait! There's more and it comes in the form of an everything $4.99 lunch menu that is available until 5pm. They even have a good selection of items on their lunch menu and as I said everything is under $5. Go for lunch and you can leave drunk and full or just drunk, maybe just full. Whatever your preference is.   The food: the portion sizes are a bit smaller than the dinner plates which is to be expected but are still filling. I ordered the Greek chicken salad and the sirloin (only $5 why not get both right). I asked for medium and my steak was cooked correctly and well seasoned. The potatoes are a bit bland and I didn't get much from the sauce for the steak but overall I was satisfied. As for the salad I REALLY love the dressing they put on that Greek salad. The chicken on top was pretty basic but I would order it again based on the salad dressing alone. Overall definitely worth the money and a steal if you ask me.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greek Chicken Salad
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sliced Sirloin Steak

58Zm_z6-H-sXXYXnFiGQGw.text: I enjoyed my brief time in here watching the dramatic end to the HOU/GSW game. Who in their right mind could walk by this sign and not go in? They could not be my friend.  These mussles were a big surprise and the gem to this visit. Yes the drinks used top shelf liquor and yes they tasted great but I kind of expected it to taste good. These mussles though; I didn't expect that.  These mussles was in a white wine creamy sauce and I was expecting this to be a total fail. It wasn't just surprising that it wasn't just meh, these mussles were really good. So good that I will be back before I leave. Maybe I'll see you there.   I'm here in #Vegas for #knowledge2019 and soaking in a lot of #knowledge and some good #food and #drinks   #mussles #cocktails

37PFWyFRP7AVYjhmIilOCQ.text: Food is always good, it is a must stop everytime we come to Vegas. Lunch is $5 for any entree. Quite the bargain. However, service is nonexistent. We sat at the bar, had to ask for the area to be wiped down. Were not given menus, thankfully we have been here many times that we knew what we wanted. We waited 7 minutes before she came over and asked "what do we want". Never asked how the food was and we had to ask for refills while the 2 bartenders were standing in front of us talking.  It wasnt just us, everyone around had to stop the bartenders to help them. I will keep coming because the price and food are good.

INDPpYLyjgOVwJybenfp9Q.text: Omg what happened? I k.o.'d after eating here on my ride back home to LA. The portion is perfect. The food is perfect. The price is perfect. Def recommend eating here if you want to treat-yo-self. But ya all jokes aside it was probably the best restaurant/food spot I had in vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JOp1gVEA2apDu5Hvhc9YkA.text: Great lunch special. $4.99 for any entree, appetizer, or dessert plus 3 drinks for $10. Food portion was great and drinks were strong too. Definitely recommend for quick stop. Server was also very friendly and attentive!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo chicken wrap and grilled salmon salad.
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 for $10 drinks!!

O-e64QUvsORdNwHRr5hr9g.text: FIRST AND FOREMOST 3 for $10 cocktails!!!! If you don't finish all three during ur meal you can take them in a to-go cup!!! Cheapest cocktails that didn't taste like water we had the entire trip.   We were a large group of 15 so we figured it would be a not so smooth dinner but it ended up being fine other than the fact that at first the waitress said she could not/would not separate our checks and that it needed to be one check. We understood but then once she took our orders individually on the iPad screen she has we realized we were already separated by seat and re asked if we could just pay per seat and she seemed annoyed by complied.   Also regarding pay issues, I ordered a $3.50 side Caesar and was charged $7.99. She was already 75% done with going around the table collecting our payments when it was my turn and I brought it up. She said she would have to void everyone's and restart and it was too embarrassing for me to have her do that just to save $4 so I said I'd just buy it because she mentioned if she gave me cash it would come from her tips and i felt bad. After back and forth of her saying she feels bad and me saying don't worry about it, she handed me $4 cash and said she'll sort it out later. It was pretty awkward for me since It was an ordeal over 4 freaking dollars.   Okay back to the food. I went out on a limb and got the filet mignon because I was craving one and yelp said it was decent. I'm glad I did, it was good, but I shouldn't of ordered medium well. I was nervous it would be under cooked but it ended up being over cooked, completely brown. Flavor was good though.   A ton of us got the $7 burger and fries and enjoyed them mainly because they were $7.   The tablecloths were paper but no crayons so I'm not exactly sure what the point was... maybe less laundry?   Overall it was good and I'd go back, especially with the major deals they have on food and drink. Amazing prices.   It is inside the miracle mile mall at Planet Hollywood.

iUzRydFTrywabCzz506g_g.text: I went here with some friends when we went recently to Las Vegas. We actually did not even know about this place but had stumbled upon it when looking for something for lunch. We saw the menu and it had 5$ lunch items and 3 for 10$ drinks and we obviously were in.  They waiter was nice and we all got lunch off of the 5$ entrees. I got the buffalo chicken wrap and I thought it was delicious. It also is a fair amount of food for 5$. I know a lot of places sometimes cut portion sizes with cheaper meals, but this meal would fill you up.  They also have so many drink options. I ended up spending 20$ on drinks and 5$ on food and left full and drunk, haha. Not buzzed. My friends and I agreed we all liked our meals and our drinks. This place obviously is not 5 star restaurant, but it is a good deal for good food. I am going back to Las Vegas in October and planning on stopping here once.

BWxOGUCZQGrdU5CEI2KasQ.text: Oh... My... Gosh, this place is AMAZING!   They have 3 for $10 drinks, and these drinks are not the cheap well liquor types.  They offer name brands and if you want top shelf, it's only $5 more.  How awesome is that!?   When I visited, it was still lunch time (4:30pm) pricing on their menu which is $5 for everything.   I expected small portions and mediocre food for it being so cheap, but once the food arrived I was totally proved wrong for that notion.   These meals were so flavorful and sized perfectly.   I cannot say enough great things about this restaurant and can't wait to go back!!

jfavOIrUA7k1Ac9gogYcnQ.text: Wow - it's like Vegas food deals of the 80's resurfaced here. Good food, great drinks and amazing prices is the name of their game. Is this the most gourmet meal available in Vegas, no but you are also not paying horribly inflated prices for a celebrity chef name. We had the tuna tartare and calamari for appetizers and the tuna won hands down. The salmon dish was well cooked and tasty. The chicken was tender and tasty.   Drinks...oh my - the 3 for $10 is the real deal. You can't find this anywhere else with actual name brand alcohol on the strip. But the drinks alone make this a perfect lunch stop - cheaper than gambling for sure.   Get in here - you won't regret it and your wallet will appreciate the break from other high priced joints o

UbyIT7fADGbRlOjM4rVozA.text: What do you mean $5?   Who does that!?!?!? Ocean One does.   I was in the Miracle Mile for God's sake!   The $5 meal caught my eye.  I mean, this is Vegas, I don't even think Steak and Shake has $4 meals.   I had the sirloin cheeseburger.  Well done and came with fries.   And wait! There's more!  3 not 2 but 3 drinks for the ridiculous price of $10.   And very decent drinks!   I had a Moscow mule that was a little too sweet so I swapped to my favorite, dirty Martini.   It was so amazing!   Not everyone gets the dirty martini as I Like it: filthy!   When in Vegas, pay a visit.  Especially if your budget is that of NORMAL people.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9ytxO1H2T76vFucSycYItw.text: My wife and I had lunch and the next day we had dinner. Both times the food was great and the price was unbelievable. ( Lunch menu $4.99) The atmosphere was great as well and our server Xavier was outstanding. If you are ever in Vegas visit and sit in Xavier section. Overall, we will be back each time we are in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uOHRYR9Vpgp-s-B6KHinwg.text: Shhh.  Don't tell anyone.  We ate here 3 times over 5 days - once for dinner & two for lunch.  Why?  Because the food was good and the price was great.  Actually I had my birthday dinner here.  8 oz. filet mignon for $22.00.  Cooked perfectly; medium rare.  Frozen cocktails $3.00, draft beer $3.00, bottled beer $3.00, Bloody Mary $7.00, and 3 cocktails for $10.00.  Daily lunch menu - $5.00 between 12p to 5p.  And same drink prices as mentioned.  Sure, this isn't fine dining; however, the food is plated and served to you.  The servers all carry a tablet where they key in your food order.  Later when it's time to pay the bill, same thing.    I can't believe we ate here 3 times over 5 days.  Several reasons include conveniently located across the street from our timeshare; extreme heat 100+ degrees made for difficult walking; and great menu selection with very affordable pricing.

h9ft4NiOuxwyGEKILK8mOw.text: Awesome food sometimes get meals that are not as full as they use too.  But other than that always love ordering online and being able to pick up my food fast.  Have tried almost everything on the menu and found the salmon to be the best to me.  Others my differ.

uU-xPbCs7PLFeO6yvVvagw.text: Here is how this mess started. I ordered online two plates and one soda. I got an email and text telling me the order was received.I walk to the restaurant to pick up my order....The host wich  started to assist me tells me im sorry but we dont have your order. Order again she sugest me ... im trying to explain to her and she left me hanging there till she sits a couple which walks in. Really i have an issue and you assist other clients. I asked  for the manager which tells that our website isnt trustable if you want correct order come here to order  on the bar. In few statements he told me: What you expected because the food is so  cheap. I have no control or reposability for orders online. Our website is relly messed up. If you dont want deal with situations lile that dont order or eat here anymore. I cant honor anything. I cant give corporate or owner phone number. We dont give customer  service numbers away. If you order here is only a dollar more if the money is not a problem for you. So after again he told me for $ 1 dollar more each plate he will be nice and give me a soda to make even because i paid more to order insite. To make short the whole thing customer service sucks if was a zero star that is what they deserve.

10XtNOT0UJH1N6nRxyTx1g.text: All lunch $5! This place was highly recommended by a local friend. For this price, I have no complaints for the food and the environment I get. It's a little bit wait for the food and getting the server.

kXy-yNxDL0CsoO3pen1-bA.text: I don't understand how they can charge $3 a drink and stay in business bc their drinks are super good. MUCH higher quality than anywhere else we went on the Vegas Strip. Pina Colada was on point!!  Food was also good and reasonably priced. Will 100% come back next time in Vegas!

xzGuUYqBMbtmg5kN1x-pBA.text: Great food, even better prices! Cannot recommend more for breakfast.   We were searching for a wholesome, reasonably priced breakfast in Vegas, and stumbled upon this joint in the Planet Hollywood shops. We then came here every morning for the rest of our stay!   The omelettes and pancakes are solid portions and delicious. We also enjoyed the steak and eggs and biscuits and gravy, though I would have liked more gravy. You should be satisfied afterwards unless you're absolutely starving.

xeqEWf3f206j9je26JxFTg.text: Terrible food. From the calamari to the pasta to the grilled cheese sandwiches for the kids. Cheese was not even melted and bread not buttered for crispness on the outside.

mfPeWAjvWqZkhdbjjxjozw.text: This is the most affordable place to eat breakfast and lunch. The food is excellent and the service is friendly and attentive

mb5Gn9LdUk-mgEcjq8A5dQ.text: Went there for breakfast and dinner. Both meals were very good, affordable, and the service was great also. They have 3 for 1 cocktails and $3.00 frozen drinks. Next time I am in Vegas, I will try their $5.00 lunch specials.

goITgumENtewEr7RgI70Tw.text: This place is an incredible value on the strip.  3 glasses of wine for $10 plus an 8 oz burger for 6.99.  Viva Las Vegas!

n8iX86j_CBCt-4NN170z3g.text: Love, Love, Love this place. This is my third trip to Las Vegas and each time I visit from NY I eat here. The food is always delicious and the staff is always very friendly. My favorite Resturant in Las Vegas. Food is adorable and good. They always have great drink and food specials. The surf and turf was delicious. Our waiter was great and made sure our dinner was perfect. Can't wait for our next trip to Vegas so we can eat here again.

bztR9ezFkf-OFxJ2JPOU1Q.text: Great deal on the strip only $4.99 for all lunch items! Lots of TV's for all the sports fans & good service too!  Thanks Jerry! We had our Meetup groups there & there was something for everyone!
