cWo9bCgmjjcjRWQA_iFJQA.text: I'm giving Oceans 5 stars because the value is the best that I found in that area 3 dollar beers food was good we got the steak and eggs for breakfast and it was 12.99 another good value the 3 drinks for 10$ is real I got Tito's vodka because that's what I like the other choices were top shelf so if your looking for Good cheap food and booze then this is the place they also have a huge wall of TVs

8AuELbmdKZ-JYg7bk-T2Sg.text: Good for breakfast, not so much for dinner. Grilled chicken was dry and had one piece of bacon. Fries were overcooked and the waiter didn't offer any condiments for chicken fingers and fries.   Steak and eggs were good and you can't beat 3 for $10 mix and match drinks.

FUTvIyz_VHR-l_ycNQzNng.text: Walked in to there restaurant today 10-23-18 tuesday at 10:30pm and waited to be seated, but the server told us that they are already closed! I checked the time when they close on Yelp, Google, and their own website, all states that they close at 11:30pm. It's either the server is lying to us or Yelp, Google and their website needs to update their time. Very unhappy!

hJoutN40Txt0aAAAzHEiiQ.text: This is a hidden value gem in Las Vegas.  If you don't want to spend ridiculous amounts of money on food, but want to try something that you can't get at home, go here.  Great value and great food.  Service was spot-on as well.  My wife and I came for lunch on a Sunday and it wasn't too busy.  I was at a conference during the week and my wife loved it so much she came back here at least one more time while I was busy.

jyuqnclo6EzN8Nq-tfWHew.text: This was a great find. It was attached to our hotel. All lunches were $4.99 and it was great quality. Drinks were like 3 for 10. We were sat right away even though there was a line I think because we were a party of five and they had a larger table. It was fun, clean and good service. Our bill for 5 was like $75.00 including six alcoholic drinks plus we were full when we left!

YuwVSUJ8DoRHIK82zmR_6A.text: I will say this it was late at night and you can tell the staff was ready to go home .....but that didn't diminish this place at all. With all the frills of Vegas and all the overpriced places to eat this was a great choice after seeing a show at planet Hollywood . I got the cheeseburger and my girlfriend got the canjun chicken pasta both were delicious and very reasonably priced. Our server was so nice and made sure we had everything we needed . It's tucked away from the craziness as well so it's a nice spot to escape to as well

GwmVkAr2iniyofj5rSFdIA.text: Pretty bad service, burger came with old hard bread, the beef is like those grainy fast food burger's. Plus the bill came much more higher than what the menu showed.  Won't be coming here again.

YNIUFBNWshO7TVmnCVdrcQ.text: Asked for a Spanish Omelet and i settled for Omelet with Sala. Perhaps i'd have appreciated your lousy service if the salsa tasted anything but salt.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spanish Garden Omlette with toast

tuJHByZHs4EFtdGW006vtQ.text: OMG the bagel with smoked salmon, cream cheese and capers was amazing! Frank my server was fantastic. Two thumbs up!

bgL7pg6YaiexRFGjymxjmw.text: We waited for over an hour for our order.  We ordered the spinach and artichoke dip appetizer and ran out of chips.  Our waiter told us they were out of chips.  We look to our left 30 minutes later and guess what they had chips.  My wife ordered the surf and turf filet mignon with lobster tail and she was given rib eye with lobster tail.  I have cooked for over 20 years and k ow the difference between a filet and ribeye.  Do not eat here even if you are starving

0t6AP8IIFoKmL5BUIInJIg.text: I unfortunately have to give this cafe a very poor review for many reasons. I was in Las Vegas with a group of friends for the weekend and when we woke up after a long Friday night we were STARVING. We were staying right behind the mile of shops and decided to walk in there and find somewhere to grab breakfast/lunch. We had the choice of a few places, but we liked what was on the special board for Ocean One and decided to give it a try. Boy did we regret that decisions almost right away!      The place was not crowded at all. There were customers of course, but many open seats. We were seated right away, but then waited..and waited...and waited. Finally our waitress came over and took our drink order. We again...waited. Once our waters (and other drinks) arrived we were not given a refill for the rest of our meal. I ordered the grilled chicken and mashed potatoes which were actually quite good. Four of the people in our party ordered different wraps and every single one of them said they were the worst wraps they have had. None of them took more than a few bites and we had to stop to get them hot dogs when we left.       The food wasn't horribly priced for Las Vegas, but we did wait a ridiculously long time for our waitress to collect our checks and bring back our cards. One of my friends paid in cash and the waitress must have been out of change because she brought back only cash and not the coin change....and rounded DOWN instead of just giving my friend the extra dollar.       I won't be coming back here.

VrxDBAfbrdXalkLy_mdZYQ.text: Instant diarrhea ... They gave me some creamy mayonnaise for my super dry 4.99 Burger and I said to myself this not right... I had to leave my party and rush back up to my room to use bathroom.

bvup4YppFxUwE4ioOz8SVA.text: First of all, this Restaurant was on my favorite to visit during the time in Vegas. However, that changed when I came back for dinner one night. The service was horrible even the restaurant was not full. We waited for about 20 minutes before the Restaurant manager noticed we have not been served. She came over and took our drink orders. We then placed our orders for dinner. We waited for 40 minutes, the server is not even care to come check our drinks or ask if we need anything. The next table came in after us and was served. We then asked the server:  Me: Excuse me, can you please check on our orders Server: Ok, will do  She didn't come back until we called her. At this time, I am ready to walk out. We told her:  Me: We'd like to cancel our order, please bring my bill for the drinks Server: Why? (Yes, a single word, why?) Me: It took forever, and we can no longer wait Server: It's coming  She left after that and come back after 10 minutes with our food and literally thrown the dishes on the table. I asked her to bring me my bill. She came back with a full bill with all of our orders even I was specifically ask to cancel my food order. At this time, I asked her for the service manager who offered a free meal which we refused and left.  A very frustrated and disappointed feeling!

UDPweiKWrVdqGuqvGty2SQ.text: 2 stars only because the food was alright but everything else a failure.  Since we were already at Planet Hollywood for a show...we figured we'd check Groupon to see if any of there restaurants had a deal before dining. And hey what do ya know...Ocean One popped up.   Walked in and immediately got weird vibes. No greeting from workers...but at the same time...couldn't tell who was working or not being that they were all in their own sweaters. Odd for a place that looks classy..from the outside.  Get to our table which was also strange because they had a piece of butcher paper over a white linen table cloth.   Saving on linen cleaning?   There are some beautiful looking light fixtures throughout the restaurant but....none of them were on.  Saving on electricity?  Basically....looked like it WAS a beautiful classy steak and seafood restaurant that was taken over by someone that has no clue.  Server greeted us with 2 waters and a blank stare...then asked what she could get for us. I ordered a Pinot Grigio. My husband asked what was on tap and got another blank stare and "um...we have Pinot Grigio....and....Stella and Blelue Moon". He orders his beer, and we both look at eachother in awe. What on earth was that?!? Lol. Weird.  We then notice our water glasses were filthy so my husband asked for another. Then we get our beverages and my wine glass had some disgusting stuff on it. Geez. Really?!?  I know it sounds like we're drama diners but we really aren't. Just letting you know what to expect.  I ordered the Miso Salmon..$18.99 and husband ordered the Chicken Breast $15.99. All in all...pretty good. No major complaints.  Got our check and noticed they automatically put gratuity on there. So make sure you check it!! We usually tip more than what was included on there but because our server never bothered to let us know, we did not leave extra. Their loss.  Try it for yourself but you get what you pay for.  Its just an odd environment, we'll just say that Groupon got us in but, we won't be returning. Should've dined at the Oyster Bar just a few steps away.

nzou6KtTdjlH5ltLAyd22w.text: Only good thing were the frozen drinks, food was ok and our server was horrible. She did not check on us or gave us any refills.

rF-7vIwk8wQE1uHrXf_VaA.text: This place is pretty good and conveniently located! It has been our go-to for years... We come here when we are staying at Planet Hollywood & even when we're not lol Although we've tried a few different things on the b-fast menu, we always end up ordering at least a couple plates of Eggs Florentine - They make 'em really good here!  The service is very fine & generous & the dining area is pleasant while still remaining casual - Great place year after year

sPVyb1reSbPMGoY3haVetQ.text: Manny was awesome. Made the whole experience a pleasant one. Kirsten also kicked butt. You need more quality staff like these two. Food was good could always be better and the bathrooms need some extra loving. Gave it 5 stars because of Manny and Kirsten.

PbWBcJmITf6bXbC0T818oA.text: Not a great experience. I was asked for ID when no one else was asked. Just to be fair I watched others walk in and not asked for ID. Granted I am over 40.  I was even asked for ID when paying for an 8 tab. I refused to spend more.  I asked the manager about it and he defended the employee in question even though she clearly was not treating everyone equally. I think  I rather spend my money elsewhere. The customer service here needs attention. They should also realize they have no clue who they are serving sometime.

Wk_wqjIwyKyANCOJzeS2aQ.text: Great service and delicious food. I loved the atmosphere and service. The food was at a good price and very fulfilling.

rCPSSV3qmY8t0DzHcYOYoQ.text: The host told us w had to wait about 10 minutes for a table because they were waiting for the open tables to be cleaned off. Once seated, we waited about 10 mins before our server acknowledged us. Once we ordered, it took over 20 mins to get our disgusting food. Our server never checked on us again. We had to find someone to get our check. Food tasted like cheap cafeteria food. The fries were adequate.

cCwUOlXoVBBgW4rfgJoxBQ.text: A real find. Good food, amazing low prices..eg..$.4.99 half pound burger and fries lunch... $3 beer...prices on strip 3 to 4 times this. Good service, worth the walk to Miracle Mile shops!  Bkfst $5.99, dinner $6.99. Perhaps last real deal left in Vegas. Ask for Manuel to be your server.

8Pb1KOjjvEUDF1s8LhT-oA.text: oh i was hungover. my wife was not. she had a damn half marathon to run in a few hours and all i wanted was some eggs and toast.   we didn't want buffet or a super expensive hotel meal. thanks to yelp, we found this place in the miracle mile shops and they were still serving breakfast food at 11am. i was sold.   it's right by the rain storm thing in the shopping plaza. service was fine and prompt. i ordered a 3 egg omelette with veggies and it came with a few spicy potato chunks and a piece of toast. it was fine...tasted like something i can cook at home. my wife had the ahi tuna sandwich but said it was super dry. and the bun it came in was like 2 inches thick so she ditched the bun and just ate the fish.   it was cheap, i will give that to them. and i feel so "local" when i don't eat at denny's. it did the job and within minutes....i still had a damn hangover.

Ctgr5MxJEwFa3iBaY1zqug.text: 3 for $10 drinks (including top shelf) when I went here made getting drunk at noon a little too easy. Fell in love with some almond joy chocolate martini I had. I still have wet dreams about that martini. Hmmmmm

Ah5jIJxnbVNr36gvceSzWg.text: You get what you pay for! Stopped by here since the menu looked cheap and had time to kill before heading to the airport. Literally sat down for 15-20 minutes and no one came with water nor take our order. All the servers were standing around and chit-chatting. We tried to get someone's attention and got ignored. In the end, walked out of the restaurant and never ordered food. Would give 0 stars if I could.

amgxkpx_kM3FDQDOXU25_w.text: One of the best drink values in Vegas - 3 for 1 martinis for $10!  We had a Cosmopolitan, Hawaiian Cosmopolitan and Almond Joy (you can mix and match but no sharing) - all were very good.  Being Vegas we enjoyed this deal at breakfast!  Breakfast value was very good too - for $5.99 I had two eggs, hash browns, toast and a generous portion of bacon.  Nice atmosphere and Frankie's (lady) service was excellent.  3 for 1 Drink special is all day also have $3 beer and other drink and food specials.  If you are in the area of the Miracle Mile Shops and appreciate value in a high priced town - this is your place to try!

fR43lLtyEBSFAa0g3rkW2A.text: When you are in Vegas most of the places you would want to eat, should have great food on the menu but sometimes they fake it and try to make it but it really doesn't catch on.   This Ocean One Bar looks like an upscale place and the menu looks like they would have great food .But it turns out that the menu is a lie and that the food is just plain ewwh.   Yes I said ewwh.. how to describe that is a place you should not ever try. My guy had the burger and I had a bite it was a semi decent patty but still probably bought from a store in the freezer section.   I got some pasta that I don't remember but it was pretty much on the hard side with a load of cheese.   Our service wasn't good and we waited really long for the check to even come to us. I hate when places make you wait forever.   The only cool or good thing about this place is the nice seating and also the buy one and get one free drink. The food isn't good and I would say just skip it.

_9D5czEUJ5MWM-bfgZeMlA.text: Lesson learned: never order a "brick oven pizza" at a place that does not have a brick oven.  To go with "Never eat yellow snow"  "Never eat at a place called Mom's"  And  "Never trust a skinny cook"  Also, the waitress gave us the lunch menu to order off of, but charged us the dinner menu prices. She did fix that after we pointed out the difference. But - I'm willing to bet that she's never made this "mistake" the other way.

JBISmk6SH4W6nqssHwsqGA.text: This place was a fail. Server was good! Food was bad. I got the steak and eggs. Eggs were tasteless and so was the steak!! Hence the price for it lol... I would not be back here unless I wanted a quick bite with no flavor. my friends Chicken wrap was Small and Not tasteful as well. Restaurant environment wasn't bad

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs

hHrjjboE0xdvhjPdio0_cg.text: My group and I ate at Ocean One Grille for breakfast 2 times while we were in Vegas. Breakfast ranged from $6 - $10. The first day our group had omlets and some had bagles with smoked salmon and fruit. Yes, very good and for $10! Good choices and the food was good for the price. One complaint was the toast came cold so the butter didn't melt, but over all good quiet place to start your day. Oh Yes, the service was very friendly and patient.

3xmY61gwGSRECziNfcy20Q.text: well we saw this place walking through the mile shops and of course, my group being cheapos (love y'all but cmon) they jumped on the $5 lunch special..i said we could just go to mcdonalds which, afterwards, they all said we should have but oh well  idk why but i ordered the seared Tuna wrap..at a place like this i was afraid for the fish lol the Wasabe in the wrap was way way way too much, it burned with every bite! it came with "asian coleslaw" which was not good and just regular cole slaw, and when ordering i asked if i could also get the fries to which the waitress said would be included with the $5 meal..but then the bill showed a $1.50 charge for it none of it was good, not much to expect from a restaurant trying to be fancy with a $5 lunch special..  1 star to the friendly staff

4V11TyEwC4IEdWg0BWHkYQ.text: Horrible service. Doesn't even deserve the 1 star I had to chose . We got into the restraunt at about 6pm and left at 720pm on Monday June 19th. we were literally the only people in the restraunt. Food was not made to order, and it took 30 minutes to get. I had to ask our waiter 3 times for our check, and the waiter had to ask us 2 times on how the check was split 2 seperate times in a 5 minute span . while we were waiting, we were watching him serve others while waiting for the check to come to our table. None of the workers have any sense of urgency to make sure customers are okay. We had to ask 2 times get our water refilled. After Waiting 20 minutes to pay for our check, I had to take initiative to ask 3 workers to pay for my check which all 3 told me that they can not help me. The last worker I asked to pay out my bill told me I had to ask my waiter to pay it out. By this point I'm already iratable because of the fact that no one could help me but our waiter. Raising my voice to try to get someone to help me. The manager passes by as I'm raising my voice with his worker and does not even acknowledge me. So I go back to my table as I wait But I see the manager behind the counter on his cell phone. I approached him to address the situation. And all he was able to say is sorry. Not even as a manager did he further assist the situation. We just paid and left which we shouldn't have.

i449uRsZ_VKrWMu2PYMp0A.text: Great atmosphere and welcoming staff. Food was awesome and prices fair. I got the surf and turf, and was able to switch mashed potatoes for mushrooms with garlic scampi butter. Important for me being on Keto diet. The filet mignon was tender. The three drinks for ten bucks was awesome, and again the server modified for my diet, making good suggestions. Again, very happy and enjoyed our special occasion anniversary dinner. Will be back!!

I8e1nLDoONMBKVcbGS6BfA.text: After checking out several options, we checked into Ocean One for its varied menu and drink special. I am glad we did.  The ambiance of the restaurant was wonderful; high end decor and pleasingly quiet to the normal cacophony of noise with most Las Vegas restaurants.  Our server was polite and very knowledge, never over selling the menu but making insightful recommendations.  As for the food....presentation excellent and practical portions of food that left one completely satisfied and tasted excellent.  I would recommend Ocean One to anyone staying at Planet Hollywood or nearby.

K_AChB_2vu16nMXo-lMnlw.text: I can't understand the 3 stars. My food snob fiance and I came here during happy hour. We loved it and our server, Kirsten was awesome! 3 drinks for $10 and good beers for $3 each got us to try it but the food was also very good. All food items were $4.99. We were pleasantly surprised at the portion sizes and taste. The rare ahi tuna wrap was the bomb!! I would definitely come here again!

znxciX5vp9e7BVCEp2rTtg.text: This place is such a hidden gem in Vegas! Me and my gorgeous asian girlfriend lol went here for breakfast and had the two egg platter each and only cost us 10 bucks plus tip!!!!!!! Anyone who's been to Vegas knows food is pricey but this place does it right and for cheap. Also they have a drink special all the time for 3 bucks a draft beer of Stella and other beers on tap. Girlfriend had a pina colada and I had 3 jack and cokes and the bill came to 14 bucks and change . You honestly can't beat it! Best hidden gem ever

5CQPcYWP7OClyKmO95ek1A.text: The location is within the Miracle Mile Mall. They offered a very reasonable prices menu with a decent selection. It was refreshing to see baked chicken, vegetables, and pasta add options versus sandwiches.    I ordered the chicken breast meal for $6.99. I have a lot of allergies, and the staff was very accommodating.  They didn't season any of my food (due to my allergies) but nothing a little lemon juice couldn't fix.    It wasn't spectacular, but it was a healthy option for cheap, which can be challenging to find on the Vegas Strip.

Fg15TiKfEq9TadDFoyR9Zw.text: I was hesitant to come at first because of the 3 star yelp review, but this restaurant was excellent; both in service, value and food. 3 for 1 drinks was a bonus, but also excellent steak and lobster dinners and appetizer I can't believe were so inexpensive and a great atmosphere. Don't pay attention to the existing rating... eat here. You won't regret it.

NgXjX1zUgy31NCJJvHu_Cg.text: 1.  Location--smack dab in the middle of the Miracle Mile Shops (and steps away from the Elara, where we stay).  2.  Price--cannot beat $5 lunches and 3 drinks fro $10 in such a nice location.  3.  Quick service--staff is a little matter of fact, but extremely efficient at turning tables at such a high-volume restaurant (they are not rude by any means, but not as engaging as some eateries).  All in all a great place to enjoy a quick meal and do some people watching away from the sun while in LV.

QDZbViHt1o0m1OA-SIHyww.text: Get what you pay for, and it was cheap.  Had a couple of quick meals here and it suited the purpose of being cheap.  Doesn't really seem to be one particular genre of cuisine, though they also seem to have something for everyone depending on your tastes.

H-ypYtMxU8VKmlsD6AmA9Q.text: Stopped there for breakfast. Waited about 15 min to get a table. The chairs were all ripped. Our waiter took our order, brought us coffee and then disappeared. The coffee was horrible. I can't believe that in this day and age we still have such nasty coffee. My local gas station has better coffee. Menu is fixed. You can not substitute any item. Everything is an add on. Food took forever to be served which is when we saw our waiter again. Food was ok. It's breakfast after all. Nothing to die for.

ncD_V6eKupMvgWXIl9a9nQ.text: I've been here a few times for their breakfast, because their omelettes are terrific and reasonably priced ($8.99).  My only gripe is with the service, which was great last time and terrible this time.  We were pretty much ignored, and the waitress only came by when she absolutely had to.    And it's August in Las Vegas.  You could at least ask if we wanted more water (after we drank all of ours 10 minutes in - she never refilled).    I'll probably go back just because the food is really good.  I'll just cross my fingers that I get a decent server.

IaT5mVXRb24FwQwln-biUw.text: Horrible owner!!!! I work just around the corner of this place they call an establishment me and my co works order here almost 2 to 3 times a week 4 to 7 plate orders to go !! i had the pleasure of meet this ass hole in person they have a system that emails you when your order is ready but if you don't get one it's not there fault so this time I did not get an emailed and thought okay there busy I'll go back to work and wait 45 last I go to check it was ready tadah!!!! I asked JUST for my fries to be replaced and the OWNER said no IT IS WHAT IT IS !! So I kinda laugh cuz I thought he was joking so I said are you SERIOUS yes your fault for waiting 45mins !!! I couldn't believe that this is happening I grab my bag and started to walk out the realized fuck this I don't want this food so o went back and demanded a refund his said it will be refunded and the end of the night it's the day after nothing yet I no it takes sometime to refunded to my card so I'll give him 5 days before I show my face in that HORRILBE establishment and I called 10 times already and no one answers shows how much they care about there business idiots !!!

tx64nsw9QZ6uL8ew2p-ADA.text: Pizza and ambience is nice.  The Almond joy cocktail was a delight, nice and refreshing.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I had to try their pizza and was pleasantly surprised.
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great pizza.
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Almond Joy drink in Vegas.

lLVssTlA0KRLphgEE7tDRw.text: We went for breakfast, and I swear it was more like early lunch by the time we finished. Although they didn't seem particularly busy, they might have been understaffed in the kitchen or on the floor. It took our server many moons between appearances, and it was overall a sloth-like breakfast service.  We were drawn in by the low prices outside and didn't want to insult Vegas by doing McD's on day 1. We figured it couldn't be that bad, and we were right, but it also wasn't that good. There's an array of $6 menu items and a two-for-one drink deal ($10). I chose the mimosa and the mojito; he chose the mimosa and the Almond Joy (overwhelming Kahlua taste).  I had the biscuits & gravy, which were very mediocre. I guess it wasn't a fair choice since I grew up with Southern cooking, and bland gravy is a crime. I splashed Tabasco on to make it more interesting.  Just keep wandering or accept that your meal will be very average and very slow. This is nothing above diner food for breakfast. I think I've had better from IHOP.

kzc5T4UN8Fpk44v8k-Ktlg.text: First off, I'm going to get straight to the point and state this restaurant's service is absolutely horrible.   This was the second time I visited the Ocean One restaurant while being in Vegas, and I recommended the food to others. My first experience was okay, just like any other restaurant, however on my second visit i know I will never be back.   When seated, my group of friends asked for waters, with lemons. Our waitress acknowledged she would bring us lemons, and she didn't. While we waited we finished our waters, and when she finally came by our table, one of us asked her for the lemons. The waitress simply made a "mm" sound as acknowledgement. She brought the lemons a bit later, and by then, our cups of waters were empty.  We then asked her if we could have refills on our drinks, and she again took awhile to refill them. Keep in mind we should not have to keep reminding her for refills when we clearly don't have any water or drinks.   Soon after our orders arrived, and we began to eat. Again, no refills on our waters, and not once did she stop by and ask us how we were doing or if we needed anything. Actually, she didn't even come near us, at all, for us to flag her down.  We talked amongst ourselves and agreed she didn't deserve a good tip, if any. We finished eating and sat at the table, with no bill. We were in no rush to leave, however if we were we clearly wouldn't have been able to since she wasn't checking on us to bring one anyway.  One of our members got up and asked her for our bill, and shortly later she brought it to us. We were upset due to the gratuity being added to each and every ticket in our group, which consisted of approximately 4$. We strongly felt as if she did not deserve that, so again, a member went to an employee and complained about the automatic gratuity, and asked to speak with the manager. The employee then walked over to our waitress, who was in fact the manager.   We were amazed to discover this, due to the service being so horrendous and her not knowing any better on how to manage a restaurant   The manager, who's name was Antonella, be came really snotty and told us there was nothing she could do, and that the gratuity was automatic. We realized there was nothing we could do, so we just told her the service was not worth what we were being forced to tip.      Antonella then replied (without an apology) that it is not her fault and she had a full house.  We looked around and the place was half empty. Free tables everywhere. She then turned her back to us once we pointed this out.   Over all, this was a horrible experience and I will be back.

oUDTgvzpf5O6YKcwg1bqRQ.text: This place was the absolute worst food I have ever had at a restaurant. I had a burger, and the meat tasted worse than what I imagine dog food would taste like.  My wife ordered chicken tacos, how do you screw that up, well they did. Absolutely no flavor and nearly as dry as jerky.  Service was atrocious and our overall experience was the worst ever.  I'm not one to be very harsh in my reviews but im sorry I had no choice this time.  Food presentation is nice but flavor and quality are a different thing altogether.  My advice is to avoid this place and save yourself the headache and cash.

ag8oRsnKIkfarVBAOlE_wg.text: Horroble horrible!! Wish i can give zero stars!!!Not worth the money at all. Service was terrible!!!!! And wouldn't doubt it if they are racists. My boyfriend and i are excellent tippers and we didnt even receive a water.I think they thought we were broke because were young and of color!!! They sat us in the corner and forgot about us!i called one of the waiters over because they were just standing there doing nothing but chitchatting and he acted as if we didn't call him looking around then he looked at us and told a white lady waitress who gave him the "shoo" hand. Horrible after waiting we waked out to Oyster bay right across from them. Much better service and the food is not cheap like this place

CSHLViJmcaOOx0BB0TUW8g.text: Food was amazing, and affordable! Do not hesitate on the steak, and eggs (add cheese for $1 extra)!! The steak was delicious, very tender and delicious. It also came with some potatoes, they were very well seasoned. I can't wait to go back to have this breakfast again. Our waiter was great, quick/responsive. Only thing is when your plate is empty they're snatching it up lol. 5 stars for breakfast. Oh side note mimosas are $12 but you get 3 and you can take them to go. I had regular orange juice and it wasn't good I think it was sunny delight.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious steak &amp; eggs

Z_AF7BN_G9agYWmN8tkLqQ.text: We went here for lunch because we had seen their lunch specials were only $5 and it was nice because we didn't go at lunch rush hour.   We were seated right away, but it was a long wait until any waiter or waitress even acknowledged we were there, but once he did come over and take our drink orders he apologized and asked if we were ready to order food.   The shredded beef tacos were good, too much coleslaw on it and not enough beef, but the flavor was there.   The chicken club sandwich was yummy. Very seasoned chicken and it was juicy. Yay for no dry chicken.   Two people ordered The mahi mahi sandwich and it was good. Nice size piece of fish.   The food was good, you can't beat the price, and the service was ok.

awXuNjUNvd5bG5hBr7-Ldw.text: This is the best place on strip. Strongly recommended. $5 lunch and $10 dinner ( what a deal). The quality of food is truly amazing, quailit of service by the staff 10/10. Staff is super duper nice, cleanness and environment 10/10.   I was skeptical when they said, $5 for lunch, but surprisingly it is awesome. Must go to this pace if you are looking budget food.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JQEsY_CpNJ-zVv6LXYd28w.text: I discovered this place when I used to work at Planet Hollywood it's located inside the mall right by where they have the rainfall. I used to walk by this place because its looks fancy and thought it would be expensive to eat here. Well I was very wrong! Lol  I've never physically ate here so I wouldn't know how the service is. But I have many times placed an order online and let me tell you their food is delicious and the best part it's super affordable $4.32 for a meal! I honestly don't think you will find cheaper here in Vegas not even McDonalds is that cheap at the strip lol.  I place my order online and is always ready in a timely manner. I go pick it up I just say my email name and they hand me my food. Every time I go the restaurant is full so I'm guessing service is good and they also have lunch specials I think it's $5 there still a great price.  If you're tired of spending a lot of money on food check this place out you won't be disappointed and if you are at least it didn't cost you more than $5 lol

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast sandwich with potatoes. Picture might not look good but it trust me it was :)
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast comes with butter &amp; syrup.
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My husbands and my breakfast look at the cost! Can&#39;t beat that :)

FRc9ejpeVdUIiSOFNZCV2g.text: What. A. Steal. 3 for 1 drinks EVERYDAY with name brand spirits (ketel, jack daniels, captain morgan, etc). $5 food items during lunch. And by food items I mean every food item on the menu, from their lollipop wings to their grilled salmon entree.   Came here on a November visit from NYC and was pleasantly surprised. I honestly dont know how they pull this deal off but man it is absolutely unbeatable.   On its own I dont think  the food would warrant me giving ocean grill 5 stars. Dont get me wrong the food is good just not 5 stars good but when I think about how nice our waiter was and the fact I spent $25 got 3 Long Island Ice Teas, 8 lollipop wings and a grilled salmon salad there isnt any other way to rate that but 5 stars.   If youre spending your time like everyone else in "Lost Wages, Nevada" you cant afford to turn down this deal. Its the best deal on the Strip imho.   It was so good I came back 3 hours later to catch the lunch deal one more time before it ended lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wings
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Island salmon salad. Pretty good. Excellent considering I paid $5

QPK8Yg5KQQgyBaCZVRlIfw.text: My roommate and I were excited to eat here! We are locals and always walk by it on our way to our car! But we went here today and the food was not really what we were expecting. It took awhile for us to have our order taken and when we got our food, it was the quality of something that I could've made at home. We also ordered a desert at the end (creme brulee) and it tasted like watered down vanilla pudding. When we were ready for the check, our waiter walked past us about 5 times before stopping and asking if we were done. We ended up leaving the restaurant still hungry. I'm disappointed.

FF1msi3r7D51rN0pZ1aXKg.text: It's located inside the Planet Hollywood Miracle Mile Shops. We arrived at 11:00am.  We were seated right away. Place had seating inside and outside and looked very relaxing.  Great atmosphere. Our server was nice.  I ordered the Two Egg Combo with bacon and house potatoes with the side of pancakes.   My wife ordered the Belgium Waffle with Strawberries and whipped cream and a side of house potatoes.  Did not have to wait to long for our meal to arrive.  Overall breakfast was good.  Just the pancakes were a bit dry.  By that time it was lunch. Lunch starts at 11:30-5pm.  Lunch menus are very reasonable @ $4.99 and Spirit drinks 3 for $10. We decided to try the Crispy Calamari. It was very good!  Great place to hang out!

Y-JMptfFMsa9Ucva1ODWyQ.text: This place was a great find! Good food & great prices. Both eat in and take out. The place was always crowded and the service was attentive. They also had a great 3 drink deal for $10...can't beat that price!

1pkDP2Ac5PBeXCOLdnQ__w.text: Great service. Very flavorful food.  $5 Lunch Menu!! $5 for a proper lunch meal! I was very skeptical and hesitant to try but I'm glad I did. Lots of options like mahi mahi, chicken, grilled salmon, with a side. Good portion size. Proper dine-in restaurant.   Free parking at Planet Hollywood.

Ag_iSGEsvf9DqCXYtg8bMg.text: I ate breakfast here twice in one week.  The first time was fantastic.  I had the smoked salmon plate and was impressed with the amount and quality of the salmon.  Others at my table ordered omelets w/breakfast potatoes and French toast.   Based on this experience I would have given them 5 stars.  Everyone was so impressed that we returned for breakfast again two days later.   Our second outing was totally different.  Everyone's (three people) toast came out cold.  One person at the table asked to have jalapenos added to his cheese omelet. When it came out he asked again if jalapenos had been added and he was assured that they had been.  He cut through the entire omelet and did not find a single jalapeno.  When he pointed this out to the server he was given a small bowl of pickled jalapenos on the side (just sad).  I ordered the biscuit and gravy.  The biscuit was cold under white gravy with no seasoning.  It tasted like flour and milk - not appetizing.  I'm giving them a 3 out of 5 because our first breakfast was so nice, but I can tell you that no one in our group will go here for breakfast again.

XM_R-LQDcGET5FW_fGhTmg.text: Love this place!  Prices are great, drinks are good, and service is quick. Perfect combo! Stopped to get a warm goat cheese salad to go at 4:45pm and paid the $5 lunch price for it. Bartender said it would take 10 minutes so I decided to try their 3 for $10 drink special while I wait. Strawberry gin...delicious! By the time I gulped that down, my salad came and I went straight for my second drink: Paradise punch. Also good!  For cheap drinks, they pack the right punch.  Took my third drink (Almond Joy) to go.  This spot makes me love Vegas! Viva Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Almond joy
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Paradise punch
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry gin lemon drop.

nRriVgwtIB3wS60QHLajXA.text: While this place has pretty good food and the pricing is good if you don't want to spend too much on breakfast. The service on the other hand is totally unacceptable. My husband and I stopped in for the third day in a row. Every last bartender overlooked us. Waited on folks to the left and right of us. When one customer tried to tell her that we had a question she ignored that and proceed to tell him about last night's chill with balsamic added. When we spoke to her she said you are free to flag me down. Now what would you like to drink. I spoke to the manager who seems to be obvious to what is taking place behind the bar when he was standing behind the bar. If i could give them less than one star I would. Before this I was a fan of this place and would have recommended them to all. Now I will not recommend to anyone. Customer service is not hard folks.

nS-cHnveXJRyqic2u5uu-Q.text: Great price for good food.  Affordable drinks too. Service was good.  Restaurant was clean.  They always have specials.

LQVbibDjwKXzggNNvmB_NA.text: This was a first.  With only 4 others at the whole bar and 3 bartenders working, I sat there for 10 minutes without being acknowledged or offered  a menu.  I stood up and walked out to the greeter, told her what happened and she said 'oh, sorry must be a bad day'.  I have never wanted a negative rating on Yelp more in my life.

cRu37akHARSzjLHv0211cA.text: Go eat here when in Vegas! Where else can you eat for $5.99??? It does get crowded at noon so I suggest getting there at least by 1130 so you aren't waiting. Great selection of food and super fast service. Awesome happy hour!

rZQ8ueh8ufVkV2xNqyBrvA.text: Fantastic location right inside the mall and the specials are excellent. Great deals if you come at the right time, so be aware of that. Our server said she couldn't even understand why the prices were so low! The bang-to-buck ratio is solid at this place. Food quality is also decent, in addition to their pleasant atmosphere. Service was prompt and friendly, definitely a highly recommended location!

CYpf4NFSzow5F5HPBCkqgQ.text: This was a great find in an over-expensive sea of casino restaurants! I had seared ahi teriyaki and it was cooked perfectly. Great fried rice too, and I usually don't eat all the rice. Half the price of other places.

1A1Y5h7gk3Wp_AnCk03TNw.text: Go here for cheap lunch and drinks and you won't be disappointed.   4.99 meals and 3 for 1 drinks until 4p.  My lady and I had an appetizer, a meal each and enjoyed 2 drinks while we dined with one drink to go for $38!   Bang for the buck!

uJRubSwCAs2PmJPfxDfw1g.text: You cannot go wrong here. All lunches are $4.99 and the food is good. It's not gourmet, fancy food, but it's good & well worth the money. The drinks are 3-$10 which can't be beat. The service was good and the decor is inviting. If you're in Vegas & you're tired of spending a lot of money at the Strip restaurants, this is the place for you! It's in the Miracle Mike Shops and a nice place to walk around.

eGDFg_8oquRau6zoBeYGqw.text: I am a Las Vegas local. My friends and I frequent this bar for the drink special. You can't beat 3 top shelf cocktails for $10! The old staff was great, they have a whole new staff now. TERRIBLE!!   Last night I took a friend of mine visiting. The girl behind the bar took about 3 to 5 minutes to greet us. Mind you, she saw us when we walked up because her and the bar back were cleaning the area for us to sit there.   So it took her 5 minutes to not greet us...she finally came over... what can I get you...I ordered my usual, she looked confused when I said 3 for $14 (Jameson is $14). She said okay and walked away. Didn't acknowledge my friend, didn't ask her if she wanted anything, how the special works, is this your first time, asked if we wanted to eat....NOTHING.   Keep in mind I get 3 drinks... to order them we had to happen to catch her walking by, repeating EXCUSE ME EXCUSE ME EXCUSE ME ... she never came to check on us, never asked if I was ready for my next drink, if we need anything else. She just seemed bothered by our presence.   I'll go back because I like the place but I dont like the new bartenders!

5Go9Eg-d3EaVzgrnPTlu6Q.text: My wife and were celebrating our 31st Anniversary in Las Vegas and we stayed at the Elara Hilton Grand Vacations. This restaurant was our first stop after arriving to Vegas for dinner. We were very hungry after getting off the plane and finally making it to our hotel.   This restaurant has great food & reasonable pricing. Our Waiter "Olsin Mejia" was not very polite or accommodating, he took our order and walked away without any communication. Another waiter brought our food out and promised to return & bring us ketchup & mayo. After waiting patiently for about 3-5 minutes while our food was getting cold, I finally flagged down another waiter and told her what we needed, she walked to a nearby cash register and gave us the squeeze out mayo and ketchup that is usually for to go orders. Wow!   If OLSIN MEJIA comes to your table suggest another waiter so that you can enjoy you meal and not have to wonder about what did you do or say to him to receive poor service. I asked my wife if there is one word to describe how she felt after OLSIN'S Service? She responded with the word "DEVALUED!" HE SEEMED BITTER TOWARDS US FOR NO APPARENT REASON. He never smiled or said thank you not once, not even when he brought us our check. As if to say "I don't need your tip!" My wife and I have a policy that whoever serves us always receive a tip and we consider ourselves generous tippers when we served. Poor service reaps a poor tip and good service receives a good tip etc. But everyone get's a tip.   We decided to give this restaurant another try a few days later for breakfast, ANNA our waiter was GREAT.. Patient and very suggestive with our menu. She continued to come back and check on us and she made you feel welcome and valued. I am so glad we returned. This restaurant would have received (5) stars if not for the terrible treatment from OLSIN MEJIA. Either he doesn't like his job or he doesn't like people period.

YM-jPuyssCcO9yuUlGgCpw.text: I can't say that this place is horrible and I can't say this place amazing... so it deserves three-stars.  To get straight to the point, the lunch deal at this place is surreal. $5 lunch?! I mean what a DEAL. They have a great selection to choose from considering it's only $4.99! The food quantity they give you is actually pretty decent, enough to kind of fill you up, kind of. The pasta dishes in my opinion probably are the best deal or the burgers. The pasta is filling and a good portion.   Flavor-wise, the food is seasoned well and actually yummy. I loved considering the meal was so cheap. The alcohol here, is also a great deal but if you've been drinking since 7 AM like I was it's a bit too much alcohol. I mean 3 drinks for $10. Definitely screaming alcohol poisoning (lol kidding, but it's a lot considering the three drinks can't be shared). It's also great that the $10 on alcohol cover a variety between cocktails, beer, wine, and liquor.   Food comes out pretty quick and drinks come out quick too, so if you're hungry you really don't have to wait that long for your food to come out. Which is a plus, sort of.   The downside as to why this place earns three-stars? The wait for a table is ridiculous. On a weekday this place was packed and we had to wait about 20-25 minutes. There was no place to sit while waiting. Quality of the food is good but also disappointing because you can tell they make their food well in advance, or in large batches. My pasta dish was flavorful don't get me wrong but the pasta was all clumped together and definitely over cooked.   Another downside was that their appetizer which were their chicken wings, stated it came with eight (8) pieces on the menu but when they brought it out, it came with only five (5). I wouldn't mind only getting 5 pieces if the menu said it was going to come with 5, because I legit was looking forward to having two pieces since our group was four. The wings also weren't really what you'd think chicken wings to be, they were more like chicken lollipops. But nevertheless, good.   The tacos my friend got apparently "were the worst chicken tacos ever. The chicken wasn't even shredded but instead was a boiled chunk of chicken. Disgusting" is what was said about them, so save your money, the tacos aren't worth it.   Overall, if you want cheap priced food, this is the place to go. Food is cheap, drinks are cheap and this is a place to go if you want to get a good buzz going. This place gets three-stars but I definitely could see myself coming here again for a decent meal, especially if I have a half-hour or so to kill.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decent sized Orechiette Pasta Primavera with Shrimp -- aside from clumped up pasta that&#39;s over cooked, this was a pretty flavorful dish.

G2eElVc5yoO_HQwQ8whJ0g.text: I take a girls trip to Vegas every year, and this is our #1 brunch spot. We eat here multiple times throughout our trip because the food is delicious and some of the most affordable you'll find in Vegas. We've been coming here for the last five years. You can't beat the three for $10 drinks and inexpensive brunch menu.   Their fried potatoes are my favorite thing on the menu. The breakfast croissant, two eggs breakfast, and biscuits and gravy are delicious too. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Croissant with bacon instead of ham, with potatoes and a side of fruit

55WNQXc9nBygKe2qNUeEog.text: Heard that this place had a decent burger and decided to check it out. This place has indoor seating as well as outdoor. And by outdoor, it's pretty much tables set outside of the restaurant, since you're still inside the Miracle Mile Shops building.   We were shown to our table quickly and given menus. After placing our order of Grilled Chicken Club Sandwich, Half Pound Sirloin Burger, and the Grilled Atlantic Salmon, we eagerly awaited our food to come. It took a bit of time to arrive, which was a bummer because we were hungry!   The Chicken Club was pretty good and came with crunch fries. The Sirloin Burger was decent. I don't think there was anything too special about that; a pretty standard burger. The Salmon was good, but the rice it came with was not fully cooked.   Overall, the food was decent. The favorite was the Chicken Club: it was nice and juicy.

jHlFH0mLLSYGJQQavSZdgg.text: Oof. This was a rough go for sure. We came in before the Gwen Stefani show and it was moderately busy. Sit down restaurant in the Miracle Mile shopping area of Planet Hollywood hotel/casino. Very loud.   The wait time was not bad for a Friday night. When we were seated, however, our table was literally in front of exit doors and a server station. We were jostled, and bumped quite a bit. We ordered salads: Cobb for myself, chicken Caesar for hubby. We got our order fairly quickly, but no silverware. When we asked for silverware we were told the hostess was supposed to bring us silverware. We asked three different people for silverware. When our waiter finally brought silverware to our table there was no apology, but rather he stated "if you have a problem, talk to the manager." So, we did. The manager apologized and told us they were out of silverware. Super sigh.   The food was decent tho, in spite of the crap ambiance, the terrible service, and the lack of silverware to eat a freaking salad with.

f5feWGn65Fgz9UhkFOtbhg.text: I heard of this place from Tangerine Travels on YouTube and boy am I glad I did!! My husband and I went there for lunch and everything on the menu was $4.99!  We started out with the hot spinach artichoke dip and chips. It was so good! Creamy, warm with a lot of spinach and chopped artichokes.   Next came tacos. My husband ordered the beef tacos and I ordered the chicken.  The beef tacos were flavorful and delicious. The chicken tacos weren't so great. The chicken wasn't shredded and it was dry and cold. After one taco, I sent it back and they kindly took it off my bill. You get 3 tacos and a side dish for $4.99.   I ordered the orecchiette pasta and it was AMAZING!! The lemon garlic sauce is creamy and so tasty!! The tomato's were a mixture of Roma and Heirloom. They were bursting with flavor!!   The restaurant was busy, but efficient. We were seated right away and our waitress was prompt, friendly and accommodating.   I highly recommend this place. You cannot find this quality of food on the Las Vegas Strip for such a bargain price.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our fantastic lunch!! Beef tacos, chicken tacos, spinach artichoke dip &amp; Orechiette Pasta Primavera!

ey9U29XH3SYIXzlVspdxkg.text: Absolutely blown away.   I've walked past this place countless times and today finally went in for lunch.  $5 lunch items!  All of them!!!   $3 import beers. Crazy selection of cocktails for 3-$10  The food was excellent.  We had the tuna app  and salmon and a magi sandwich.    A MUST DO

xynsv01W3R7BaIPa7TcxVQ.text: This place is a go to for lunch! My friend told me there is this place that serves $5 lunch dishes every single day. So I had to try this place out.  There was a ton of people outside the restaurant when we got there, but the line kept moving so we didn't even wait that long.  When we sat down, it took a while for our server to take our order or acknowledged us. We noticed the people who sat down after us was already being served. After meeting our server, we saw how many tables he was helping so we let it slide. He was so helpful the entire night and made sure we were taken care of, they we gave him a 30% tip!  What we ate:  1. Calamari - Hmm... The calamari had some kind of marinara sauce on the bottom of the bowl. I think to add some color. I never had them like this. The calamari became a bit to soggy since it was sopped in that sauce, but we can't complain because it was only $5.  2. Artichoke Dip and Chips - The artichoke dip was good. The quality was like what you get from Applebee's. I think it may have been sitting there a little too long because it didn't look melty or cheesy. But again, $5.  3. Steak Quesadilla - My husband's favorite. It came with a bit of sour cream, guacamole, and salsa on the side. He didn't need it because he says it was already flavorful.  4. Cheeseburger - The cheeseburger was nice and juicy, but my only complaint would be the cheese on top. It was a perfect square so you know they took it out of that krafts clear plastic wrap and three the processed cheese on top.  5. Penne Pasta - The penne Pasta was just ok. There wasn't much flavor in the pasta sauce. But again, only $5.  6. Steak - My husband enjoyed his steak, but didn't really care if the veggies and mashed potatoes.  Everything was good for $5. We would definitely come back to try the other things on the menu. I think we got a little too much for two because we got judging eyes from the other tables. Lol! They don't know foodies until you become a foodie!

PtVCW3otwNT5fcriuTY1KQ.text: This is the best place to get affordable food in Vegas. Everything on the menu is $5 for lunch and almost all of the drinks are either 3 for $10 or less than $5.  The service, however, is terrible. I don't completely blame them since they're so busy, but we had to wait for over 20 minutes for a table (party of 6, but a party of 8 got sat immediately even though they arrived 15 minutes after we did, and when I asked about it, they said bigger parties are given preference).  Once we sat down, it was at least another 15 minutes before our server came and everything from then on was super slow. Appetizers and entrees were out before our first round of drinks made it out, it took forever to get our checks, we weren't given straws for the frozen drinks ordered (one of my colleagues tried drinking hers from the glass and it wouldn't budge, until it all came crashing on her face), and we waited at least 10 minutes between finishing appetizers and receiving entrees.  So if you want affordable food and have 2.5 hours to waste on a subpar lunch, this is your spot. (Tbh, I'd come back just because of the prices in contrast to the rest of the Strip, but if I found another affordable place nearby, I would never come back)

NkpM3z3HIsotku1mPQr7rQ.text: We came here as a party of 7 and I liked it here a lot. We waited about 20 minutes to be seated and there were many people also waiting to dine. At first I was a little worried about how the food here could be so inexpensive, especially for a restaurant on the strip. They have a large sign on the front advertising their $5 lunch menu and I think that brought lots of shoppers in.  I was pleasantly surprised!! I ordered the Caribbean Mahi Sandwich with fries and it was yummmy but just a little dry. The fries are soooo good. I also ordered a strawberry daiquiri and I can't believe it was only $3! My friends really enjoyed their food as well. This place is such a great restaurant to eat at if you happen to be on the strip. As a local I'm never on the strip but I will definitely remember this place the next time I'm nearby. It is good food and drinks at fast food prices!

tsZ6lYXfuFyYbkLlQGfq3A.text: The price is right and portions are bigger than I imagined.  Service and draft beers got only $3 each.  This place is great for a quick meal that won't break you wallet.  The only small problem is sometimes their computer system goes out and you have to wait up to 30 min to take your order.

S0Vkv-jJhAwswnmPzlteSg.text: Bad food, worse service, no explanations. Take my money, add the gratuity and don't worry about service. Don't come here. It's really convenient, but you'll wait for.ev.er for your cold food and the server won't bother coming to ask how it was.

mbL_mFNQV7C1jSDX2YpGyg.text: I had been walking by this place for years. I heard about the $5 lunch plates and came here 2 days in a row. The seared ahi plate is a must try so is the goat cheese salad. The burger plate is surprisingly good. It's not Gordon Ramsey but it's better than most fast food options and much cheaper!  Plus 3 drinks for $10 means tou can have an amazing lunch. I found my new lunch spot in Vegas!

MDkHDcgp93emR3es-yVDMA.text: I was so intrigued by the $5 lunches and many youtube las vegas videos recommended this place. I looked it up on yelp and of course this place has mixed reviews, I notice that tends to happen with AYCE or places where you're getting the best deal you can. People have really high expectations and get mad disappointed.  Alright, so lets talk real fast: The food was really amazing for the deal. This food wasn't like life changing but it reminded me of a quality outing at your local restaurant chain... but even better because its only $5. I couldn't complain.  We got the following:  Calamari - People complained about this being undercooked but mine was super crispy and delicious. Tuna Tartare - A smaller dish but I really liked it. For the portion, I felt very satisfied. Had a lot of avocado, yum! Ocean One Wings - Sweet and sticky wings, they were slightly crispy and hit the spot. My boyfriend enjoyed them. Orecchiette Pasta - This was a huge portion for $5! Pretty delicious with a light cream sauce that wasn't too heavy. Salmon - Okay I'm always skeptical of salmon but heard this was pretty good. My boyfriend who rarely orders salmon and hates dry salmon really liked it. It's better than places that serve dry salmon for $17. A great value.  Was this the best most life changing gourmet food? No! Did this hit the spot and keep our wallet happy? Yes!  We ate at the bar and the service wasn't bad but it wasn't the best excellent. They were super busy and everyone at the bar was rushing around, cleaning, taking checks, etc. They were in between changing shifts so it got a little hard for people to order. Honestly I didn't mind. for a $5 food, the servers were attentive enough and got my orders in a decent time. You could tell they were hard working and just trying to get everyones orders in.  Also, I'll definitely come back here if I stay close by, the freakin cocktail deals are amazing. $10 for 3 cocktails (all day) and you can take it to go! I wasn't in the mood to drink but the $3 frozen slush was too good to pass up. If you want to, you can even walk up and ask to buy drinks to go. I noticed a lot of takeout orders as well, I might try that for their lunch deal next time!! Amazing.  My advice is to come in with low expectations and just remember that you're getting a deal. I was pleasantly happy and very full.

IWaMkXO1vLLdMu0WZwca0w.text: This is a great find on the strip! Decent lunch at $5 can't be beat.  We had a large group, and were seated in about  15 minutes. Nice thing they have is scrolling screen out front with your name and how long you have waited.  Folks had pasta, burger, wings, salmon, mahi sandwich, lava cake, and 3 cocktails for $10. Everyone liked their meal. I had the salmon salad with rice and beans (pictured). Nice piece of salmon on bed of greens. Perfect size for a reasonable lunch. Easy credit card pay with their mobile square devices.   We were chatting, but they have some great TVs if you want to watch the game.   Located in the miracle mile shops connected to Planet Hollywood.  On this visit service was really good, but have had mediocre service on other visits. But for quality  $5 lunch on the strip,  can put up with mediocre service.

The food OK but not worth it for the long wait.  This place seems very unorganized.  With all the options in Vegas one would not need to settle for this.

FM8B-RFuoRaTlVONdtgcdg.text: Wow this place is amazing! if you're looking for great food and drinks at great prices you gotta go here! The lunch specials are $5 and 3 for $10 drinks all day everyday. It doesn't get better than this especially for it being on the strip. Plus the service is good. Try this place you won't be disappointed. We've been back atleast once a week since we discovered this gem!

Lunch is $4.99 can't go wrong for that price but aside from that the taste was delicious! So far my favorite in Vegas!

bAobpHIy_kBkP5g6rfDAmQ.text: We had a great light dinner after the show. Our server Stephan was very professional and attentive. I would highly recommend this for a quick late night meal. Nothing fancy but very quick to get our food. The food was hot and came out quick.

BAsC1GF01t4gOwUzDawtXQ.text: The food and service was great! The servers were really friendly. The steaks were delicious and the portions were filling. We ate dinner there and the drink deals were amazing. You get three drinks per person for only $10 bucks. The beers were only $3 bucks too.   Breakfast was good too! The steak and eggs were great. lRCBiOIqNdcwHhBBx00qIg.text: You can't go wrong with $4.99 lunch on the strip in Vegas! I stopped by years ago and the prices are still the same!  The food is pretty good for $5. People who say the food is terrible are expecting too much! It's $5 for a sit-down, hot meal in Vegas- come on people! The ambiance is nice and the restaurant is clean.  I got the Chicken Cesar Salad and my husband got the steak dish. We shared a calamari appetizer as well. We were both very satisfied with our food and service.  I highly encourage you to stop by and grab a quick meal because you can't get a better lunch deal anywhere else in Vegas!  We will be back!

Oceans One has this amazing 4.99 meal for lunch and three for 10 drinks!!!! It's places like this that make my long hrs in the salon and car while worth it to play on the strip!!!! The food is always in point along with the services!!! Coming to Vegas? Then you have to eat at this wonderful place!!!

I expected a dip in quality or portion size, but I was pretty satisfied with my salmon salad, which was worth way more than $5.  My MIL liked her pasta just fine.  It wouldn't impress an Italian, but again, $5!  My husband got the chicken wings and portabella burger.  He polished both off without a complaint.  It's amazing that we were paying these prices for sit down service.  It's the best deal on the strip that I know of.

7Z5NqVSffqIJgc4PB_EiVA.text: Seriously, the go to place when we are in Vegas. The prices can't be beat. The first time we were here, it was dead so I was pretty scared. Lunch prices are $4.99. How can that be beat? My BF will usually get the buffalo wrap. The first time here, I got the salmon and surprisingly it was quite good.   The last time we were here. It was packed everytime we walked by and sometimes there's a line. They also have really good drink specials. The service can be sometimes slow but, for the most part, they are on it. It's in Planet Hollywood.

MrCCEGUXuhremmlo0FLHNQ.text: I was going to a show last night and Ocean One Bar and Grille popped up on Groupon and I got one.  I have walked around the Miracle Mile Shops looking at the menus of various places, but until now, I hadn't eaten in this area.  The Groupon gave me the excuse to go.  I had a reservation for 5 PM, unneeded as it turned out.  I looked at the menu while my server, Tracy, brought my iced tea.  For a starter, I ordered the sesame tuna.  It was  5 pieces of tuna, previously seared and arranged on a bed of seaweed salad with wasabi cream and pickled ginger topping the salad.  The tuna was dry.  It was just stored too long before being used.  The plating was certainly nice but the dryness was very noticeable.  For the main, I ordered the filet, cooked blue.  The server returned from another table and checked with me to make sure that's what I wanted before putting the order in to the kitchen.  See the photo to see that it was cooked the way I wanted it.  A plus vote for that.  Along with the filet were some mashed potatoes and some yellow and green squash stings with carrot strings.  The vegetables were very good--crisp and not overdone.  For dessert, I got the Peanut butter cheesecake.  It was good and had a nice peanut butter flavor.    Overall, the meal was OK.  I'm glad I tried it once but I probably wouldn't come back.  I was disappointed with the tuna appetizer.  Without the Groupon, the dinner would be very similar in pricing to some of the steakhouses at Strip hotels.  There are better choices with nicer atmospheres.

Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cooked correctly.

TMKpbfYexKbK8VgXZrD43Q.text: so you get what you pay for. $5 lunch items. score! the goat cheese salad is amazing. however its not goat cheese its like herbed cream cheese. the orrechette pasta is good too. generous portion sizes. the 3 stars is for service. the girls purposely ignored me. plus they gave 3 drinks for $10. the weakest moscow mule ive ever had. dont expect a tip if u dont provide service. the drinks were generic and didnt have a good selection of liquor. id come back just get the salad

KakhVSPH4OxUEpdOPSYylQ.text: Start with the price.  Everything is $5 and it's not bad at all.  In fact, given my expectations, the service, speed, and food were quite good.  During our stay we ate at many overpriced restaurants that offered lots of noise, crowded dining rooms, and poor service.  At least here my expectations were exceeded.

NO_oREdBwhm2XbVOH0GtPQ.text: Found this place on the hunt for the brewery.  Great service, great food for lunch (11:30 to 5:00 pm) $5, long list of menu items for this price.and great premium drink special 3 drinks for $10 (all day every day) We ordered  the Greek Chicken salad, marinated flank steak and cheeseburger with fries. My partner commented that his flank steak was very tender and more than satisfied with his serving size. My salad was delicious and a generous serving size. The cheeseburger was a good portion size. The drinks are all premium liquor and very well made.  We will definitely be back.

Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JbmyDFMf24icCXEQ3dbP-w.text: So my honey and I tried this place out today for lunch very happy with the lunch menu everything is $4.99 drinks are 3 for $10. He had the Mahi tacos you get 3 per order and you get your choice of his side he chose chips and salsa, we had calamari to share was good except for the fact that they put it on top of the sauce where that should be on the side and I had the herb crusted chicken chop with mashed potatoes house veggies and natural ajus very very tasty for dessert he had the cheesecake with strawberries and whipped cream he said it was rather dry I had the molten chocolate lava cake oh my goodness for $4.99 totally worth it super moist, sweet cake with strawberries and whipped cream the drinks I did have were the Blue Hawaiian very good the purple hooter all so yummy and the Hawaiian Cosmopolitan very good and for everything we got $41 not bad not bad at all I will come back for sure
