Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bad sour cream and salsa

9t8t1dEybfSdsbPTG-pzuw.text: In Vegas it's hard to find a cheap filling meal but ocean one hit the spot. They have a huge lunch menu with every item only $4.99. The food definitely exceeded what I thought I would receive. Our first trip there I got the flank steak and my boyfriend got the salmon. Both were delicious. They also have frozen drinks for only $3. We tried the margarita, pina colada and the strawberry daiquiri. They were all good. Our second trip I got the spaghetti and my boyfriend got the tacos, he loved them. If you're looking for a good cheap meal this is the place to come

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vhJQwDBNEdfUZ83iaGr80A.text: Amazing budget lunch. $4.99 for everything on the lunch menu? Wow.   The food isn't anything spectacular on its own, but when you realize you only paid $5 for it? It's amazing. I had the burger and quesadilla. Both well made and delicious. No, nothing unique or special about them besides the price. But this place will absolutely be my go-to lunch spot when I'm looking for a budget meal.

a_WPtBUgLzbVwlTeD-VZLg.text: Just touched down in Vegas and was looking for a bite to eat while inside the Miracle Mile Mall inside Planet Hollywood. Came upon this place when we couldn't decide what to eat. My fiance ordered a a salad that had a really good dressing on it! So delicious. I ordered a mozzarella arugula salad and upon getting it, it was my surprised there were 4 leaf arugula on there lol. But there was large sliced pieces of tomato and mozzarella. Maybe that's just how it's suppose to be , I never had a salad like this before and I did added steak it as well for some protein. Still a very delicious salad but I wasn't very full.

w1Z0pnXoKzfueXhByV1KUA.text: Horrible. Went yesterday night and the service is just sad. Our table ordered three burgers and every single one we received was wrong. Also my burger buns were burnt. The Pina colada ordered had no alcohol in it. We ordered nachos and the cheese was underneath the chips. They never gave us napkins or silverware and we had to ask for it several times. Waiter couldn't understand the most basic way to split the check 2 ways. It was only a table of four. Prices aren't worth all the issues we had. We should have been comped in some way for the food being so mixed up. Do yourself a favor and don't go here.

eP0gick_hfP9Khfg8b7ebA.text: This place has 3 for 1 cocktails at $10. I was truly skeptical about the quality and quantity of the drinks. I ordered Tito's Handmade Vodka, club soda, lemon and lime. I couldn't believe for me and my friend our total bill for 6 regular sized drinks and one chicken salad was only $27. What is there to complain about?? A must go to!! I'll be back whenever I'm in Vegas. This is a gem of a find especially if your are on a budget.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PoBdH3gwurJPWun3BL1d4A.text: This restaurant is awesome, in the strip of las Vegas, inside the mall, prices are unbelievably cheap, food is really good, we recommend it to anyone who's looking for a good deal

HXAx4Yq8Ws7OpsOnn5YvBQ.text: What they lack in service they compensate in price. Host was extremely rude. At host stand, he was checking his Apple Watch when I came up & said "I'm here to pick up food." He continues to look through his Apple Watch & then looks up when he's done to finally acknowledge me. He asks for my name & said it wasn't ready. I told him I received a TEXT saying my food was done. I get computers glitch, whatever, but DAMNNNN don't be rude.   & My portion of calamari was wayyy smaller than usual. & my quesadilla was fucking burnt.    I think that was the last straw. I refuse to give any more money to a shitty establishment.

LRFrYKzHHnEvs_pOuu9XzQ.text: Located inside the mall of Planet Hollywood. Lots of seating available. Good vibe of the restaurant with good lighting and TVs.   I ordered a spinach mushroom omelette. It was alright. It wasn't fluffy or airy. It needed more cheese or garlic or something. It comes with a side of crispy fried potatoes and bread of your choice. I don't think I'd order this again.   But the main reason my party came in is because of the 3 drinks for $10 deal!! But we soon found out that this deal is strictly for one person. You can't share your three drinks with anyone! They are totally trying to get you drunk and have you gamble haha! But there is another list of drinks that are $3  and kinda strong. They are really sweet especially the watermelon one. Of course it's not real watermelon! The pina colada and strawberry daiquiri were my favs.  I'd come here again but only for the drinks! Clink clink!!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EaDHAMwNwvbW0nf6tzIo6Q.text: Surprisingly good food. Sports style bar and restaurant located in the Miracle Mile shops between Paris and New York hotels, it was steady busy. Atmosphere is like a sports bar. I had the grilled salmon with jasmine rice and the capri salad. Both were very good, as was the bloody Mary. Prices were reasonable - paid about $50.00 for one. The reason why I was surprised is that it just looks like a regular sports bar with bar food. But it was better. I recommend if you don't want to pay a lot in Vegas and still eat good food.

lB2eWwNLk49L4ByE7HjKLQ.text: Brought a large group of 17 here for dinner last night.   Happily surprised with the low prices and the great clean ambiance of the room.   Wait staff was super friendly and very accommodating for separate receipts for all. We enjoyed apps of calamari (very fresh), artichoke dip (bland but fine) and mussels (delish!). I ordered the creamy polenta (very bland) and the filet.  The filet was perfectly cooked and had sides of julienned veggies and mashed potatoes.   Most drinks are 3 for $10 and includes decent brands and plenty of alcohol.  It is in the Miracle Mile shops and I highly recommend!

Rp6_OT81K8WbuPWbkGS8hw.text: We went this evening wanted to do $5 lunch menu but it ends at 5 so had dinner. Waitress didn't catch her name seemed not that friendly, perhaps she was having a bad day. Ordered nachos, so good. I got the chicken caesar salad (added chicken) and husband got margarita pizza. Portions are good size, the chicken I felt wasn't fresh idk very thin and dry. While we were there a women sitting across from us flipped a table smashing glasses and yelling expletives . It was just a bizarre scene but hey it's Vegas.

FyTm7AJ42vcYWl1UVXHoww.text: You can't beat the overall value, our service was great too. Arrived at 10am plenty of seating, we chose to sit at the bar, obviously, to take advantage of the drink specials.  I ordered a 8oz Sirloin and Spanish Omelet, both were cooked perfectly.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 8oz sirloin and Spanish Omlet

4AzkbwbG0AAtsGesQs2KKA.text: This was our first meal in Las Vegas after checking into the Hilton. I ordered the Cajun pasta and my husband ordered the  cheeseburger. We also ordered the Cajun Rock Shrimp Egg Rolls with Caesar side salads. Our appetizer plates were thrown on table, but maybe they slipped? The egg roll appetizers were good but things went south after that. The side salads had NO taste and got served on warm plates. The bun on my husband's burger was thinner than sliced bread, the meat was dry and he was only able to stomach a couple of bites. I LOVE Cajun pasta and this was THE worst pasta I've ever had, I took a few bites and left the rest alone. For a bar and grill restaurant I should've known better than to order a pasta dish. That being said, the burger at a bar and grill should've been the best thing on the menu. There was lipstick on my husband's glass that we didn't see it until after the fact!!!! We normally go to a restaurant a couple of times before we write them off, but a lessoned was learned the very first time for this place. We should've left when people turned to look as the appetizer plates hit the table. BTW go here if you want the waitress to watch over your shoulder as you fill in the tip!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cajun Chicken Pasta.
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheeseburger. Doesn&#39;t it look yummy?
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Receipt for meal.

t5yH_dWZWGo13Sicpa0_pA.text: I would suggest coming here for the drinks, not the food. They have for 3 for $10 cocktails all the time!! The drinks are great and are not watered down. We ordered a couple appetizers during lunch time so they were only $4.99. Cant complain there! We got the spinach & artichoke dip and the wings which were not amazing, but not bad. The wings were crispy and on a stick which made them easy to eat without making a mess. The chips and the spinach and artichoke dip wasn't the best but better than like Applebee's. Service was very friendly! I will come back here!

yfvb6BYFXTEXbYcsrsZVCQ.text: Located in the Miracle Mile Shopping area, this was a great find while visiting LV.  I stay at the Elara Hilton and this is only a few steps away from the lobby.  Beautiful decor and fantastic service are a given.  What surprised me were the amazingly low prices and the quality of the food was far above what I was expecting.  One morning I decided to splurge and get the steak and eggs.  Typically this would be a low expectation meal so I got the A1 steak sauce ready.  The steak was cooked perfectly and was seasoned just right.  No steak sauce required here, it was fantastic.  In fact - the person sitting next to me asking me if it was as good as it looked (it was!).    Drinks are 3 for $10 and hey use top shell liquor.  Don't waste your money on Fat Tuesday's - Ocean has $3 frozen drinks.  Unbelievable.    Another great find in Vegas.  I'll definitely be back!!

krXJLJkoeZuOQGLNyFKE0g.text: At this point, I have eaten from here way too many times to count! First of all, if you like a deal come here! RUN don't walk! lol I recommend the pastas or any of the $3.99-$5 deals. Where else can you get a perfectly delicious and simple steak lunch or salmon salad for that price on the strip???? No place I have discovered yet! My absolute go to is their orecchiette pasta. It is on the $3.99 menu which btw is monday-friday 11am-11pm. AND you can order out! Just pick up at the front desk and they send you an alert when its ready. The pasta has artichoke hearts, tomatoes, grilled chicken and a bunch of other yummy stuff with a creamy sauce. The portion is enough for two people. I have eaten half for dinner and saved the other half for lunch the next day.  Another deal of they have are the $5 deals which has an option for everyone. Lastly, the 3 drinks for $10 deal. I know a few of my yelp friends that would tear this deal DOWN! Not only is there a nice selection to choose from(wine, beers, mixed bevs or make your own) you can take the third drink with you! Yes! you heard me correctly, the restaurant is nice enough to give you a sippy cup for your third drink!   We have ordered out from here and sat inside at a table or at the bar. Great atmosphere, lots of tvs to watch games and friendly staff all around. I didn't give 5 stars because I have had their quesadilla which was was meh and so were the fish tacos. Other than those items everything else has been great. I highly recommend coming here if you're on a budget and need food/drink.

V8yj8s1mRppi7EolcqIQ_g.text: We came here on a Friday around 2pm and there was no wait for a table. The manager was super helpful and accommodating. When I told her I couldn't eat here because of all the seafood and the fact that I was deathly allergic, they let me bring my own food in so that I could still eat with my friends.  The specials here are almost too good to be True. Their entire food menu is only $5. This includes steak, burgers, seafood, you name it. All 3 of my friends ordered the burger and it even came with their choice of a side.  And the drinks are incredibly cheap. You can get any 3 drinks for $10 (they don't allow you to share with other people though so you have to drink all 3 yourself). But still, this was such a good deal considering you could order cocktails, wine, and champagne and mix and match. They also let you take your drinks to go in case you can't finish them all.  Seriously this place is a best kept Vegas secret since none of us had heard of it before, but I will definitely be sure to check it out next time I come back.

ZM46plQkNiY_-ZRURxIvxA.text: I told the waitress that the spinach and artichoke dip was not good and she tried to argue me down that it was and told me that I could change and then came back and told me that I couldn't it took her 20 minutes to check on me for me to even tell her that the food wasn't good and then you have the nerve to argue me down just great prices but if it doesn't taste good then that's not my problem.

D9UbDqXMp-xCanH1kQuKUA.text: Enjoyed the salmon dinner with wine. Reasonably priced meal in the mall. Chocolate lava cake with ice cream was delish!

3wN0_sFcKsoOcdTZ4HO-MQ.text: Stopped in after a show around 10:30 looking for an appetizer and something to drink. We got seated right away......then we sat and looked at the menu. Looked for a wait staff, but no one showed up......5 more minutes still no one.......5 more minutes still no one, waited a few more minutes and left. Needless to say we are never going back. I doubt they care most of their business is from tourists.

l5BLlHVS4aWoPAcP9lu5Pw.text: This place is delicious! You get a big portion and it's very inexpensive. You can also get 3 alcohol drinks for 10 dollars. I didn't finish two of my drinks so they doubled up on my to go cup that they give you.   The customer service was also excellent and I will be going back when I visit Vegas again.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Toast, Belgian waffle &amp; etc

vN_lOfsiARYuL3o7GKoFFw.text: Here for another trip. Usually when I come to Vegas I eat here. They have 3 for 1 drinks and the food is pretty good. Unfortunately, when you have a server who does not want to be there, and you get them, it puts a damper on the whole meal. We have a table of 7 and for most servers that means a high check so good tip, but I'm not giving money away. When a server tells me that he can't provide good service and have a decent attitude because he has too many tables then it's a wrap. Unfortunately, the manager was no help either. I asked for a different server but he said that they're all busy and that it would be the same. I understand being busy, we all get busy at work, but I don't understand the sour attitude. That I won't deal with. Beware when you come here, you'll get food eventually, but getting it with a smile or any pleasantries, may be a hassle.

pHWrC0pz978ewbngNC9otQ.text: Fantastic place. Very affordable and tasty. $5 lunch menu until 5PM and 3 for $10 cocktails.  Our server (trainee, didn't get his name) was fantastic and very attentive to all of his tables. The service was prompt and food was nice and hot. Drinks are good, no skimping on the alcohol.   Definitely dropping by here again on my next trip to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Quesadilla
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old Fashioned
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger

dPUyT5-ze62ld0ii3DQOsw.text: Ocean One! My wife and I had lunch.  1st, our waiter Cristobal (two weeks employed) was very attentive and extremely nice.  We had the calamari as appetizer & it cooked to perfection.  I had the salmon and it was delicious. My wife had the Mediterranean wrap, which was very tasty.  Did I mention the price was $4.99 for each?  AND both came with sides. Great value along with wonderful customer service. What else could you ask for. Thank you Cristobal !!!

xlpESHo0qtveArVwhO2aBA.text: This place is AMAZING! We were seated within 5 minutes. We stopped in for lunch and I ordered the Mediterranean Wrap. The food was so good...cooked to perfection! The service was very good. Very attentive and friendly servers. I will definitely be returning here before my vacation is over.

5u9Dm4MDNmV9clKEnOfenQ.text: We ate here for the first time. The food was pretty good for the price. I had a chicken caesar salad. It needed more dressing and was a bit warmer than I usually find. I think it was a good value.

t5G3Ow_zUB6j1TU52DlHcw.text: Great food and great prices, $5 lunches. We ate here twice for lunch so far this week.  I would come back again for sure.  There mahi tacos are wonderful.  My husband had the shredded beef tacos and he loved them.  We also had the burger and one of their wraps. Both meals we once again great!!!   Didn't break the bank and the food was so good.

L7U6BM1P4M-j4VX390y32g.text: Food is average.  If it were not in a prime location,  it would go under.  It is all over priced for what you get. Nice decor with greasy soon dinner food.   They charged us for hot water but did not tell is that it would cost $2 a cup...for hot water!!?  Iced water is free. Serioisly, the owners need to focus on improving the overall restaraunt instead of trying to nickel and dime the customers.  I have no problem paying for something as long as I know how much it's going to cost up front. Don't try to slip in $4 for warm tap water.    Thanks for helping me narrow down my food choices in Vegas.  One more place I will not be coming back to.

aFb1ne8tbikdLpGjA6O81w.text: Came here on the recommendation of one of the locals and this is definitely a value restaurant in Las Vegas!   Lunch hours are from 11:30am to 5pm and items are $4.99.  There is quite a selection from quesadilla, tuna tartare, grilled chicken tacos, buffalo chicken wrap, grilled chicken salad and a lot more. Just bear in mind that it is only $4.99 so the portions aren't big.  The restaurant itself is modern looking with lots of tables for couples and groups. The service is friendly. The menu has an extensive list and the price point is great. They have a variety of beer, cocktails and wine and very cheap. You can get three for one wine or cocktails for $10, frozen drinks and beer for $3.  The drinks are not the crappy kind too!!  It is definitely worth coming here just for drinks !  I came here for dinner the next day and it was pretty good. The chicken Marsala was about $17. The chicken was good, but they could have done a bit better with the risotto. However, the double pork chop with mash potatoes and natural Demi-glace reduction was yummy and about $23. The portions aren't huge but it is a decent size.

qlXozWtXvKrqof8bqVj6xA.text: This place is bomb.  I got the shredded beef tacos omg so much flavor. They're amazing I deff recommend them. My bf got the chicken sandwich with bacon and he loved it we also got drinks and it was only 14bucks. Great price and great flavor. Also the servers are pretty nice. Totally recommend it.

mbM3l3MhQaD0Eya2KBYsrg.text: Tacos were absolutely delicious , cooked fresh and seasoned just right. Plenty of room for big parties with many televisions  all around the restaurants so you won't miss the game. Staff are very professional and polite. Restaurant was clean and organized, place was very busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

p86kiZkm8bUy3f6kAvq42Q.text: Not impressed. Food was just ok for the price. Waitress sucked. Was never around. Brought the wrong salad dressing and drink. No personality at all. Unfriendly staff . Not welcoming at all! Took our money and never said a word, just walked away. Wont go hack.

E9b1QVnHO9PzJrzVZIFONg.text: The food is decent but the price makes up for it. The customer service is terrible. They didn't listen and they forget two of our dishes and messed both of them up. They do have a decent amount of options to choose from but none of them amaze or shock me. There's really nothing special about this place except that it's affordable For the most part, the price makes up for the food and the customer service is awful!

RnHTVoX1Z0W3bns5CTx05A.text: BEST PRICES IN TOWN!   We met a couple from Canada that pointed us this way, which was a good thing as we were picking up tickets from the Saxe Theater in the Miracle Mile Mall we stopped at Ocean One Bar and Grille to grab lunch, everything on the menu at that time was 4.99, and $3 drinks...... AMAZING! We were seated right away, we order lollipop wings for starters and chicken penne and smoked salmon for entree... it was yummy! Food was good, service was a little shaky starting off, but Jose eventually warmed up to us and became apart of the positive Vegas experience.   The restaurant was clean and nice, the food was prepared fast  and it was really good... the prices were great, no gimmick! You should definitely check this place out!

mqYKEWjYBZWP7rtbYVMOug.text: I don't know where else in Vegas you can order anything on the menu for $4.99 and get 3 drinks for the price of one. 3 glasses of wine for $10 is pretty insane. It sounds too good to be True but it's not. I couldn't even finish my 2nd glass of wine, so our server brought me a to go cup for my 3rd glass & the remainder of my 2nd. I'm also not sure who else would be able to take down a shot of whiskey and 2 old fashioneds in one meal (also just $10!) but if you can, I will happily give you a standing ovation and watch you stumble out.   On a holiday weekend Friday, we put our name on the list & were seated in about a minute. I'm sure as word gets out about this place, that may change. Our server was patient and hustled the entire time we were dining. We selected the calamari appetizer. It was on our table in a flash, lightly breaded, flash fried, and served over a mild tomato based sauce. I went for the chicken Cesar salad, and opted for dressing on the side. It was a decent sized portion, the lettuce was fresh and the chicken was tenderly grilled. The Mr. went for the buffalo wrap and selected fries for the side. Yea, you read that right - for $4.99 you can get a buffalo wrap and your choice of fries, Cole slaw or rice & beans. The fries were fresh & crunchy. The wrap had real blue cheese in it.    I still can't believe we had an amazing meal, with 6 drinks, and fantastic people watching (you are in the miracle Mile shop corridor) for under $40.

c65ROUXw1oDfOxCdNZcrbQ.text: We came in with a party of 9 at noon on a Thursday. We were seated in less than 3mins. The service was quick, server was attentive and made great suggestions about menu items. $5 lunch special was a bonus, but it would be worth dining in at any time given the quality food and service!

CTqL-noZN-NqAUDm3E-prg.text: Have a seat and don't leave. Ask for Monica and only wonderfully good things can happen to you. You might hit the Wheel of Fortune jackpot, meet your future mate, or just have the best time eating and drinking.   One of my normal recommendations is to sit at the bar for better service, faster drinks, and fresher food. Ocean One is no different. Bombay Sapphire martini up and dirty was my first drink. Bombay Sapphire based Vesper was my second drink. Mint Moscow Mule was the third. They were all delicious and would have costed well over $36 at the Heart Bar inside Planet Hollywood. This is the best drink special I've ever had in Vegas!  As far as food, I had Ceasar salad, southwest chicken salad, calamari fritti, chicken wings, burger and fries, and grilled salmon. Everything was good and fresh. Except the burger was a bit plain, needed cheese and bacon.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. At the bar
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Southwest chicken salad

_ZnUjzOoT8rx2wkbOtuZrQ.text: This place rocks! Used to be cheap booze 3 for 1s back in the day, now it's too shelf and take em to gos. All beer $3, and the food is darn good for a $5 lunch.  So far staff has been great!  An oasis at Ocean One

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VGQx3D50PJ18OfDqowk30g.text: You cannot beat the lunch deal here.  All entries are $5.00.  I had a Applewood chicken sandwich with a full breast of chicken, Swiss cheese, tomatoes & iceberg lettuce on a fresh Berger bun, with a side of fresh spiced fries.  My partner had chicken penne and said it was good.  Both entries were generous.  Great deal!  There is a lot of menu items to chose from.  I will return.

Kf3sxf44ytXNciso0cubwQ.text: This place is for real! I had the chicken club sandwich and fries which were delicious. I also had the 3 cocktails for $10 and they didn't skimp on the liquor. The food was well presented and delicious and service was friendly. One could do a lot worse in this town.

-J7Q_HkbqMJzr5RcLQSn1A.text: I've come here twice for lunch, everything on their menu is $5.00!!! This is everyday from 11:30-5Pm. I've had the steak w/ mash potato and veggies, salmon, tuna tartare, chicken wings, mahi tacos w/ chips, and alcoholic beverage. You honestly can't beat that for $5. The alcoholic beverages are 3/10$ or else the frozen alcoholic drinks are $3 each (I specifically love the banana daiquiri mixed with mango ) they are very efficient with the seating I never had to wait more than 10 minutes. The service was also very good, we got our food quickly. I would say the presentation isn't beautiful but the food is dirt cheap so very much expected. Definitely recommend this place! I cant believe the quality of food & price!

Gyj0Q58vQgRSb-Md7uFvLA.text: Vegas is known for many things and thankfully food is one of them! So many things to choose from and an opportunity to sample many culinary delights at Oceans One in the Miracle Mile.   Met several people while getting my daily miles in on the strip. Thankfully one was able to highly recommend this restaurant when I inquired about places to eat. He mentioned daily specials, great taste and large portions. All were accurate and pleasing to the pallette!   My daughter had the ceasar salad and tacos. I had the steak with julienned vegetables and potatoes. My steak was tender and full of flavor. Veggies were not overcooked and tasted great too. I sampled the tacos and found them to be tasty. Drink prices were reasonable and had 2-4-1 specials.   The wait staff was personable and very attentive. I highly recommend this place for the lunch special of $4.99 per plate with many options. Dinner prices were reasonable, but why not dine a bit earlier and sample more? I believe lunch menu was served until @4 or 5 pm.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oceans One menu featuring meals priced at $4.99.
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taco platter included rice and beans. Yum!
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Extremely large chicken ceasar salad.

7p7-n-pI6RGjXcktKNIxgw.text: Just got back from LV and really wanted to let people know that this is a definite must visit especially if you are on a budget.  Drinks are 3 for $10 and you get to take whatever you don't drink with you.    We ate there 4 of the 6 nights we were in LV.  That is saying a lot.  The food choices were excellent.  My husband raved about the filet mignon.  My daughter loved the Margarita pizza and salmon dish.  I had the $7 burger on two nights and it was very tasty.  Had the Cobb Salad and Greek Salad two other nights.  Very fresh and just perfect portions.    Definitely will be back when we are in LV again!

DMCfhoGT8GH-DMYc-hyHxA.text: Only went here for breakfast but it was reasonably priced and sufficient serving size. I think they served breakfast until 2pm which worked with my schedule (late to Bed and late to wake up )!   I had the veggie omelet which was really good and I ordered pancakes on the side which were thin, moist and delish. I don't like really thick pancakes because it feels like I'm eating a real cake. I didn't try the coffee or lattes but everyone else in my party did and no complaints!  The wait staff was attentive and courteous. This restaurant is inside the miracle mile shopping center at Planet Hollywood    I would go back again if in the area. The prices were super reasonable and they gave me a military discount (I'm retired Military) which I always appreciate.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. From our seats outside Restaurant inside the miracle mile mall inside Planet Hollywood
Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K8Kr6NhTF2E6s7JDGy8q7w.text: The most horrible experience. We arrived at 4:45pm , upon checking in when asked the lady at the front if we would be granted the lunch special if we are not seated by 5pm. She stated yes.. while waiting to be seated the waitress asked if we woukd allow a party of 11 to go ahead of us (sure, no problem). Once seated the store manager approached us to advise they would not grant the lunch special for us.... He stated they have a system and the orders has to be in the system by 5pm... Welp, no one took our order prior to the cutoff time, just kept making promises.... Customer Service is HORRIBLE

fvNkHiH-MEgIaY8NKQ9Y-w.text: Came here for lunch, we each got the 3 for 10 drink deal....my husband got the long island, the margarita and the whiskey sour...I got the almond joy, the strawberry lemon drop,  and the paradise punch .  I loved all my drinks they had a good amount of alcohol and were easy to drink and tasted really good, my husband liked all his except for the whiskey sour.    We order the artichoke spinach dip and the filet mignon quesadilla appitzers which were both very good. Then I ordered the flank steak and my husband ordered the burger.    The food was very good, alot of flavor, the drinks were good and an awesome deal, the whole meal was a fantastic deal. All of that food and drink for 50 bucks....cant go wrong with that at all.  We will for sure be coming back here next time we are in Vegas.

MLWcaVk_8TPVViL4q3jrmQ.text: My husband and I are in Las Vegas for holiday and are staying at the Elara. We needed a place for breakfast and were recommended Ocean One Bar by the hotel staff. It is located in the Miracle Mile shops. This place was delish! I got the smoked salmon with bagel. Now, we are from New York and this dish is a New York staple so I set my expectations low since New York bagels are like nothing else. I was pleasantly surprised. The platter consisted of a bagel which was great, fresh salmon, fresh fruit salad and toppings for the bagel. The coffee was great and the service was awesome. Our waitress was attentive and friendly. This place was also priced really well for Vegas. Much lower than expected. Highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eEFwfHvllR6LmtHGTZ8sjg.text: For the price you can't beat this place the food is ok, the service was good. Drinks suck the pina colada had zero alcohol. Three people with drinks food and desert $50 can't beat the price was worth the 20 minute wait.

oQjiyMRz_bxa3t4DwuMoSg.text: We made 2 attempts to eat here. The first night, they sat us eventually. When we let the waitress know we had a show to go to, she told us they were having computer problems and we wouldn't be able to get our food for at least a half hour. I'm not sure why computer problems would delay our meal, but we decided we should go elsewhere. The next morning, we decided to give Ocean One another try. This time, they sat us right away. Then we waited and waited and no one came. After 10 minutes, we stopped a server who was passing by and asked him who our server was. he said he would check and have them come by. 5 minutes later, we still hadn't had a server come over. We got up and left. We went across the way to Oyster Bay. The cost of our steak and eggs with a $5 bloody Mary was less than it would have been at Oceans One. A;so, from where we sat, we could see a family that arrived at Oceans One at the same time we did. They just got their food as we were finishing our meal. I would only try Oceans One again, if I had a lot of time to wait.

aX9-dKO22RGQOK0FGb_V0g.text: My family and I really enjoyed this restaurant. My Garden Omelette with bacon & sausage was delicious. It was seasoned to perfection. The drink deals was an added bonus. The waiters were very friendly and informative.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8ZkRKQYYTV_AWoan2c-puw.text: Want a burger for 7 bucks?! This is your place. Want 3 drinks for 10 bucks?! This is your place. We were looking for a place to grab a quick bite and this restaurant was satisfying. I really enjoyed the burger. It was really good for 7 bucks. Also, can't complain with the alcohol being so cheap. They even let us take the drinks to go. Vegasss.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-6iGh0kjU_lHEIq3zcP25g.text: I come here at least twice when I visit for work in Vegas which is almost every weekend. Today I had the worst service everrrrrrrr okay maybe not ever but my waiter was rude asf .... Ocean one is usually very busy I get it but you don't have to rush me off once my 3/$10 drink is completed I'm still eating and I'm celebrating so I may want my next round and he rudely swiped my drink menu and left for my 3rd drink. I was in shock because it was pulled from underneath me no he wasn't trying to rough me up he just swiped it as he has many tables to service trust me I totally get that my sister was a waitress and I understand the stress and the fast pace intent when serving. Especially in Vegas things and people get a little wild but do not forget your customer service I mean I'm the one tipping remember that smh. I just feel like I was just another person to rushed off and on to the next no curtesy taken. I don't normally blast people so even though I'm through the roof upset writing this I will not disclose the gentleman's name but I will not be returning to Ocean One.

ji9Stro5Rd1SEUpehiQF2g.text: Great place! Never stepped a foot inside though, so I can't comment on an in dining experience. During a recent stay we always got our food to go and my hubby would pick it up. Everything on their menu is $3.99 when you order it online and pick it up. We first noticed this place while walking through the Miracle Mile shops shopping and saw their ad for alcoholic drinks that are 3 for $10. The Buffalo Chicken Wrap, Chicken Club Sandwich, and Spaghetti with meatballs were a favorite with my family.

OZ-bl-rpITNkqLBPUr58zA.text: I was on the waiting list at this restaurant for lunch on 1/20/19, and I realized the hostesses purposely and continuously bumped me for customers who came after me. I asked them on three different occasions why I was obviously bumped, the hostess just ignored me and kept lead other later arriving customers to the tables. One of them, on the counter, then asked me if I have another person with me, which I replied no and that she spelled my name George wrong for Georgor. She was very rude and cold, and ignored me again right after that.  I asked the other host about that too, but she kept saying just wait. By this time I see my politeness was not going any where, I asked her if I can speak to their manager. She grabbed a passing by waiter and said he is the manager.  The waiter said to us that he was not the manager as she lied, and he was decent and said he'll go to find the manager for me. That host was rude and lied to belittle me, and wanted to get rid of me.  I asked them for their names, and they refused and looked at me with the "what the f..." facial expressions. Later on I find out their names are; the counter host was Staffany, and the moving host was Ki---something.  I was a tourist, and I did not deserve to be treated like that so badly. They belittled me, humiliated me, and lied to me. All they had to do was telling me to take a hike, and I have no problems to eat at other fabulous restaurants in Vegas.   The manager did see me about this, and he was so nice and generous to seat me and provided me with a good lunch. He knew the problem I had.  I'm writing this complaint because the owners of the Ocean One Restaurant need to know their employees are treating certain customers very badly. No tourist deserve that bad feeling. How would the owners feel if they go to a restaurant and get treated badly like me?   Extra Detailed Info Date of last interaction with business: 01/20/2019      (Less) BBB Designated Category: Customer Service Issues  Case opened date: 01/29/2019  Case closed date:   Desired Resolution: Acknowledge the hosts are mistreating customers. ...     (More)

GtqkHoeHThBReJlhJJZQ6A.text: $5 Lunch and $3 daiquiris sign me up! We got the chicken & the salmon and they were tasty. Not an AMAZING meal, but I got more than expected. The service was slow our waiter was inattentive. This would've been a 4 had the service been better.

cWcJTo9FWsbhAANXv8myAA.text: 3 for 1 cocktails for 10 bucks. Need I say more??! We ate here once a few years back and the food is decent too. But 3 drinks for $10 is the real reason to come here. This is Vegas so most everything is way over priced. This is the easily best deal on the Strip.

MIyz_E2EGzKxTud05EG83w.text: This restaurant only gets knocked down one star because I did not enjoy their shrimp pasta because there was nothing extremely outstanding about it - a very simple pasta. Their eggroll appetizer was really bomb though. They made the rest of our experience here very nice with our sweet server, Evelyn. She checked up on us a lot, especially when one of my friends was getting the 3 for $10 drinks (so worth it). Also this restaurant was relatively cheap on the strip. I would definitely come back for the drinks and appetizers.

CjuiVuMDSQkrQvOpQvgGKw.text: I stopped here because it's very hard to find inexpensive food that's not something like taco bell in Las Vegas on the strip. We had lunch here. Waited for over 20 minutes for our food. Came out fairly cold when we got it, and it tasted like something I could microwave at home. I guess you get what you pay for because it was cheap. But it was also the worst meal I've ever had in Vegas.

Waitress arcane to me after 20 minutes of waiting and told me they are really busy today. Wow really? But I get my bill 2 minutes after my food came.  Food was ok, portions big and cheap, and only because of that I gave 3.

pam5J9T0tUdipFua_XbRpg.text: Depends on your priorities: cheap or flavor. If you want to just give your body calories then you are set. Otherwise just hit up a fast food joint for a guaranteed good time.

c6uqVUMjcWwfFq4iEDE_gw.text: This is a great place for breakfast or lunch if you are on a budget. For lunch it's $4.99 and breakfast varies. The portion sizes are pretty small but fine for the price. However it is quite basic, I definitely could make some of this my self. I'd recommend the Biscuits and Gravy. Free refills for fountain drinks. I'd go again, if it wasn't a special occasion

Uo-YdjnR1H3pSM-ljLSM2w.text: This place is actually a gem. The food is pretty good and at a very inexpensive price. It is a pretty casual place and we were able to catch the game there. It's a great place to nurse a hang over and to pick up more drinks. If you are on a budget, they have a deal where there you can get 3 drinks for $10.

B6JmnC5_dJBjDIPEoHjmPQ.text: Went here to olay poker at Planet Hollywood. I oassed by and saw the lunch menu where everything was $5. I had to ask to make sure, and it was (only weekedays from 11:00 -3:00. I was thingking the quality would be degraded cause salmon was on the menu. I ordered the Island Salmon Salad and was already thinking it would not be that good, but i was wrong. Not only was it good, it was a good portion. I would have given them 5 stars, but they cut the salmon wrong.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mvnStPb3wA544aoElFk7pQ.text: Working at Cosmopolitan Casino, getting breakfast and lunch at one of my favorite places, Ocean's Bar and Grille has almost been a daily routine.   A few days ago, my coworker ordered online. She and I begin walking to Oceans. My card didn't work. So my coworker tries with her card. Again the message reads, system is not processing order. The bar manger who is useless; she had the worst customer service, she didn't have one contact number or any way to help, instead giving us attitude and not one hope for a solution. She also said this has only happened to us. As we walked to another venue - we met up with people who just went through the same thing. A few hours in the afternoon- we get messages that BOTH OF IUR CARDS WERE CHARGED! We check out accounts and sure enough our money is gone.   We have been calling and without any response. Someone help us!

Lx2JYbbXO0FuBhR47KUJew.text: $4.99 isn't bad for lunch in Vegas, is it?  I mean, if you're not buffet bingeing, a $4.99 burger, let's say, made quickly and easily and served within the Miracle Mile Mall can't be that bad.  Can it?  Because if you'd just lower your expectations a bit and understand that for a measly $4.99 you should in no way get your hopes up, you'd be golden, stopping in for a bite during Ocean One's $4.99 lunch special.  And that must have been the problem: we expected a little too much from Ocean One.  Although the pictures we took speak for themselves--depicting a rather sad looking burger and a very dry chicken--the service wouldn't prove to be any better.  Ours, Rufat, saw our table only three times: once to take our order, a second time (when after I'd called him over) to return with my corrected order, and a third time to drop off the bill.  Truthfully, we'd wished we had just purchased a less than mediocre lunch elsewhere.  After all, Vegas has more than enough to offer.  Besides, a $2.99 soda, when added to the bill, alters that "deal" you had imagined receiving.  Your meal now: $8.00.  That's quite slippery of you, Ocean One.  Nice work!  We won't be seeing you again.

Photo of Ocean One Bar and Grille - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A VERY dry $4.99 lunch special.

ip0D3K6PmBfbTps3LUacLA.text: Came to Ocean One after some shopping, it advertised 4.99 lunch menu. I ordered the Max "lolli pop" wings and my friend the Sante Fe Tacos.  My wings are delicious,  had a nice smokey taste if that makes sense.  I was a little bummed out i couldnt add fries but the order of wings actually filled me up. My friend said the Sante Fe tacos were good ass well, 3 came in the order with fries...i will definitely be back for more wings
